Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: Bustermaderrycity
Reviews.Content: Brillant stay at a cracking hotel...gret facilities and loads of quirky features that really impressed...roof top pool was soo good and the breakfast was fantastic. Only downside was no bar area to have a little drink...but a great hotel in a great location

Reviews.Title: “Terrace room worth the money”
Reviews.Author: TheFrasiers
Reviews.Content: In April, my husband and I stayed three nights at the Soho Hotel. We found the hotel based upon the tripadvisor reviews and were not disappointed. We opted for the terrace room, since most of the European hotels we've stayed in were very small. The room was very large and the terrace was bigger than expected. The location of the hotel was perfect-- close to the Aerobus stop, the Metro stop, and all of the main attractions. Service in the hotel was great-- gave helpful suggestions for transportation and areas to avoid at night. Only complaint was that the bathroom was oddly arranged, but this would not change my opinion of the hotel. I thought the lighting was dark in the room, but my husband did not have a problem with it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay!”
Reviews.Author: dmejias
Reviews.Content: We had the perfect stay at this hotel during our 3 day stay in Barcelona. The hotel is centrally located within walking distance of Plaza de Catalunya and Las Ramblas. There is a metro station almost in front of the hotel that conects with the major metro stops. This ia very modern hotel ideal for couples, friends or business. Not a kid oriented or friendly hotel due to the decor and areas. The rooms are very modern and spacious with automatic dimming lights, glass integrated curtains, flat tv, and stainless steel entry doors. Wifi is free and accessible throughout the hotel but there are areas were the signal is poor. Staff is very friendly and willing to help in all matters. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Love This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: peggysuevancouver
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights Mar 31 to Apr 2 arriving from Vancouver two days before a cruise. The shuttle bus T1 from the airport is 5.30 each and stops a block and across the street from the Hotel at the second stop. Urgell is the name of the Metro and the Bus Stop so an important name to remember to get back to the Hotel. Front desk staff are very nice and speak English. We were given room 75 which is a terrace room on the front. We could not have asked for a better place to stay, very safe, very clean and in a good location within walking distance to most attractions. If you want plush carpets and cozy this is not the place for you as it is very sleek and modern. We had breakfast across the street both days at the most wonderful bakery where artists make designer baked goods. Coffee and pastry for two 8 to 10 euros. Next door is a restaurant Guidos where locals eat - also excellent and very reasonable. Lots of restaurants and bars in the area. We never felt unsafe in Barcelona even though we had heard so much about pickpockets. Wonderful place.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: mike22207
Reviews.Content: In March 2012, I booked a week stay at the Hotel Soho for my first trip to Barcelona. I found the website easy to use and the reservation process simple. I booked a terrace room on the 7th floor and found it to be very clean, modern and spacious. Even better was the top notch and attentive staff, always with a smile and suggestion as to restaurants and points of interest. A special thank you to Leo and Jonas for all their kindness. I would not hesitate to stay here again, as I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Andrew F
Reviews.Content: Everything I was going to say has already been said. This is a superb hotel. Great location, great value, twenty minutes on aerobus (cheap at 5.30 euros) to a stop 150 metres to the front door. Metro station virtually right outside. Top end of La Rambla less than ten minutes walk. Lighting and venetian blind gadgets look a little scary to a fifty plus oldie like me but are easy to work out. We had our twelve year old daughter with us so they upgraded us to accomodate the fold up bed. Staff were fantastic. Alessio and Daniella were the only ones on duty during our stay and they were so helpful. Easily the friendlest most informative multi lingual hotel staff we have ever encountered. Hotel was spotlessly clean and breakfast was good. Could write an essay but will cut it short and say "just book it"

Reviews.Title: “Modern, comfortable, excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: vesnaileto
Reviews.Content: I was debating with myself if I should stay in "old charm" or modern place while in Barcelona. I picked modern and did not regret. The 5 euro (at the moment) bus takes you from the airport to the stop practically across the hotel. Second stop, "Urgel", if you need to know details. Subway stop is 1 min walk from the hotel door! I liked "Scandinavian" style of the rooms and lobby. I did not find light odd: you place your room key in to the pocket by the door and it's on, the way you set it up... Windows do open. Bathroom style is unusual and cute. You can take bath not just shower. Towels good quality. Bed: the mattress is on the firmer side. Linens are soft. Breakfast was a good value with variety of styles (eggs, potatoes, bacon, fruit, cold cuts, milk products, breads and sweets). Staff is multi-lingual and VERY helpful: make reservations, advising on where to..., just chat about local life. Wi-fi was always on. It was kinda cold, so pool on the roof was left unchecked. Next time!

Reviews.Title: “Trendy hotel, fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: ANCBeachGirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 5 night stay at Hotel Soho and we had a fantastic time. Let me begin by saying that the main reason to stay at this hotel is the staff. Everyone is so incredibly helpful and friendly and our trip wouldn't have been the same without their daily assistance. Daniela, Jonas, Leo and Alessio all provided very helpful suggestions from sight seeing tips and metro instructions/directions to restaurant recommendations and cultural commentary. You are in great hands with the staff at Hotel Soho. The hotel is located on the Gran Via - a busy, but mostly quite main street - across from the Urgell metro stop and about a 10 minute walk from Placa Catalunya and The Ramblas. The location is great - it's away from the super-touristy areas, but still close enough to everything to be convenient. The hotel is very contemporary with interesting architectural and design details at every turn. We stayed in an Urban room overlooking the park behind the hotel and were very pleased with the space and amentities. The bed was a little harder than I am used to, but the pillows were very comfortable making for an overall positive sleeping experience. I also liked the lighting system, the electric shades and the ability to open various window panels for fresh air. The water pressure in the shower was great and the separate toilet room was another good feature. Our room and the hotel in general are very clean and well maintained. Our toilettries were replentished when needed and we could choose to reuse our towels or get new ones based on where we placed them each day. We decided to have breakfast at the hotel during our stay and it was completely satisfactory. The selection included eggs, breakfast meats, cold cuts, cheeses, fruit, muffins, pastries, toast, cereal, and yogurt. The coffee is Nespresso, which we also enjoyed. And since this was our vacation, we appreciated that the service continued until 10:30am. The breakfast server was very friendly and accommodating and she remembered our coffee preferences by the second day. We also greatly enjoyed the rooftop pool area. Although the temperature during our stay was only in the 60s, the sun was very warm. We were able to sit out on several afternoons after our sightseeing excursions. The pool was a bit chilly however. The business center is convenient with two computers, a TV and sitting area. There's also a coffee machine, but the coffee is 1 euro - it would have been nice to have complimentary coffee considering the cost of the stay. One of my only complaints. As for general Barcelona tips: - We utilized the metro a great deal. It is very cost efficient (get the T-10 ticket for about 9 euro)and super easy to figure out once you become familiar with the lines and directions in which to travel. The Urgell metro stop is literally out the front door of the hotel. We also walked a great deal, but it was nice to be able to hop on the metro when we'd had enough walking. - The tourist information booths are super helpful. If you plan to go to Monserrat, go straight to the one on Placa Espanya and you can get the necessary tickets there before catching the train. - Daniela recommended Teresa Carles restaurant near Placa Catalunya and it was my favorite meal while in Barcelona. It is a vegetarian restaurant, but the food is phenomenal. The owners are a local Catalunyan family and they have a farm just outside the city where they grow all of their own produce that they serve in the restaurant. We had delicious assortment of croquettes, an awesome pumpkin and leek soup, my husband got a mushroom spinach risotto with shaved parmesan, and I had an amazing eggplant parmesan type dish with mushrooms, a delicious tomato sauce and cheese melted on top. Check it out!

Reviews.Title: “Great visit to SOHO hotel”
Reviews.Author: CazzySmith
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a long weekend in Barcelona where stayed at the SOHO Hotel. Very nice hotel, with friendly and very helpful staff. Room was very clean and although small more than suitable as a base. Yes the lighting is a bit odd but we found it strangely restful. Breakfast was good with a great deal of choice. We stayed on the 2nd floor at the front of the building and yes you can faintly hear the traffic but it never stopped my husband and I going to sleep or ever woke us. The hotel is situated just outside the busy areas but only 10 minutes walk away from the very heart of the city. If you are coming from the airport on the aerobus you will need the A2 and get off at the University. We had a lovely time and would go back tomorrow if we could.

Reviews.Title: “Very cool hotel in centre of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: RupertM
Reviews.Content: Very high-tech, modern, designed. Spacious rooms, quiet at night (even tho on Gran Via). No complaints at all

Reviews.Title: “Designs on cool, good enough”
Reviews.Author: Funky_travel_junky
Reviews.Content: Decent location for Urgell metro & a few mins walk from the Passeig de Gracia. Room was pretty small & dark, the bed took up most of the room & the glass wall between the bedroom & the bathroom was a bit strange. Pool was tiny but nice to paddle in after walking for miles in July. Absolutely fine for the money in a central location & another identikit boutique hotel perfect pitched towards the flashpacking budget airline weekend brigade but the quest for the default Barcelona hotel room goes on.

Reviews.Title: “Ultra modern”
Reviews.Author: Lu C
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Hotel Soho for 10 days for business in Feb/Mar 2012. I agree with other reviewers, the staff were absolutely excellent. Friendly and fantastic recommendations -- very helpful. The breakfast was great value and the hotel was very clean, modern and new. My room had a bath -- clean and perfect for relaxing after a long day at work. The location was good -- walk straight into Las Ramblas or the market in 20 minutes or across to the Fira Palace in 10-15 minutes. There were some small cons worth considering. My street facing room could be considered noisy by most, however as I live in London I am used to street noise. The room lighting is very modern, which is interesting and cool but not very practical for putting on make up. If you can, bring along a little lamp or light, or a portable mirror to apply your make up closer to the windows. I would also advise simply hailing a cab from outisde the hotel. There are so many cabs that drive past and it costs an extra 10euros to book a car. I would definitely stay here again, for pleasure or for business.

Reviews.Title: “Good location & staff”
Reviews.Author: JuhaTraveller
Reviews.Content: Had a 4 night stay in this hotel. Staff in the front desk very helpful and have good tips about nearby attractions. Room was good size and cleaned daily. Even our room located on the busy street Gran Via side, we got good night sleep (5th floor). They also have small pool at the topfloor terrace but not heated so we didn´t tested it.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here”
Reviews.Author: Got2
Reviews.Content: Great in every way. Location is tops as is the staff. Lighting a bit funky but did not make a difference in our opinion. I'd highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Everything perfect !”
Reviews.Author: Ikerne2211
Reviews.Content: The Soho Hotel is the perfect place to be during your stay in Barcelona ! It is very well located, just 5 minutes away from Plaza Cataluña y las Ramblas. The rooms are modern and the ones with the Balcony, should say the big terrace on the street "Gran Vía" are gorgeous and with free WIFI. The lounge and the swimming pool at the top are a must see, a wonderful place to have a nice "aperitif" after an intense day. Most importantly the staff is very friendly ad helpfull. they know all the best places to go in town ! So I do recommend this Hotel, you won't be disappointed !

Reviews.Title: “Great location and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie L
Reviews.Content: We have recently returned from a very enjoyable stay at the Soho Hotel. The room was very stylish and comfortable with plenty of space and kept impeccably clean throughout. We had one of the rooms with its own private balcony, which is well worth the extra money. It had great views and was very relaxing to sit out in the sunshine after a busy day of sightseeing. The location was perfect as lots of places to eat nearby and close enough to walk to the ramblas, without being too touristy. It was also right next to Urgell metro station which was ideal if you wandered too far during the day and wanted to save your legs on the way back! The staff were very friendly and offered plenty of advice on places to eat and visit. The Breakfast was mostly continental, which was fine for us, but perhaps not great for those who prefer a cooked breakfast. Would definitely stay here again if returning to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible staff”
Reviews.Author: paulunterman
Reviews.Content: People talk about the hotels convenient location and amenities. It was the helpful staff that made this hotel memorable for me.

Reviews.Title: “impeccable service, great location and impressive room!”
Reviews.Author: 289JESS20
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I had a fantastic stay at the Soho hotel. We wanted a modern hotel and were both very impressed when we arrived. We stayed in the terrace room which is well worth the extra money and if I'm being completely honest, the pictures don't do this hotel justice. We found the staff amazingly helpful, they helped us with everything from metro routes to storing our bags for us on the last day. Give your staff a raise! :) Also for any one wondering or worrying like I do, it will be between 30-40 euros in a taxi from the airport. Overall I would definately go back to the hotel, we had such a great stay! Thankyou, Jess and James.

Reviews.Title: “Central, modern, but a bit run down, considering it's almost new”
Reviews.Author: cla114
Reviews.Content: I was there last week, and it was the second time I've been in this hotel. The hotel is very central, in one of the best areas of Barcelona, close to everything but at the same time not in the middle of the chaos of the ramblas. So the location is very nice, around there you can find plenty of restaurants for dining out, and in 10 mins walking distance you are in the heart of the ramblas and of the old town. Service was very efficient, and the price I paid was absolutely low even for the very low standards of Barcelona these days. The rooms are very modern, essential but designed well by good architects. It has to be said that this is not unusual in Spain, there are now several chains of hotels which are have design rooms even if they are 2 or 3 stars, the difference with hotels in, say, France or UK, is huge in this respect. Breakfast was good, efficient (self service so you don't need to wait for waiters), with lots of food of all types, and most importantly, cheap at 10 euros (some hotels make you pay 25 these days!). However, and here I come to the negatives, this hotel has been left to its own since when it was built, and you can see that by seeing some details which are a bit run down (curtains, or chipped furniture, etc.), but most important, in the whole hotel there was this horrible smell of wet carpeting, which is really annoying for a modern hotel. Both in the room and in the corridors this smell really ruined the experience, I think it should not be too expensive to give it a good cleanup and perfume all the areas of the hotel, no? I think this whole feeling of run down, that musty smell, will not make me go there again, also considering that N&N, the same hotel chain, has other better hotels in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy, Clean and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Leila G
Reviews.Content: I visited Soho Hotel for the NYE weekend - we were really pleased that we picked Soho Hotel. The staff were helpful and friendly, and the hotel was modern, clean and very well presented. The location was excellent too - we could walk to Las Ramblas in 5-10 minutes. We preferred this to staying on Las Ramblas itself given that it is so touristy/bustly. The only downside to Hotel Soho is that the rooms are somewhat small, and the lighting (although very tastful) was not the best (it was dark in some areas and there were lots of shadows because of the spot lights). Otherwise, I would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to stay in a trendy hotel in a central location!

Reviews.Title: “A little disappointing”
Reviews.Author: ItchyFeetVienna
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four days and were a little disappointed after having read all of the good reviews beforehand. The only good thing we found was that the hotel is in a good location, close to the metro and slightly way from the crowds. Our first impression of the hotel was that is was very dark, and the rooms seemed very damp dark and smelly. The rooms have a very poor ventilation system and as a result they smelt damp. The bathrooms were in desperate need of a good clean. Its really not nice to have a bathroom with green mould build up around the tub and shower. We found the hotel very gloomy, despite the tricks with the ‘hot’ light it was otherwise a very dark room. Maybe its modern to paint the walls black but we didn’t find it that inviting. We were situated in one of the rooms towards the park though the windows were not so sound proof and so we could hear the children underneath playing in the mornings. Which isn’t a big deal, but its not great for a romantic getaway to be awoken by screaming kids. We asked to move but were advised that the alternative would be to have the rooms on the street side and then we would have the noise from the traffic on the main road. We had the breakfast once, it’s a little expensive but very good. We found a cheaper alternative to go to some of the local restaurants in the area which also served great quality local food at half the price of the hotel breakfast. All in all we would not go back to the hotel and really cant understand all of the good ratings about the place.

Reviews.Title: “Our Barcelona home!”
Reviews.Author: RickB123
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just spent 9 days at the Soho. The experience was amazing. It was like living in a high-end, stylish condo with three of the best concierges you could ever want. We had a very large room with a huge terrace overlooking Gran Via so the location was very handy - 10 min walk to La Rambla, Placa d'Espagna. If you want a busy lobby scene and a jumping hotel bar, this hotel is not for you. If you want quiet sophisticated surroundings and outstanding personal service, Soho is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel in a central location”
Reviews.Author: Littlemops
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very centrally located and only a couple of blocks from an airport shuttle bus stop, so be sure to save yourself 20+ euros and take the shuttle, which will cost you much less. We were able to walk to most places from the Soho hotel including La Rambla, Passig de Cracia and there's a metro stop very close by. This hotel really suited our tastes and was great for the budget. The room was a bit small, but more than adequate for us. The decor is very modern and comfortable and the bathroom had all the amenities you need. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. I would definitely recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Fashionable and friendly”
Reviews.Author: Jane B
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our honeymoon and booked through Expedia after choosing the hotel based on reviews and photos. We were not disappointed in the slightest and were delighted to be upgraded to a large room by the very friendly receptionist who congratulated us on our nuptials! The staff were knowledgeable and always happy to advise and the room was clean and spacious with a great bath. The location was ideal and we walked everywhere - plus it's very close to a metro station so very easy to access from the airport. The pool area was lovely - would be great to go in the spring/summer and make use of the water and loungers. We didn't opt for breakfast but there are plenty of cafes just a few metres away. All in all a great hotel and we would definitely go back :)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent all rounder”
Reviews.Author: J0y0us
Reviews.Content: We choose this hotel because of the tripadvisor reviews and also we got a reasonable deal. We were there for 2 nights at the beginning of February. Breakfast was buffet style with a wide variety of rolls, jams, cheeses, meats etc, plus egg and bacon, yogurts, fresh fruit etc - all very nice and fresh. The room was clean and modern. Unfortunately, I think the bathrooms have been designed by a man as the lighting was dreadful - so dark it was impossible to put on makeup in the morning. We were there when the weather was around 2 degrees so were a little worried when we saw there was only a sheet on the bed - fortunately there was a blanket in the cupboard and surprisingly we were perfectly warm enough over night. There's a great little pool and sun terrace on the roof and, had the weather been warm, it would have been a lovely place to relax in the sun for a few hours or have a evening drink before dinner. If you like walking the hotel is in an ideal position for all the sights. Nothing was more than about 20 minutes away - in fact we visited most of the main attractions and didn't take the metro or taxi once. It's easy to get to the hotel from the airport - just get the A2 and it's the second stop. The stop is just a couple of minutes away - couldn't be easier. The staff at the hotel were very helpful especially the guy that checked us in who recommended a great tapas restaurant for our first lunch. We used tripadvisor to help us choose where to eat and we certainly were not disappointed. We really recommend Restaurant Etapes - here you can get a really wonderful lunch for Euro 15.50 for 3 courses! We also tried Osmosis who have a 3-course lunch menu for Euro 25 during the week but at the weekend it rises to Euro 45 and becomes a tasting menu - a little bit pretentious and not too welcoming staff but good food.. Altogether we had a fantastic break and would certainly return to Barcelona and stay at the Soho again.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy design hotel”
Reviews.Author: DD_on_a_trip
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 days at the Soyo Hotel during our 5th Wedding Anniversary trip to Barcelona at the end of January 2012. We choose the hotel because of it's trendy looks and good location close -but not too close- to the action. It's easy to travel from and to the airport (we took the Aerobus which stops on the Gran Via - return ticket 9,15€ per person) Getting places is easy: the nearest metro station is Urgell (almost right outside the door) but you can just walk to Plaza Catalunya (10-15mins) which is the starting point of la Rambla. Breakfast room is nice and trendy as well, although a bit chilly during our winter stay. Choices were good enough for us, with meat, eggs, potatoes, croissants, etc. Big bonus is the free wifi access in the hotel. If you didn't bring any internet phone or laptop you can still use the free internet access on the pcs in the multimedia room in the basement. Our main luggage was lost and delivered a day late, but the hotel took care of the handling when it was finally delivered: they kept it in a safe storage until we returned from our day trip, and also on our last day they stored it for a few extra hours after checkout free of charge so we could have one last goodbye visit to Barcelona while waiting for our flight back home. The hotel staff was great: our room's towels were changed and beds were made up every day, and the reception staff was eager to help with advice and recommendations for restaurants etc... Minor issue: we had a room on the lowest floor on the street side where the traffic outside is very obvious. Took us a day or two to get used to this, so if you're a light sleeper you might request a room located in the center or back of the building. We were offered to move to a quieter room but we liked the brighter outside views and activity of the front room so we stayed and didn't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: dixiefish61
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Soho hotel for 5 nights and have just returned. I chose the hotel based on other Trip Advisor reviews as neither my wife or I had ever been to the city before. The hotel is well placed for all main attractions such as La Rambla, the Marina, Olympic Park and the Joan Miro foundation. The hotel is right next to the Urgell metro station but if you are travelling in from the airport, take the Aerobus as it stops 1 minute walk from the hotel and is great value at €5,30. The hotel was opened in 2006 and so is still in top condition. The rooms are very contemporary with a modern feel. Note that there is no facility to make tea/coffee in the rooms but the are vendors within 30 seconds of the hotel all selling drinks to take away. There also is no hotel bar but we didn't miss this at all as there are so many in the area. The breakfast available is served buffet style and offers hot and cold food, fruit, cakes as well as more traditional fare. We were on the 4th floor at the front and although we could hear the traffic it was never a problem. There was another couple who changed rooms as they strggled with noise so it might be worth asking for a room at the back of the hotel if you like complete silence. The staff were really helpful and recommended some great places to eat and offered advice on travelling around the city etc... This is a really nice hotel in a great location and you would be hard pushed to better for value and accessability.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Kim_8000
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel is not in the heart of the live area of Barcelona (a good 20 minutes walk to Plaza Cataluna - Las Ramblas - Passeig de Gracia), the hotel has a good value for money: - cosy, nice design, very clean - room quite big (ours was "Urban"), very good bed - breakfast more than ok (salty warm stuffs, cold stuffs, sweet stuffs, fresh fruits, Nespresso coffea...) - metro just outside - easy access fro airport - very friendly and helpful staff (thanks to Alessio and Leo for their recommendations)

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stina1978
Reviews.Content: Soho was one of the hotels I've shortlisted for a Barcelona stay and while it wasn't actually me who decided to finally choose it, I am very happy the we stayed there. The only minor flaw I can mention is that it took about 5 minutes for a receptionist to "notice us" at check-in. I mean literally, we stand there waiting while he was busy answering every possible phone call, calling somewhere himself, shifting the papers and stuff like that... We had an 'urban' room which apparently you can only book through the hotel website. It was quite big, with a little couch near the window (backyard view). Despite what other reviewers said, we didn't find the room to be any dark, perhaps that can depend on the weather. It was sunny while we were staying in Barcelona, so once you've opened the blinds the sun really filled the whole room. I'd recommend to book the Terrace room if the weather is really nice, its not so much of a price difference (at least it wasn't for our dates) but I expect it should be really good. The lighting design is quite nice too and in general the hotel is very modern, but still cozy. But it did surprise me that you still have to use the actual key to enter the room, the plastic card is for lights only. Other thing that put me off a little was the wardrobe, which is not really a wardrobe but a curtain in the corner with a few shelves and a coat rack. Part of the design I guess :) The metro station is literally just outside the hotel, somehow it seemed to be far from what was shown in the map. The hotel itself is about 10-15 minutes walk from Plaza Catalunya, which IMHO is just a little bit far from what I'd like it to be. The free wi-fi is a nice feature, but you need to keep logging on every 5 minutes if you are not using your device non-stop.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel & location”
Reviews.Author: AllyEwen
Reviews.Content: Getting from the airport to the hotel could not be easier, the final metro stop is literally 20 yards from the hotel. Very contemporary hotel with friendly staff at reception and a great rooftop terrace to sit and relax. Rooms are very adequate in size, modern and clean and no noise experienced from the traffic outside, had a great nights sleep. Opportunities for the hotel - lighting is dark in the rooms & would be great if there was a bar both in the hotel and on the rooftop which was open on an evening. Overall a great hotel, within 10 minutes walk from the city centre, would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Stay here!”
Reviews.Author: bobby_bat
Reviews.Content: This place is set on Gran Via, pretty close to Plaza Catalunya, Passeig de Gracia and Las Ramblas....without being "too close" to Las Rablas! The rooms can get a little noisy...but that's fairly typical of staying in big European cities. Get used to wearing earplugs and you'll be fine anywhere! Hotel Soho is well worth it and great value for money. I paid a little extra and stayed in the room with a private terrace and very glad I did. The room and terrace area are spaxcious and well appointed. It is a little "designery" as other reviews have noted, but it's well located, safe and close to everything without being too touristy.

Reviews.Title: “All you could ask for and more...”
Reviews.Author: freddocat
Reviews.Content: It's difficult to find a good value hotel in Barcelona in a good location but this is one hotel I'll be coming back to!!! First of all, it's in a convenient location only minutes from La Rambla but luckily not in the heart of it which makes for a quiet sleep... The room we had was at the back of the building (facing a park), had a sensational shower and very comfy bed. Design wize, the hotel is clever and modern without being over the top. You feel like you're staying somewhere special but very homely. It's a perfect balance between style and familiarity. Finally I'd like to commend the staff for being both helpful and friendly at all times.

Reviews.Title: “Dont think twice”
Reviews.Author: avi10
Reviews.Content: I landed only this morning and I promised to write a recommendation on this hotel. This is are third visit to Barcelona but the first time I recommend a hotel in the city. Not sure why the hotel rated only three stars I think he should be at least four stars plus. Very centrally located, ten minutes walk from Plaza Catalunya and the Ramblas and within fifteen minutes walk from Plaza Hispania. The team was welcoming, there were happy to help us and answer any questions. they also gave us great tips on tourist attractions and good restaurants. It is strongly recommended to upgrade to the terrace room and enjoy the large privete sun terrace & larger room. All rooms have a safe, hairdryer, plasma TV, telephone, advanced lighting system and free WIFI. Rich buffet breakfast with a wide variety of fresh fruits, cheeses, sausages, pastries, breads, spreads, cereals, eggs, fresh juices and excellent espresso. The hotel is designed in warm modern style with alot of thoughts of the little details. The hotel is very romantic and best suited for couples. Please note that bathroom is transparent - very special but not for everyone. but there is a complete privacy in the toilet. Wonderful value for your money. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Well placed and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Fankleman
Reviews.Content: Very helpful staff and the room was comfortable. Yes, the lighting is a bit too "designery" but it's better than stark and too bright. Eventually found the button to control the blind to the bathroom (it's to the right of the wash hand basin in the bathroom. Perhaps more information on how to control the lighting would help. It is however, refreshing to have a modern interior rather than a faux period one and we'd happily go back again, though a room to the rear would be preferred.

Reviews.Title: “Just right for first timers to Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: JeanPierreKim
Reviews.Content: Agree completely with Mothersap. Stayed for three nights. Room was spacious enough for two. Slept well. Internet worked perfectly. Location is just right. Front staff helpful - our daily contact was Alessio. As for the lighting, it is quite oddly designed - we were told the hotel has a 5 year contract with the architect so they can't change it, but have already tried to bring some extra lighting as improvement. But the safe area is still too dark. As we opted for the main street view, we got plenty of natural light during the day (and double glazing keeps most of the noise out).Coffee making in the room would be good, but 10 seconds left and right of the hotel are plenty of decent coffee shops who offer a coffee and snack for under 2 Eu - who needs Starbucks!! Yes, it has an almost industrial design feel to it, but it's clean and comfortable. Having slept in some "charming" period accommodation with dreadful furniture, impractical layouts, equally awful lighting, and overpriced service and facilities, this was an effortless experience.

Reviews.Title: “SOHO --- oh so NO !”
Reviews.Author: SoEndBear
Reviews.Content: I almost hate to write this review because so many seem to have thought this place was wonderful. Yes, the location was excellent and the service was good but my God the room was reminiscent of a sensory deprivation chamber -- dark-dark-dark with absurd lighting arrangements that masqueraded as high design features ....The breakfast room too was so dark and dimly lit you might as well have been eating at 4 not 8 in the morning. To illustrate this point I overheard the following conversation among fellow guests: " Why did you move to another table ?" "Because I´d like to be able to see what I´m eating !!!" ...... The SOHO certainly tries for cutting edge design but sadly their pursuit of it leaves common sense elements of comfort in the dust ..... I just couldn´t stay here again or recommend it to friends or family ......

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chickee12
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent five days in Barcelona and chose this hotel based on other reviews. I would say the property is lovely and the location is perfect. Very close to the metro station, and If you decide to take the bus from the airport to the hotel it is very easy and economical too. My ONLY gripe with the Soho Hotel was the showers (no shower door or curtain) this means water all over the bathroom floor and I really think the lighting was a bit dim. I loved the soft "hot light" effect, however when trying to put on makeup and contact lenses... you (I) need/require more light. The breakfast was good. Nothing spectacular,but sufficent enough and with a variety of fresh fruit, yogurts, cereal and toast. We purchased the breakfast plan and were fine with the decision. The front desk staff offered exemplary service, two individuals in particular were Daniela and Jonas. Both were very accomodating and made excellent suggestions on various points in Barcelona. The owners/managers should be proud of their staff. These two went out of their way to help. In closing: Would I stay at the Soho hotel again? Yes Was it worth the money? Yes Is the hotel spotless and with a sophisticated staff? Yes!

Reviews.Title: “We lucked out”
Reviews.Author: NYJanet
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to spend an extra day in Barcelona. Our reservation was for the Jazz Hotel (the sister hotel) but they didn't have any availability for our extra day. They hooked us up with the Soho Hotel and we were able to get a reservation there. Location: It was pretty good, but if you want to be close to the Ramblas, you should stay at the Jazz Hotel Staff: Super helpful and friendly Hotel Room: Spacious, modern and clean. Loved it! Price: Incredible for what you get. I'm glad we stumbled upon this hotel and although I'd say the Jazz Hotel is a little better for tourists (because of its location), I'd still high recommend the Soho.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, Low Cost Hotel - Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: Naomi C
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Soho for 8 nights in Nov/December 2011. We have nothing but nice things to say about the hotel and it's employees. On our first night we were upgraded to one of the loveliest rooms my husband and I had ever stayed in - and when we saw our regular room we were happily surprised to realise that the quality and services were exactly the same - just minus the fancy terrace! Two staff in particular were fantastic - Daniella and Alessio. Both were happy to speak English (next time we will come back with a bit more Spanish!) cheerful and forthcoming with recommendations and advice on where to eat and how to get about. We managed to see many of the sights on foot, as many of the Gaudi buildings, the Gothic Quarter and the beach were within walking distance (if you have decent shoes and the will!). We had breakfast at the hotel one morning - it was plentiful and fresh. We will definitely go back and will recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Clean modern hotel in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: christyreznor02
Reviews.Content: Good location. Very modern looking hotel. Close to metro and bus stops. Close to restaurants and a couple of small grocery stores. Comfortable beds. Friendly staff. Very helpful. Would definitely stay again. Tip: Take the Aerobus from the airport. This is a very efficient service. It takes 20-30 minutes. The price is 5.30 Euro or you can get a roundtrip ticket if you are staying less than 9 days for a discounted price. The bus stops at Gran Via & Urgell Street, which is very close to the hotel. This is much easier than lugging your suitcase on the metro.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, clean, great location”
Reviews.Author: KPEOzzie
Reviews.Content: very modern clean and in great location. 10 mins walk to la rambler which has great restaurants. Comfy bed. Don't get the hotel breakfast, save money and eat at one of the cafes near by for much less. The flamenco show we booked through the hotel is a must. was awesome. Don't bother getting dinner show package, eat somewhere on la rambler before the show.

Reviews.Title: “The place to be!”
Reviews.Author: GM_ComfortBoersparke
Reviews.Content: Soho hotel Barcelona has been my destination three years in a row. That says a lot, because there are a lot of nice hotels in Barcelona. But if it works, why fix it? The hotel has great rooms (actually worth the money to buy an upgrade), clean and modern. If you like the american style, Marriott og Hilton its not for you, but if you like something that feels luxurious and till trendy, this is the place to be!. The breakfast is good, but I prefer Starbuck down the street anyways. Location is perfect, ideally located a mere five minutes from La Rambla, but far enough to avoid salespeople og pickpocket performers. The calm rooftop terrace is a city dream! Order up food and you never have to go to the beach. The service is excellent, discreet and professional. We are definetly coming back for a fourth time!

Reviews.Title: “Careless service, not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: gmpurple
Reviews.Content: We had to wait an hour and a half past check in time upon arrival. The rooms are supposed to look modern, but they were more industrial and bare (lack of light fixtures). The hotel website says their rooms are soundproof. Our room was the opposite of sound proof. We could hear traffic outside as if windows were open, conversations in other rooms, people walking around in rooms above us, and doors opening and closing constantly. Our toilet ran and refilled about once every minute or so. We reported this to the front desk in the morning and they said maintenance would fix it. 6 hours later we returned and maintenance did not know about the problem. They came and repaired the toilet so it wouldn't run, then left. We used the toilet and it started pouring water non-stop. We called maintenance back and the man had us talk to the front desk who told us "you're flushing wrong". We had to flush at least 8 times to get the toilet clear. The staff at this hotel were polite, but had no concern for making our stay comfortable. There were barely any shampoos and soaps given and they weren't replenished by housekeeping. Also, their website advertises a bar but hotel staff told us there wasn't one. This hotel gives the impression it's a nice hotel, but it was not an enjoyable stay for us.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at the SOHO”
Reviews.Author: BobandDave1
Reviews.Content: This modern facility, in an excellent location, with a friendly staff, was truly wonderful. We loved Barcelona, and the welcoming SOHO as our home while there was a treat. The reception staff spoke excellent English and was both friendly and helpful. Whether suggesting sites to visit, recommending restaurants and making reservations, or calling a cab, they were always courteous and efficient. We recommend the SOHO without reservation, but we do suggest you make a reservation before you arrive.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for our Barcelona adventures!”
Reviews.Author: kchall
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful 2 night stay in a terrace room at the Soho the beginning of October. The hotel is very modern and updated. Never did visit the rooftop pool area as it was too cool to swim but the rest of the hotel was very nice. We were really looking forward to our terrace room but we ended up with a courtyard (back of building) room with less than stellar views. We asked if we could switch to a view of the main street but they said those were already occupied. The room was also very noisy even though it overlooked a courtyard. Didn't get much sleep the first night as it sounded as if our windows were open and could hear everything that was said below us in the courtyard. So, the next day we went across the road to the Pharmacy and bought some .99 Euro earplugs...slept like babies the second night. Overall a great hotel in an excellent location close to everything. The metro is right outside as well as an ATM. Would definately recommend the hotel but would book a regular Urban room the next time and skip the higher priced terrace room.

Reviews.Title: “mostly good”
Reviews.Author: visitor00
Reviews.Content: We reserved a terrace room, and were really looking forward to having a private terrace to enjoy the temperate October weather. When we go there, they said that the plumbing in our assigned room was not functioning properly, and they didn't know when it would be resolved. So they temporarily gave us an urban room. Three days later, the terrace room reserved for us was still out of order and so we elected to just stay in the urban room for the remainder of our stay (2 more nights). Given that this is not a large hotel, it was a little frustrating that we had to explain the circumstances each time we went to ask about the room. And their offer of breakfast to make up for the difference in room cost (we had prepaid) was not satisfactory, since the breakfast was overpriced, and cafes are steps away. Ultimately, the refunded the cost difference, which was the only right thing to do. And the manager sent up complimentary champagne and a hand-written apology, which was nice. The decor is interesting and modern (odd lighting which others have mentioned), the location is good (metro steps away), and the service was friendly, helpful, and generally responsive (our issue aside). I think bathroom lighting could be greatly improved - form precluding function in this case. I'd say that our experiences was more 3-star, but 4-star appears to be the typical experience, which I can agree with. 1 pointer: the toiletries at this hotel (and perhaps generally in Spain) are pathetic. Soaps and shampoos don't lather at all. So bringing your own might be a good idea.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Luke M
Reviews.Content: Loved the rooms and the roof deck pool. Great location. Best part might be the fact that it's across the street from Escriba. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location and Comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: india h
Reviews.Content: I chose this specific hotel as a result of reading all other Tripadvisor reviews. The hotel is in a great location for the tourist sights, and extremely ideal for the metro and aerobus stops. The rooms are very comfortable and the rooftop terrace, which has a swimming pool, proved to be a bonus. The staff are very helpful, and it is definitely recommended that you use the hotel's safe. I would recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to Barcelona

Reviews.Title: “Nice, modern hotel in good location with excellent transport links”
Reviews.Author: charlie35slr
Reviews.Content: The Soho is a modern boutique hotel on the Gran Via, one of Barcelona's principal thoroughfares. The location is very good for a city break. You're next door to the Urgell metro statio, 5 minutes walk from Universitat station, 10 minutes from the Placa de Catalunya. The 50 bus passes the front door which takes you to the Sagrada Familia to the East and Monjuic to the West. Around the corner you can grab buses that take you down the Rablma and on to Port Vell or the Olympic Village. Rooms are modern with some interesting touches! Comfy beds and everything spotless. The only thing the hotel lacks is its own bar, but there are plenty nearby. We declined the €10 breakfast which was not included in our package - you can get that meal cheaply in any number of places locally, including the famous Escriba patisserie which is right the road. Recommended. Finally thanks to Ana at the Soho Hotel who's flexibility allowed us to reschedule at late notice...

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay in a perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: basteca
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Soho Hotel for 3 nights before embarking on a cruise. I can't imagine a more perfect home base for our visit to Barcelona. After a brief taxi ride from the airport, we entered the hotel and were greeted by the friendly staff. It was 9 AM, so a room wasn't available for us, but they referred us to their downstairs lounge where we could freshen up after our flight and use the computers in their office center. There was free Wifi throughout the hotel--definitely a major plus! The staff took our luggage and we went on our way walking around Barcelona. The location is PERFECT--maybe a 10 minute walk from Las Ramblas. Having visited Las Ramblas at night, I was very glad we weren't any closer because of the late night noise and activity. Though Gran Via is a major street, our room was very quiet at night and we slept well. We were very near to pharmacies, cafes, restaurants, and the street itself was clean, comfortable and beautiful. Our street was very safe, even when we returned from dinner very late. One note--we didn't experience a single uncomfortable situation in Barcelona though we were told pick pocketing was rampant. Don't make yourself look like a target and you'll find the same to be true. The hotel is modern in design and felt WAY more expensive than we actually paid. We were thrilled to receive an upgraded room and a complimentary bottle of Cava--probably because we noted it was our Honeymoon! Our room was very large for typical European standards and we had ample space. Our bed was two twin mattresses pushed together, which some guests might dislike, but we liked having plenty of personal space and the movement-insulation from the other person. The mattresses were firm and the linens were super soft and comfortable. The AC worked great throughout our stay, but like many European hotels, the room key is necessary to power the room, so it did heat up a little while we were away. We were nothing but pleased with the space. However, I wouldn't recommend this hotel to someone who hated modern design enough to ruin their comfort level. The bathroom was in a glass cube in the room with blinds that opened and shut with a switch inside the bathroom. We found this design choice to be really interesting and fun--the only problem was that if someone went into the bathroom at night, the light from inside still shined pretty brightly into the bedroom, even with the blinds shut. Otherwise, we loved the design and feeling like we were in a very expensive boutique hotel for such a low price. The rooftop deck and pool were beautiful and I would have loved to spend some more time up there. The view itself was great! The international staff was extremely friendly and helpful. They all spoke perfect English and were great at recommending restaurants and getting us a taxi to the port. I will definitely stay at the Hotel Soho when we return to Barcelona. What a great start to a wonderful honeymoon!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location”
Reviews.Author: Cpt B
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideal but I was not convinced by the room features which seemed more aesthetic than practical at times. The room we had had no outlook but was very quiet and comfortable. Like another poster I managed to leave our safe open but nothing was taken. I think the problem may be that the code is cancelled after the safe has been open for more than a few minutes. We managed to check out of the hotel and be checked into Barcelona airport within half an hour! The areobus is terrific and they run about every 10 minutes from virtually opposite the hotel. The bus is the A2 and you get it outside the terminal. Inside the terminal there was a queue of people at the information desks, confirming which bus and getting detailed maps of Barcelona on which the airport bus stops are clearly marked. Arrival at the hotel was quick - it was the second stop. We couldn't believe the value for money were getting for meals. Guito's is a restaurant / bar 20 metres from the hotel front door. We ate there 3 times and had their menu of the day - usually 10 euros for 3 courses which includes a fresh bread roll and a drink each. If two of you take a glass of wine they just give you the bottle. Wine by the bottle there was just over 6 euros in any case! I am as certain as I can be that it is Guitos that supply room service to the Hotel Soho. We regularly saw waiters taking covered food on trays along to the hotel and later saw an identical tray by the pool on the hotel roof. We were there 6 nights and enjoyed the breakfast but a couple of doors along from the hotel you can get a croissant and a coffee for 1.5 euros. It takes about 15 minutes to walk to the Placa Catalunya and we regularly bought large bottles of water there to take back to the hotel. It was rather belatedly that we found an almost secret minimarket between Guitos and the Hotel Soho. There is no obvious sign and we did a double take when we realised. Water was 50 cents for 1.5 litres.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Bag”
Reviews.Author: Tuko_Pomoja
Reviews.Content: Staff at the Soho were very friendly and genuinely helpful. The position is about 10 or so minutes from Placa Catalunya so good but not great. Right next to the metro though and a T10 gets you around well. The price was good for a mid-range room in a big city. The rooms are likely to polarise guests. We didn't like it much, all brown, with odd lighting and blinds that were hard to figure out. I needed a torch to see into the safe. The sofa is made from woven plastic. The shower screen allowed water all over the bathroom floor. Despite being on the Gran Via though (on the 6th floor) the room was quiet and the bed good.Air conditioning worked very well. Hence the mixed bag. BTW parking is very expensive at E30 p.n. (not the hotel's pricing but an independent operator).

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Content: We received a warm greeting when we arrived at the hotel and were upgraded (at no charge) to an Urban room which was spacious with a big bed, wonderful tub-shower and very quiet at night. The location is just out of the main craziness of La Rambla, but close enough to walk to - also right next to metro which we didn't use. The breakfast buffet was good - not a huge selection - but certainly enough variety to keep from getting bored. As many have mentioned, the lighting takes a while to get used to, but it ended up not being a problem at all. Also, for our last night we asked for a non-touristy restaurant recommendation for paella and the young man recommended La Clara a few blocks away. Although at 8:30 we were the only ones in the restaurant (we were just too tired and hungry to stay up for the Spanish dinner hour which is a lot later) it soon filled up. And I think we were the only ones speaking English. Our dinner was delicious - one of the best of our trip. This hotel is an overall good value and we'd highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Should have packed a torch!”
Reviews.Author: Saintssupp0rter
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent, right next to the metro station (Urgell) and within comfortable walking distance of the main squares. Rooms are comfortable and modern with limited storage,very interesting lighting effects which is attractive but made us feel like we were living underground. The inner rooms do not have natural daylight and no views. We couldn't see the buttons on the safe to input a security code. That's when we wished we had packed a torch! Just one overhead light in the entrance to the room would make such a difference. Bathroom area is divided from rest of the room by a window screened with venetian blinds. Lights and blinds are push button operated which gave us a few laughs! The roof top terrace with swimming pool is what made us book and that was lovely to enjoy after a hard day's sightseeing. There are 2 free computers in the basement TV room. Very helpful Reception staff. Not a comfortable place to stay if it rains like it did when we stayed as there are no comfortable chairs in the rooms and no lounge area or bar. There is room service. Would stay again but would upgrade to a room with a view.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: EvaM02
Reviews.Content: My wedding was in Barcelona on September 17th, I had all my guest staying at the Soho. Went few times myself to check it out and loved it! The location is perfect, the price is very good, the hotel is super modern and the service was impecable, and overall me and my guest couldn't have been happier with our choice. I want to thank you especially Anna for her time and patience :) and thank the Soho staff for their great job !!!

Reviews.Title: “Beats on the rooftop & the seethrough bathroom!”
Reviews.Author: Lomburko
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself does exactly what you need when in barcelona. Lovely rooms that are very comfortable. Where it excels though is that it provides you with a lovely rooftop that acts as a suntrap throughout the day giving you the perfect place to relax after a day walking around the city. The seethrough glass bathrooms in the hotel are a nice touch, if you like that sort of thing. Great staff, who are always willing to recommend good places in the area. A small word of warning, URGELL, where the hotel is isn't easy to say if your not Spanish so cabs can be a bit tricky.

Reviews.Title: “our stay at soho hotel, barca.”
Reviews.Author: nicka12
Reviews.Content: found hotel very easy upon our first trip to barcelona. the staff were all very friendly & helpful - jonas & daniella especially - answered all questions & gave us some handy tips.the room was very clean & tidy , beds made daily & towels changed as & when we wished. all transport links easily accessable - used metro( 2 mins from hotel ), bus service & taxi without any problems and all very affordable. very modern, stylish hotel would stay again & will recommend to all. our stay was september 24th to 28th - we had a blast , lovvvvvveddd barcelona & saw george michael in concert - wished we were still there!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A great choice!”
Reviews.Author: Riley500
Reviews.Content: We stayed at hotel soho on our recent trip to Barcelona Sept 16. I spent many hours researching hotels in Barcelona, ended up choosing Hotel Soho and we couldn’t be happier with our choice. The most important things to me were wifi access in the rooms, price, location, comfort, cleanliness and as silly as it seems…a tub. After long days of walking, trust me it is nice. I read all the reviews and everything seems to be very accurate. The staff was always helpful and nice, the décor is modern but inviting, the location is GREAT. Being right on Grand Via and central to everything was much better than being way out on the beach. The neighborhood is very safe, but really, we didn’t feel unsafe anywhere in Barcelona even very late at night. The buffet was included in our room price which we booked as a special and I would encourage you to check the web site for these deals. The breakfast buffet was wonderful and had many more choices than the average European breakfast buffet. We were in the Urban room on the courtyard side, which was fairly quiet, comfortable and spacious. The beds are two double put together but feels like a queen. The tub was deep and had a shower massage. I think it was meant more for bathing than showering because the glass comes half way across, but it is no big deal to throw a towel on the floor. The blinds close with a button for extra privacy if you want it, and the toilet is separate with a door. I want to also give the cleaning staff many kudos for their honesty. One day we left the safe open with our passports and cash inside and all was well upon return. Another day, we put the do not disturb light on (but I guess they did not see it, or they clean your room anyway) and left all our purchases on the bed before leaving for the day. When we returned, the items were neatly arranged on a made up bed and everything was accounted for. The pool looked nice, but we did not use it so I cant comment on that. The metro station is very close, and easy to navigate to anywhere you want to go. Just go down any station and purchase a T-10 ticket, which you or anyone can use 10 times. Also, the areobus to the airport is only about 1 block away so getting back to the airport for 5 Euro is easy and cheaper than a taxi (it runs every 10 minutes). However just know that if you are flying back to the US you will probably be at terminal 1 and not terminal 2 where it drops everyone off. We finally figured out that once the areobus drops you off you have to catch the green bus (free of charge) to terminal 1, which looks like they come by often. Get to the airport early if you want to hand in your receipts for the 14% money back, because the line is usually long and there is not much instruction on how to accomplish the task. We were running late for our flight so we did not do it. We consider the 14% a donation to the Catalon people who were all wonderful. One more tip, if you like to eat you HAVE to go to the restaurant “Me”, a catalon/Vietnamese/new Orleans fusion restaurant that was just amazing. Have the front desk make reservations for you, as you will need them. We ate at a lot of places and have to say this was the highlight of the trip! As far as attractions go, if I had to pick two things to do in Barcelona, my must do would be Sagrada Familia and Monserrat. Fantastic! We had a great experience with Spanishtrails tours, I highly reccommend them if you want to treat yourself to a well done, well priced day trips.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, walking distance from main attractions, very clean.”
Reviews.Author: Nicola R
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights with my boyfriend and have nothing bad to say about the hotel. The room was spotless, you could hear no road noise, despite being on the main road. The hotel itself is very stylish yet good value. The bathroom has a glass wall, which can be left transparent or not...(the toilet is separate) which I thought was quite a fun detail. Breakfast was nice- lots of choice, and the added bonus of sitting outside or in. The rooftop was nice enough, we only used it once. The pool is very small, but large enough for a cool-down dip. Overall I really enjoyed the hotel. The location was great, about 10 minutes from the top of the Ramblas and walking distance to nearly everything. The bus from the airport takes about 15 minutes and drops you across the road.

Reviews.Title: “We would certainly stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Rixameyerzc
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for our honeymoon and therefore decided to spend a little more and book a 'terrace room'. This was quite big, with a large bed and a good size balcony overlooking a small park at the back. We also opted for the daily breakfast, which we thought was very nice as there was a large selection of different food to choose from. Curteous staff who always made sure everything was well stocked and replenished. The staff at the front desk were also very helpful, identifying places to see on a map and giving us good directions on how to get everywhere. We were also given some excellent recommendations for restaurants in the area. The location of the hotel was ideal for us. Even though the metro station was pretty much just outside the front door, we generally walked everywhere from the hotel. Overall a very enjoyable visit and we would certainly stay here again, if we ever come back to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “"We absolutely loved this Hotel.....We would definitely come back!!"”
Reviews.Author: Wayanim63
Reviews.Content: The Staff were awesome, and gave us great tips on where to eat, and the sites to visit. Thanks Daniela and guys at Soho Hotel for a fabulous week in Barcelona. It was our first time vacationing in Europe. And our hotel being so close to the Metro (Urgell) didn't hurt either. We were just a couple of stops from Catalunya.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and convenient boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: JuliaSheffield
Reviews.Content: We really rated this hotel. It was modern and stylish. Our room was a good size and very comfortable. The hotel had wifi and also desktop computers in the basement. As said by other reviewers the desk staff were extremely courteous and helpful. We are over 60, so do not agree with the previous reviewer who said this hotel is only for the young and trendy. The location was extremely convenient - within walking distance of many of the main sights, close to an underground station and to bus stop for airport. As we do not eat a large breakfast we did not have the hotel breakfast but went to a small cafe across the road which served excellent croissants and coffee. We would certainly use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect hotel for our Barcelona vacation”
Reviews.Author: Ron Z
Reviews.Content: The room was clean, quiet, with a very nice modern design. The staff was very friendly and informative. Especially the receptionists which were very helpful. The location was good (about 10 minutes walk from the Catalunya square and La Rambla, and 1 minute walk from a Metro station). The street felt safe to walk on, even at night. There are some nice coffee shops and super markets within a walking distance. All in all, we really enjoyed our stay and we hope to come back soon. Ron & Tal

Reviews.Title: “Very modern design”
Reviews.Author: efsnik
Reviews.Content: You can read quite controversial critics about this hotel. The truth is that the target group of this hotel is young and modern people. If you like very modern design, low atmospheric lighting, nice music in the lobby, etc then you will love it. If you have a more “traditional” taste then better look for something else. We just returned from a 6 nights stay. We found the hotel really relaxing, atmospheric and stylish. The location is perfect, safe, right next to a metro station and just 10 minutes walk from the Rambla, Passeig de Garcia, etc. The hotel is also clean and staff is very helpful. We didn’t try breakfast in the hotel since we had booked it without breakfast, and you can have excellent breakfast in the nearby cafes if you get up a little late in the morning. Overall we really appreciated our stay although we found it a little expensive, but that's how Barcelona is after all.

Reviews.Title: “Always delivers”
Reviews.Author: nielseno
Reviews.Content: I often travel to Barcelona. In bcn you can experience a great city while you can also go to the beach to relax and enjoy the sun. I always stay at Hotel Soho whenever I able to get a room there. It is close to the center, modern and clean and the staff is friendly and professional. Also it is very good value for money compared to some of the other hotels I have stayed in. Some reviewers complain about noice in almost all hotels in bcn, but really if you go to a big city there is bound to be some noice.

Reviews.Title: “We were expecting more”
Reviews.Author: Nicholas S
Reviews.Content: Most of the reviews of this hotel suggest that it is a brilliant place to stay. Whilst we had no major catastrophe we did experience small annoyances that made it less than perfect. When we arrived on a hot day after a long flight from New York via Frankfurt we were told our room wouldn't be ready until 2pm. As a result we had to walk the streets of Barcelona for 2 1/2 hours. We did have access to toilets next to the business centre to get changed first but we desperately wanted a shower. I know that 2pm check-in is reasonably standard in many hotels but this isn't meant to be a standard hotel. Other small inconveniences included: one soap (meaning we had to break it - half for the shower and half for the basin), a tiny light in the toliet by our ankles making it a very dark little room, sandpaper for toilet paper, a fairly dark bathroom overall, a blind between the bathroom and bedroom that we couldn't work out how to close (maybe you can't?) and our locks being changed by management whilst we were out with no message telling us this was happening (this had us trying our keys for ages before going back to the front desk - and then the new key sticking for a while as well). I can't help but think that in the chase for 'design' there has been some compromise on function in a couple of key areas (although a lack of soap has nothing to do with design). The staff, whilst ok, weren't exactly bursting with enthusiasm either on the three occasions we had to deal with them (on our arrival, check out and the key incident). On the positive side, the location is good, the hotel is clean and the pool area was nice (although no bar). As I said - no major dramas - but next time we will look for something a bit more 'traditional' and see if it just does what we need on a short stay in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “great staff”
Reviews.Author: itaireland
Reviews.Content: I found the hotel very modern, the staff were amazing the receptionests could not do enough for us. Well located and really enjoyed the stay. Litlle negative - pool small (terrace area nice though) and pity no bar /relaxing area. Would recommend hotel and would return

Reviews.Title: “Our Room was Robbed”
Reviews.Author: Wendy O
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was fine. Unfortunately, while we were out during the day someone came into our room and robbed us. The hotel asks guests to leave your key at reception when you leave the hotel to sight-see. I STRONGLY ADVISE YOU NOT TO DO THIS. We have emailed the manager since returning home, and she claims all of their employees are trustworthy. Sadly, at least one of them is not, since we were robbed. The thief rifled through all of our bags, taking 100 euro, 200-300 in US cash, and a headlamp (which seems odd, but I guess if you're a thief and you see something you want, you take it). Luckily we had the rest of our cash and all of our credit cards and passports with us when we left the hotel, so nothing irreplaceable was stolen and we had enough money to return home. We have never been robbed before and did not have the foresight to lock our excess cash up in the safe before leaving the hotel room, as we assumed the hotel was safe. The manager has said she will investigate the matter, but they do not have video cameras on the room floors, and it doesn't look like she's going to do much as she just replies that all of her people are trustworthy. Play it safe and stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: TravelBunnies69
Reviews.Content: Soho was a great hotel for us for a few nights before we hit Portugal. Great location, really modern and an awesome rooftop pool which was awesome to use. Friendly staff and very clean. Would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here.”
Reviews.Author: MartinSJ
Reviews.Content: Your search for a good hotel in Barcelona in a good safe location can stop here. Let me start with location. My partner and I were slightly put of Barcelona by stories of pick pocketing and theft. Having spent one afternoon on the Rambla I am so glad we stayedvat the Soho. It's location is walking distance from the Rambla if you want to spend any time there but the area that the hotel is in bustling with restaurants and cafes frequented by the locals but which are extremely welcoming to tourists. The Hotel is about a ten minute walk from the Corte Ingles and surrounding shops and there is a Metro stop (Urgel) right outside the hotel. The Metro which is blessedly air-conditioned is a simple and safe way of getting around the sights of Barcelona when it is too hot to walk. Getting to the hotel from the airport was a simple 20 minute taxi journey of €22. The accommodation in the hotel is both novel and functional and our room was one of the largest we had stayed in for a long time. The rooftop (8th floor) has a modern and relaxing terrace with a small plunge pool. Room service will deliver a bar service or meals / snacks to the roof top. The breakfast buffet is generous and there is seating inside and outside. This hotel is comfortable, safe, well appointed and is an excellent base for exploring this beautiful city. Try to get a room to the front or rear of the building which will afford you atmospheric views of the Gran Via (to the front) or of a small public park where you can watch local families enjoying the outside space. I will go back to Barcelona again and would certainly be planning to stay at the Soho. Take my word for it, stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rachel M
Reviews.Content: As others have said, there are a few really small issues with this hotel - noise levels within the hotel, getting used to the lighting and the shallow pool. Also it would be good if the pool area was open after 9pm. However, all of these things are trivial when you consider the overall experience. The hotel is modern, fairly central, smart, sleek and the customer service received was great. I would definitely recommend this hotel and stay here again if ever visiting fantastic Barcelona. Beware Barcelona is very busy in August but the hotel was a little haven from the heat and crowds!

Reviews.Title: “Soho in Barca”
Reviews.Author: fartyk
Reviews.Content: This hotel is everything it says it is which is unusual these days. We agree with everything other reviewers have written, maybe except we didn't find the breakfast great. The location is fairly quiet and everywhere is walkable or possible from Urgell Metro station. The lighting made us feel claustrophobic at first, but after a day it's not too bad. Don't expect a large pool either-it's a roof top dip! Barca is possibly to be avoided in August. It's unbelievably busy, busy, busy. Our fav bit was an afternoon in Gracia where the street festival restored faith in communities and it was relatively tourist free.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly formed boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: onefootforward
Reviews.Content: We went for our honeymoon and they made our stay personable, enjoyble and relaxing. A great location for sightseeing, near to Plaza de Catalunya and with a metro stop a stones throw away, you can get to almost all the sights in Barcelona. We had a magical time staying here as they knew already it was our honeymoom and welcomed us with some refreshing champagne and chocolates in our room. A smallish pool on the top was a welcome relief away from the midday sun, and the staff were always very effiicient and caring.

Reviews.Title: “A great, friendly hotel with a "funky" feel.”
Reviews.Author: jenx2468
Reviews.Content: We used Soho hotel as a base for a 5 day trip to Barcelona. Despite being on a main road, outside noise is not a problem. The nearest Metro station is 2 minutes away and the walk to Placa de Catalunya is less than 20 minutes. Our room was very clean and once you get used to the lighting and blinds which are both electrically controlled, the rooms have a very airy feel with very quiet but effective air conditioning and are very clean. Breakfast is served on the 1st floor and offers a good selection with excellent service. The reception staff are very professional and friendly and all speak good English. We would use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was perfect”
Reviews.Author: MDUSAtraveler
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, clean, attractive rooms, great location.

Reviews.Title: “ABSOLUTELY BRILLIANT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: MrsKatharinaS
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Soho for a long weekend in the end of July 2011. The Hotel staff is the absolut PLUS PLUS of the hotel. They are so friendly and nice, you feel like home!! I think her name was Danila - from the front desk - is absolutely helpful in anything you ask and they are always there 24hrs to help you with anything you need - may it be a request of what you can do in Barcelona or an extra pillow you need. The hallways are a bit dark and you wonder, whats behind the doors - but the rooms are very clean and stylish. You have to be a Lover of Design Hotels though to like the interior. The breakfast is brilliant and also the breakfast room is very stylish and the staff there is wonderful! You get Nespresso coffee for Breakfast, which we looooooved! I can only say: WONDERFUL HOTEL and I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: SarahLamb30
Reviews.Content: It was a nice hotel however the room was slightly dark - putting make up on in that light was tricky!! The concierges were great throughout the day at giving advice etc. Quite a walk from where we would have probably preffered to stay - the gothic quarter as it was busier but not overly touristy like la rambla. We got upgraded to a bigger room since we were staying a week which was nice. Our tip would be to take a business card from the hotel with you to show to taxi drivers. Overall we had a good time at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Love & Enjoy our Stay”
Reviews.Author: nizzel_dazzle
Reviews.Content: Hello Soho Hotel! Thank you for our lovely stay!, thank you for upgrading our room. We stayed for only 2 nights but we had a great time there. The Hotel is in the City Area. It was very convenience for us to walk back from wherever we go!... I will COME BACk again

Reviews.Title: “good value for money”
Reviews.Author: working_pro
Reviews.Content: Soho hotel is a nice hotel. Good rooms, new building. Location is OK if you do not mind the walking 10-15 minutes to the center. Dark setting, Price is fine for a city hotel. I love the metro nearby.

Reviews.Title: “terrace room, breakfast, staff”
Reviews.Author: jean marc G
Reviews.Content: we spent one week at soho hotel, at the end of may (party of 4). we took the 2 terrace rooms on the front. really great rooms, spacious, giant bed, outside equipment, excellent for evening drinks and night chats. the breakfast is gorgeous everyone can find what he wants, depending on his own country type. i forget my camera usb cable, so couldn't transfer my pix to my computer. i try to find one at the front desk, they look for one in their office, and finally borrow me the director's one for a few minutes, anything we've asked they do their best to satisfy our needs. really great place, 100m from a metro station, to go far, a few blocks from the center of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location. Disliked the bathroom.”
Reviews.Author: imari96
Reviews.Content: The location for this hotel was perfect for us. It is about a ten minute walk to the top of La Rambla, which meant that it was away from the crowds. The hotel is on a major road, but we hardly heard anything in the room, and is just one block from a subway stop. The staff at the front desk were helpful and friendly. The rooms are modern in decor and feel. This was ok for me except I disliked the bathroom. The bathroom had two parts - one for the shower and sinks and then one for the toilet. There were no windows and the area was a bit too dark. There was no shower curtain only a half panel which facilitated water leaking onto the floor. Otherwise, the room was fine and would still recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money City Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kathie_gemi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Soho Hotel based on the reviews it has received on the Trip Advisor and were not disappointed. This hotel has a high value for money: it is very conveniently located - a metro stop extremely close by and at walkable distance to the Placa Catalunya; modern design and amenities; large and clean rooms; decent breakfast; friendly stuff and extremely helpful reception. Basically everything you can ask for from a city hotel at a very reasonable cost!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel well situated, staff is welcoming and takes care of you”
Reviews.Author: Sylvie_red_hair
Reviews.Content: I felt welcomed and got support every day in my search for restaurants or others. Équipe souriante et sympathique. Nice beautiful room, modern, clean and very comfortable.
