Pool on the 8th floor deck is a luxury you get to enjoy after a long day of walking and visits. Great! Well situated, 2 minutes from metro station Urgell and 10 - 15 minutes walk from Playa Catalunya and the Ramblas. One detail - I would add a bit more lights on floors ( dark as you go to your room) but rooms have big windows and lots of light , so it compensates.

Reviews.Title: “So chic, so friendly, so Barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: Rynt
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Soho on a recommendation of a colleague of mine. It was our first stop on our 18-day trip through Spain this summer. This place was delightful and my husband was so pleasantly shocked when he saw the room. Every attention has been put into making the rooms sleek, functional and modern with real beauty and a sense of space. I don't need to do a rundown on the decor, you can check the website! What really made our stay even better was the staff. They are young, friendly, multinational and serious about the hotel business. They gave us really good suggestions for excellent meals (e.g., the Segons Mercat across the road). I didn't realise I'd erred when making my reservation (a room for one instead of 2) but they upgraded at no cost to accommodate us. I blew a fuse and they didn't lecture me, they just fixed it. The same thing went for the airconditioning, which was making the room too cold. They fixed it quickly and with professionalism. The rooftop pool was, of course, a real boon, as was the magnificent terrace. Public transport is fabulous and the youngsters helped us with planning our route when we weren't sure. Barcelona, I miss you already....but I want to come back and try the other hotels in this Nunez group. BTW, the Rambla de mar was a delight! And the shopping at the Desigual shops (one on the Rambla Catalana and one at Mare magnum, Rambla de mar) was very cool. Desigual is a native-to-Barcelona designer with fabulous designs, especially for children and the young at heart (which includes my fashionplate of a husband!).

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and great location!”
Reviews.Author: gocaldeira
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, it`s a true design hotel with a great location. Alessio (the concierge), and the rest of the staff wore really nice and helpful in all situations. Thank you and congratulations. Gonçalo and Marla

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with inspirelring design”
Reviews.Author: Sagees
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the SoHo hotel for three nights in July. Location: This place has a spectacular location. Its the 2nd spot on the Airbus on the trip from the airport. A cab cant get you any closer so that was a great start to our trip. Also, you are located a short 5 min walk from Placa de universitia and the metro station is right across the street. The location is convenient for everything yet is set in a quite area. Leo greeted us at the concierge and executed a very speedy check in. His English was phenomenal and he was very helpful with any advice we needed. Room: The hotel is really a treat for people who enjoy design. Its appears that every square centimeter was well though out in this hotel. We stayed in an urban room, which faced the back courtyard. This provided extremely quite quarters with a cool urban backdrop. The room is small compared to other hotels i have stayed in, but definitional one of the more beautiful. There is enough room for all your essentials do to great design. Breakfast: We included breakfast into our three night stay. The pros are you get a basic section of hot dishes that don't change scrambled eggs, small sausages, fried potatoes. There are also hamon cold cuts, slices of cheese and a small assortment of fruit. Not sure if the orange juice was fresh, but could have been. There is also a nespresso machine for coffee and a larger assortment of baked goods. Its not a breakfast to rave about, but it does the job and most people can find something to start their day. Bottom line, this is a great that i would like to visit again on my next trip to Barcelona on business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: lionel86
Reviews.Content: The employees of this hotel are extremely friendly and knowledgeable of the city. The rooms are good size, decent bathrooms with excellent TV channels. I liked the location, not too far from La Rambla but a 15 minute walk so you are away from the loud partyers of the city. They have two free computers downstairs for internet use so you are not too far from the outside world. Can't complain to much about the hotel so if you are thinking about coming there, the SoHo Hotel is a very good spot to pick.

Reviews.Title: “Very good, but some small details could make it great.”
Reviews.Author: CatherineMFT
Reviews.Content: As first time travelers to Barcelona this was a good place to begin. Great location right next to the metro and out of the busy tourist zone. Very clean and quiet. Super helpful front desk service. We booked a special deal that included breakfast and a 'managers reception' which was wine and tapas in the room one night. Breakfast is fine, but coffee leaves a bit to be desired. Any of the local cafes can make a better cup which is convenient. The 'reception' was disappointing - a little more effort could have made a big difference. Don't bother for this option. Wi-fi was hard to get reliably on the 4th floor. Light in the bathroom was terrible for make up and shaving. Has a pool which is a lovely option. PS - Barcelona is awesome!!

Reviews.Title: “Very good Barcelona Hotel in a great location...”
Reviews.Author: velardemf
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Soho for 5 days in June. The hotel is very clean and has a great look to it - very modern. Front desk staff were very friendly and helpful. The hotel lights and blinds controls do take a little getting used to, but overall very nice. Our room faced the courtyard in the back - which you would think would make it quiet, but it was a little loud when kids got out of school. We also went during the festival of Sant Joan, so fireworks kept us up the last night we were there, but we didn't mind as we got to experience a Spanish celebration. We used the metro to get around barcelona, and Hotel Soho is right next to a Metro stop on the red line - very convenient. There is a Dia market close to the hotel where we stocked up on water - ask the front desk where it is. My wife and I also stayed at the Hotel Jazz later in the trip. Both hotels are great and owned by the same company, but we did like Hotel Jazz better. Bottom line - Hotel Soho was a great base for our Barcelona excursions. Must do's in Barcelona - Eat at the Boqueria (especially Pinoxto's), eat at Cal Pep, see Sagrada Familia, Park Guell, Montjuic... Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: Sheila-Bob
Reviews.Content: We selected Hotel Soho as there was a special offer and after checking the reviews we booked straight away. The hotel is really easy to get to from the airport (A2 Airbus) and it is even easier to get back to the airport. No hassle travel. The hotel itself has everything you need. We had a lovely quiet room at the back overlooking a park. The bed was comfortable and the room had a good supply of hanging space, workspace and powerpoints. We opted for the breakfast deal - which was excellent, well prepared and plentiful. Exploring Barcelona from the hotel was easy. The metro was just a few metres from the door and the buses ran frequently. We purchased a metro/bus ticket (10 trips) which was ideal for our 4 day trip. The guys on reception were unfailingly helpful - and knowledgeable about the restaurants in the area.

Reviews.Title: “super hotel”
Reviews.Author: sandiepie18
Reviews.Content: Our rooms. located next to each other, were really comfy, very modern and with high spec fittings and were cleaned daily. The pool was a pleasant surprise and we used it a few times, ordering food there once which was lovely. The location was great; right next to the Metro which we used daily after overdoing the walking the first 2 days. Glad we were not really close to Las Ramblas as this seemed too touristy. Loved the restaurants at the Port Olympic area as well as recommendations from hotel staff. The staff were exemplary.

Reviews.Title: “Nice choice for Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: TravelerDallasTX
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a basic SOHO room and felt it was plenty big. Our friends paid extra for the SOHO Urban room and ended up using the small seating area to lay their clothes. Hotel: Modern, clean, and comfortable. In a safe neighborhood area. Rooftop pool open from 9am-9pm with sun loungers and room service menu. Complimentary pool towels provided at the front desk. Free Wifi and safe in rooms. A/C works great. Front desk staff speaks great english and is very helpful with directions/train station information etc. Metro stop "Urgell" on the red line is right outside of the hotel. They offered a buffet breakfast each morning for 14 euros per person (or you can pre-pay when you arrive for 10 euros pp), but we chose to go across the street to cafe "Escriba" which was FANTASTIC. Highly recommended for breakfast (quiches, croissants, coffee). The area was very walkable and safe. There is a mini-mart around the corner from the hotel called "Schlecker" (it's like a CVS/Walgreens) which will come in handy for things like bottled water. If you happen to arrive in Barcelona Sants Station I recommend taking a taxi to the hotel (no more than 8 euros) because it is quite a walk with luggage. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff in a fresh hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChrisBros
Reviews.Content: We just stayed one night, but are really happy with the hotel. It's clean, new and fresh. The staff is really helpful and make you feel welcome. The room was small, but nice. The bathroom was cool - really modern. In our room the free WIFI was crap, but it was ok in the foajé. The swimming pool on the roof was really small, but it's nice that it is a roof top terrace. We will definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “nice boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: londoner_8557
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel mainly based on the reviews on tripadvisor, and we enjoyed our stay. It was central (but not too central) so only a ten minute walk away from Las Ramblas. Loads of attractions within walking distance, or a quick hop on the metro, which is only a 30 second walk around the corner. Hotel is in a safe area too. Our room was a standard double, it was clean and very modern, great design - but sadly we didn't have a view of anything. Our room faced the inner courtyard so had a view of the room opposite and next to us, with no natural light. Due to the design of the room, the electric blinds did not open either, so our room was very dark. Perhaps we were just unlucky with our room, and having seen images of other rooms I know there are nicer ones. We could not upgrade either, as they were fully booked. I would recommend to check this with the hotel before booking, or ask to stay in a room facing the main road. Apart from this issue, we had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very cute, affordable and centrally located.”
Reviews.Author: louise1006
Reviews.Content: We got the breakfast included price and it was a good deal. The rooms are small but chic, the front desk clerks were very helpful and all spoke English

Reviews.Title: “Nice place we recommend”
Reviews.Author: Jean R
Reviews.Content: We staid at the Soho for a total of 4 nights... The hotel design is great. The room was clean but a bit noisy due to the main avenue i front of it. The great thing is that it's located very closely from Barcelona downtown (10 minutes walking distance)...

Reviews.Title: “Mas que perfecto...”
Reviews.Author: maitili
Reviews.Content: We just came back from Barcelona and Soho Hotel where we spend 4 nights. Hotel very well located, 10 min walk from Plaza Cataluña, Metro station Urguell in front of hotel and Aerobus stop (from and to airport) very close. Nice little restaurants, not too touristy, in the area. Service and accommodation are just excellent. Alessio, very friendly receptionist, is more than helpful and knows Barcelona and sights like the palm of his hands. Very good advisor! Rooms are clean, modern and comfortable. Not noisy at all, as facing a courtyard. We enjoyed the rich breakfast with fresh juice and fruits, bacon and scrambled eggs and excellent bread. Coffee was not so good. Time was too short for us to zip a nice drink next to the pool!

Reviews.Title: “Design hotel with a great location!”
Reviews.Author: nullejaro
Reviews.Content: We stayed at SOHO hotel for four nights. Friendly staff, great location, sturdy breakfast buffé with everything from scrambled eggs to fresh fruit, relaxing pool area at the roof. The room was nice and clean even though we didn't fancy all design features like mood lightning, electic jalouisesetc.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and hope to be back.”
Reviews.Author: Pammy1946
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and my cousin and his wife went to three different cities in Spain the end of May, 2011. We loved the Soho very much. Great location, great accommodations, wonderful staff. All of us cannot say enough for the staff in this hotel. The most accommodating of all the hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Modern comfort. Excellent Location.”
Reviews.Author: CaneBarbone
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel while traveling with a friend to celebrate a "milestone" life event. Barcelona was our last stop, and we had stayed in very nice hotels in all the other cities we visited. Although our room at the Soho was on the street, it was fairly quiet, and we slept well. The rooms were cleaned daily and we were pleased with the standards in this regard. By far the biggest attractions of this hotel: (1) the location, which is in the Eixample neighborhood. A vibrant, safe neighborhood with good connections by public transportation or by walking to other parts of the city. La Rambla is not far away, and there is a subway station very close by. (2) there was a young gentleman who worked at the reception named Andres. He is an absolute professional--courteous, helpful, responsive to our questions. I kept going back to him with any questions because I trusted his judgment and knew he would have the right answer. Not that the others at the reception desk were unfriendly. It's just that Andres stood out and provided consistently excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location, very good experience over all”
Reviews.Author: cadby
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Soho Hotel very much. We had a balcony room on the Grand Via with a nice view and a very spacious deck. The trade off for the view was a louder room the the balcony's on the back of the hotel. The street noise was consistent, but bearable. The premium balcony room was quite large, very clean and comfortable. And free internet worked fine in our room. The location was excellent, walking distance to Las Ramblas, and most of the Old Town with the Metro right across the street. The staff was very helpful, accommodating numerous requests without any complaints. We would highly recommend the Soho!

Reviews.Title: “We will absolutely return to this hotel”
Reviews.Author: VetteKettinglid
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in this hotel for 4 days (3 nights) 2 weeks ago. It's a very nice design hotel on a good location. We agree with the positive reviews. We had a great dinner thanks to the advice of the reception: no tourist trap but genuine good spanish food! (thank u Allessio!). One advice for the hotel: consider better isolation: we heard a lot of noise even during the night.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! Excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: Chubb_8
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the SOHO last weekend and thought it was superb! The staff were extremely helpful and the hotel had everything you needed for a short stay. Location was excellent with it being only 10mins walk to La Ramblas and bus and metro links on your door step! Would definitely go back if visited the city again!

Reviews.Title: “Very modern, clean, good location”
Reviews.Author: mattouli
Reviews.Content: Great room! Thought a little odd at first, until i discovered the blinds in the layer of glass between the bed and shower. Nice view from the front of the building, a wee walk to la ramblas but you get used to it. Uber modern; but i quite liked it! Shiny one-piece aluminium doors everywhere Very clean (which i always appreciate!) Not much else to say, staff at reception were great for directions/suggestions. Walked past it a couple of times, not as easy to spot from street level Free internet use if you go down a few floors in the lift. Look up the subway maps, will save you a fortune on taxi fares... Pool on the roof; albeit a rather tiny one!

Reviews.Title: “Great base for a city break”
Reviews.Author: Tremmers28
Reviews.Content: We have recently returned from a city break and found the hotel to be superb for what we needed, clean trendy and air-conditioned rooms which were well equipped. Although we were hardly at the hotel it was handy that they have a lovely rooftop terrace with a small pool area for sunbathing which we used for a few hours on the afternoon we arrived. The free wifi in the rooms is a really nice touch and very handy. It's location is good and around a 10 minute walk to La Rambla, very direct walk...and around 7 mins to placa catalunya which is a central point to catch the tourist bus ride which I would recommend as a good way to get around and see all the sights. Special mention to Alessio at the hotel who was superb (as were other staff too) at recommending restaurants - EVERYTHING we were recommended was superb. We particularly liked Agua, La Clara and the fish restaurant opposite the hotel... Sergot..?? I can also highly recommend Ciutat Comtal for a tapas lunch...excellent value for money and fantastic food!! This is around an 8 minute walk towards placa catalunya. Other fun bits are the 26th floor at W hotel for cocktails and lunch at La Bocqueria market. The only points to consider about the hotel are the lighting in the rooms/bathrooms is poor, but that's all in keeping with the design and concept of the hotel so not a lack of attention and the hotel doesnt have a bar, although not an issue for us it can be for some. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “if you never been to barcelona, this hotel is where you start to plan your trip”
Reviews.Author: Youvalv
Reviews.Content: Great service from the front desk, they recommend us with great restaurants for our stay (and not very pricey) the rooms are small but comfortable, the room service is very effective. the room safe is relatively large (to what i am familiar with), the hotel is 10 minutes walk from Placa Catalonia and the La Rambla. it's also 10-15 minutes walk from Placa Espania. there is a Metro station 30 meters from the hotel, and great patisserie across the street. there is also a small pool on the roof for those hot days :) and, finally free wireless Internet! in conclusion, unless you must have a 5 star hotel, this hotel is the choice for you

Reviews.Title: “Excellent friendly Hotel in great location!!!”
Reviews.Author: sambo_1986
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the The SOHO hotel for 3 nights at the begging of May. It is a very modern hotel in a great location a few minutes walk from the placa catalunya which is the start of las ramblas. There is an underground station 'Urgell' right outside the hotel entrance which was really convenient for getting around the city without wasting much time. The rooms were cleaned everyday and the staff were very friendly and helpful and all spoke excellent english. The room had a flat screen TV with english speaking channels such as BBC news 24 and Fox, the wi-fi at the hotel was free of charge and worked perfectly! The roof top terrace and pool was well maintained although the pool was a little cold and not heated but it was only the begginning of May so later in the summer the pool would probably be warmer. If I go to barcelona agian I would definately stay at the SOHO hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel and nice service”
Reviews.Author: Angel10128
Reviews.Content: Very modern hotel. Clean, neat lines. The rooms are very well designed. Very good usage of space. The bathrooms are very modern and comfortable. We had the room facing the courtyard and we had no noise problems faced by other reviewers. The breakfast was pretty good. The service was immaculate. The only problem I had was that the bed wasn't very comfortable. They had spring mattresses and it is okay for a day or two. We stayed for 6 nights and the mattress got a little uncomfortable for us. Otherwise, we had an amazing stay. Well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and delighful staff”
Reviews.Author: Prudence2000
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our trip to Barcelona, and a large part of the experience was due to the thoughtful and genuine recommendations by the concierge (Alessio was particularly helpful, but all the staff were good). They gave excellent advice on where to eat well, how expensive the restaurants were, and how to travel out and about in Barcelona. The hotel is well placed for the centre of Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “just wow”
Reviews.Author: pleutenegger
Reviews.Content: we stayed here at the hotel for three nights. the only thing we have to say is WOW! not only the nice rooms, but also the service, the roof pool and the breakfast is just great. even the price was very OK. furthermore it is to mention that its a good place when you are coming by the aerobus form the airport, metro station is just over the street and in the neighborhood are a lot of very good restaurants

Reviews.Title: “I Work In Travel and Give Honest views on all my reviews”
Reviews.Author: Lindz_Travel_Agent
Reviews.Content: Reception Area Is Lovely, staff know the area very well and were able to provide us knowledge on where and what to do and were the best places to eat are. computers and internet are very very very slow not advised to use unless its to pass time while your waiting to be picked up to get taken to airport LOL. Rooms are lovely. 2 single beds pushed together with a double sheet on but its like this in the whole of EUROPE get used to it !!!! View was lovely and blinds were electronic. bathroom is fine, dissapointed that the bath was not nice dirty were they had sealed round it and needed cleaping badly or re-sealing. shower was hanging off wall slightly so you had to hold it or push it to the side so you didnt flood bathroom. Its obviouly not like this in every room. Hotel is a 4* and i would say its probs about a 3.5* . would recommend people to use metro to get around and plan what to do each day.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Choice - Resonable Rates”
Reviews.Author: Ridgesas
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in April. Had a terrace room with balcony and sit out facing the rear of the building. Got a good rate directly from the hotel website. Breakfast was included in the rate. Convenient location within walking distance to all the major attractions, metro, las ramblas, shopping, Gaudi Church etc. Hotel room was clean and well appointed. Room had a modern design and was quite comfortable. Lighting in the bathroom could be a little brighter (especially the WC area) and the shower glass could be wider to prevent water from escaping and flooding the main area of the washroom floor. These items were very minor in the grand scheme of things. We did have a complaint about the housekeeping. One day we decided to laze around the room and head out a little later. The housekeeping staff kept urging us to leave so the room could be made up. Around 3pm when we told them that we would not be leaving for another 30 minutes the lady was rude in her response. When we did leave as promised in 30 minutes and returned late that night after dinner we found the room was not made up. This was a little disappointing. We did find the front desk and breakfast staff was very pleasant and helpful. They did keep reminding us not to carry our passports, extra money and valuables because of the pick pockets. We were careful but did not feel reason to be more alarmed than other tourist destinations. We did feel safe walking around the hotel and the city. Would consider this hotel on returns to this city. Ate at Con Gracia and Ca L'isidre. Con Gracia was great Asian themed Spanish food while Ca L'isidre was amazing local Catalan food. Both were excellent and great choices in this city. Price was reasonable compared to similar restaurants in other parts of the world.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky hotel”
Reviews.Author: BIGHARRY1939
Reviews.Content: We walked past the hotel twice before we found the entrance. Take airport shuttle bus A1 or A2 and get off at Urgell. When you get off the bus look across the road at 1st floor level where you will find the SOHO HOTEL sign. Hotel staff are very helpful and this is a good location for the Metro etc. Beware of street crime in Barcelona . A gentleman was robbed of his laptop and briefcase when someone poured liquid onto his jacket and then made a fuss of wiping it with paper towels whilst an accomplice stole his possessions from under the table. All his travel docs, credit cards, passport with visas, laptop etc were stolen.

Reviews.Title: “clean, comfy, weird lighting..”
Reviews.Author: itchyfeetKent
Reviews.Content: Had a mid week break at Soho hotel. Staff were friendly and helpful. Our room overlooked the square at the back which was nice. The floor to ceiling windows made the room light and it was big too. The lighting and blind control was a bit odd, and if you like to read in the toilet forget it. The walls are black and the light is set a foot off the floor aiming downwards. It's about 15 mins walk from La Rambla and most sights. There is a small pool area on the roof but we were a bit early in the year to use it. There are plenty of eating places about. All in all we liked it there. TIP - If you get the Aerobus from T2 it drops you just past the hotel on the other side of the road. To get back to the airport you need to cross to the next block over and walk up a block to the right for the bus stop. Very efficient and frequent service. But beware. if you are travelling by Eazyjet the bus drops you at T2 section B. No details of any of their flights there because they go from section C which is a few hundred yards futher up the road past arrivals. Even then when you get through the X ray machine you won't see any details of any London flights. They are on a seperate board far down on the right hand side, we then had to find MO which was far down on the left hand side. We travel a lot and this has got to be the worse signposting (or lack of) ever. Still, hope this helps you find it more easily. Barcelona is fab, enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “amazing hotel that i shall return too !”
Reviews.Author: phil222
Reviews.Content: brilliant hotel, much closer to the city than i thought, nice friendly (good looking :P) staff who spoke english well and were very helpful, rooms are amazing so modern, glass is great as is the mood lights and pictures in the hotel and the bathroom :D would return!! also rooms were great size!

Reviews.Title: “A great base for exploring the wonderful city of Barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: Tommytyke
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights in March and have only positive things to say once again. Returning to this hotel after a stay in 2009 we were pleased to find that the hotel was just as good as we had remembered. Arriving before check-in time our room was ready so we were welcomed straight in. Staff were friendly and helpful and the cleaning staff were particularly pleasant. Rooms are very clean and modern, we had the basic urban room which had an internal view from the window but for £90 per night it was perfect for our base from which to see the city. And yes there is a window into the bathroom, but if you don't like to watch your partner in the shower then there is a button for the automatic blind! Breakfast was included in the price and runs between 7:30am and 10:30 which is much longer than at most hotels. Everything one would want for breakfast, and some you wouldn't, was on offer and plenty of it! Roof terrace with a small pool is a nice touch, but being March it was also very very cold so we didn't brave the water! Ideally located, 10 mins walk from top of Las Rambla, 10 mins walk from Passeig de Gracia (shoppers heaven) and literally seconds to the nearest Metro station. The Metro is excellent, although we loved walking around all the sights it was good to take the weight off and zip around under the streets, and for just 11 Euros for a two day unlimited ticket it was a bargain. All in all a great hotel that we'd have no hesitation in recommending to others, and we will return in the near future!

Reviews.Title: “Cool!”
Reviews.Author: Wundertraveller
Reviews.Content: Nice design. Good location (line 1). Friendly service (even if the lights do not go off;). Clean and sylish rooms. Very good!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly service”
Reviews.Author: RSTW
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the terrace rooms on the top floor. The room was huge and had a large private terrace. Rooms were very clean and comfortable. The staff were very friendly and helpful. We walked almost everywhere but there is a metro station just outside at the next corner. The Aerobus also has a stop just a block away which was very convenient. The only negative was that the free wireless only worked sporadically on the top floor.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, relaxed atmosphere. Lovely rooms & great staff.”
Reviews.Author: Purple_Turtle_HH
Reviews.Content: We came back from Barcelona today and stayed at the Soho Hotel for 6 nights. The hotel is in a great location. It takes about 15 minutes to walk into the gothic quarter and the area it´s in seemed nice and safe. The room we had was very modern with a glass cube-like bathroom within the room. We liked the different light settings. Generally the room was spacious enough and had everything we needed like fridge and hairdryer. We slept well and didn´t hear any noise from other rooms. The staff at the Soho are not at all like the usual hotel staff - they´re very cool and trendy (in a nice way) and laid-back but efficient and very friendly. It was a bit cold last week but I´m sure the rooftop pool with lounge and bar is great fun in the summer. All in all, we loved this hotel and would definitely stay there again next time we visit Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Soho Barcelona? the right choice.”
Reviews.Author: NathanSouthseaUK
Reviews.Content: We spent sometime deciding on our accomodation for our recent trip to Barcelona, and the Soho Hotel seemed to tick all the boxes - good price, good location and great looking rooms. As ever it isn't until you get there that you discover what a hotel is really like, and we loved it! The rooms were very stylish and exceptionally clean - everything that is needed for a trip to this fabulous city. Breakfast was just right (a great selection) and the staff were extremely helpful - every request was met with a smile and excellent advice. We would definitely book again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sophie188644
Reviews.Content: This was the second time I stayed at the Soho Hotel for business. Contemporary style, very close to the city center (Plz universitat and cataluya). Very nice rooms, with very friendly personnel. Breakfast is very good too. In summer the pool on the roof with extra terrace makes a nice break from work. Very good value for money! One piece of advice, if you don't like the city noise, ask for a room on the inside of the building when you book.

Reviews.Title: “Marvellous”
Reviews.Author: huysj
Reviews.Content: My brother advised us to stay in the Soho Hotel in Barcelona in October 2010. I stayed 3 nights at the SOHO hotel with my wife and it was a marvellous trip! The hotel is centrally located and the breakfast was extensive and copious. We stayed in a superior room and we loved the lounge style. Many thanks for the good service! I think my brother will stay at the Soho hotel in April 2011!

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: Jocaxxx
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. The location is very handy, the subway station is right in front of the hotel and the line that serves the area can take you anywhere in the city within minutes. The room is modern, comfy and cozy. Towels are big and smooth. The staff are amazing, very helpful and kind. The breakfast buffet is worth the extra money you pay, very tasty and everyday there's a new delicacy to taste. I'm definitely coming back

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic,shame about room 21”
Reviews.Author: fargo72
Reviews.Content: stayed here last week,hotel was fantastic,front desk staff were very pleasant,told we were in room 21,went in room and found we had no view,we were in middle of hotel,no view apart from other rooms looking in,went and asked if we could change rooms and was told that was not possible as hotel was full,in all fairness i did say 2 them at the start if it was not possible then it would b ok,my only bad point was i felt that whatever way you closed the blinds(which had 2 b shut all the time)people could see in,but that was it,everything else was great,breakfast was very good,very nice staff,never got 2 use the roof terrace as we were out all day,barca is great and i will defo return 2 city and hotel,eatting out was great,just b careful as soft drinks can b more expensive then beer and wine,found a fantastic restaurant called Ferrans,just of la ramblas.Anyway thats it talking,as i say it was FANTASTIC,(but not room 21)

Reviews.Title: “incredible stay-lived up to its praise!”
Reviews.Author: inlovewtravel
Reviews.Content: i am a 23 year old solo traveler who went to barcelona after 17 days in egypt. i chose to stay at the soho hotel after it was highly recommended by my parents who has stayed there the summer before. the hotel was fantastic with an extremely accommodating staff. the staff is very knowledgeable on restaurants, points of interest, shopping and nightlife. the rooftop pool is small, but there is space to lay and tan. rooms are spacious with an AMAZING bathroom. walking distance to las ramblas, university and public transport. the hotel has a very edgy feel. doors to the rooms are steel and you can change the lights in your room from white to orange. computers are available one floor under the lobby. i would recommend this hotel to anyone, no matter what age group. when i come back to barcelona, i would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, spacious rooms, great location and wonderful vibe”
Reviews.Author: DN38516
Reviews.Content: Had a 3 night stay here in early February. Loved it. The hotel has quite a contemporary, "trendy" style which I found a refreshing change - its a really cool place. I stayed on my own in a double room, with a very comfortable bed and plenty of pillows. Considering the price and location it was very spacious indeed - I've stayed at similarly priced hotels in many big cities in Europe and this was probably the biggest room I've been in. It has a neat electronic safe, minibar (typically overpriced) and free wifi, which worked really well (just get the login code from reception). Plenty of towels, etc, though toiletries are pretty basic. The bathroom was very clean; as others have mentioned the somewhat unusual setup was a bathtub/shower in a separate room but with a glass panel (instead of a wall) between it and the bedroom, with electronically controlled blinds offering privacy. The actual toilet was through a separate door adjoining the shower room. I personally wouldn't see how this would be much of an issue for anyone. Didn't interact a whole lot with the staff but they seemed pleasant and efficient. It's just a short walk from plaza catalunya (and the adjoining ramblas) and Urgell metro station is right outside the door. Seems like a very safe area. My only gripe was the noise from outside - it faces onto a busy street, but even though I was at the rear of the hotel on the 4th floor, I was woken during the night on a few occasions by traffic and other noise. Little or no noise from other rooms though, the walls seem fairly sound proof. All in all, I'd highly recommend this place - it just has a great vibe.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: norman100
Reviews.Content: stayed 2 night very good front of house staff. right next to a metro station 10 mins walk to top of ramblas got a good deal and breakfast was good.bed was 2 singles together and room was a bit noisy dont get one on the main road.would stay here again.also has a great roof terrace with pool great when the weather ok but not in feb !

Reviews.Title: “Modern Great Hotel offering Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: mkilroy
Reviews.Content: I would recommend a short stay at this hotel, offering great value for money in a good loctation (just a few metres from the Ugell metro Station) Rooms are a good size with a remote which operates the blinds, lighting (low and hot) no Tea and Coffee facilities you needed to order this from room service. Only downside was it did appear to be a little noisy from the road outside, however we had the same at another hotel we stayed in Barcelona. All in all if you want a good modern hotel, you should not stay in the centre of the Gothic or Born area as you will be paying for it! try looking further a field as long as you are on the metro it is not a problem to get around. p.s. get a T10 for 8 euros this is for 10 trips including getting to the airport and can be used by multiple people i.e you dont need one each!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Luke2009
Reviews.Content: We stayed a couple of days in this hotel and it was a pleasant stay. Nice and quiet rooms although the light is a bit poor. Friendly and helpful staff and nice breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: cbrown52
Reviews.Content: The Soho is in a great location for seeing the sights of Barcelona. All of the staff were friendly and helpful. The rooms were trendy,clean and quiet. We would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy stay with a very friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: trvlnsandy
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel because of the TripAdvisor reviews, and was not disappointed. I found the staff to be very friendly, helpful and knowledgeable (well, one lady at reception did not speak English - but she was only there a short time, and it is Spain, after all). Directly across the street is one of the better chocolate shops (hidden from me for several days because of the Christmas stalls) - pricey, but the hot chocolate was totally decadent. The hotel is an easy walk to the Rambla, and the metro is right outside the door (well, maybe 30 yards away). Only problem I had was with wireless, but I think because our room was so far from the router, and they happily loaned us a cord to connect. Was slightly disappointed that the solarium on the 8th floor was not open - was looking forward to the views, and there was no way I could see to obtain hot water for an afternoon coffee or tea.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, Metro Station outside, but rooms can be noisy if a light sleeper”
Reviews.Author: Londondesign
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Soho for 4 nights. The rooms are of varying sizes & layouts but the two we had were perfectly adequate. There's some English TV channels (FOX and BBC World News). The rooms have a good size electronic safe which fitted my SLR camera (which is very handy with all the pickpockets in Barcelona). One notable member of staff (Danelle) was outstanding but all the staff were friendly, knowledgeable and spoke English . The best thing was the Metro (L1 line) was right outside the hotel and Aerobus transfer was just a couple of blocks east of the hotel. There's a media centre in the basement with a couple of Internet ready PC's and a comfy area with free magazines and a plasma TV. We found this a useful resource when planning the next days activities and reception staff were happy to print any research we needed hard-copies of. Worse thing about the hotel is there is a busy road outside the front and area out the back where kids sometimes hang out, neither of which would normally be a problem but the sound proofing is poor and you can hear other rooms very easily, the hard floors when combined with high-heels in adjacent rooms are a real treat at 14:00 in the morning! If you are lucky with the other residents or a heavy sleeper then the location will make up for this.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: AusTraveller000
Reviews.Content: Fantastic modern 3 star Hotel. Great Location (15min walk to La Ramblas). Room very modern, spacious, and had english tv channels. Bathroom, was small but perfectly adaquate, with shower over bath, great water pressure. Mini bar fridge wasnt working, but didnt use it so no issue there. Unfortunate that breakfast wasnt included, but offered for a discounted cost of 10 euros (13 euros without discount), great cafes around the area though.

Reviews.Title: “disappointment”
Reviews.Author: aandiss
Reviews.Content: The hotel is quite dark and rooms are very used (many scratches all around), basic 3 star amenities. You can hear all the street noise and bathing from neighbor rooms. However reception staff was very friendly and hotel has decent breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “SOho would go here again!”
Reviews.Author: claudsx
Reviews.Content: We arrived here on November the 8th as new to the city had trouble finding the hotel but this was down to our own faults however once we knew where it was, it was soo easy to find on the way back from town and things. Not too sure on the taxi drivers! As they over charged us for a short trip from the train station! Receptionist staff were very helpful and friendly and also spoke fluent English which helped us lots as our Spanish vocab wasnt too great! Room was spacious modern very clean and tidy. Loved it. We really enjoyed the hot and soft lighting. Hot being a personal fav ;) Wouldnt go near the minibar, abit too over priced for our liking. Unfortunatly the weather wasnt too hot so we were unable to have a dip in the pool, which is on the rooof! awesome! great location in Barcelona, right next to the metro, which i would recommend highly for transportation round Barcelona! This hotel was very amazing, the only fault I would give, would have to be the breakfast which we paid extra for. Nothing special, no real variety of food, but if you like toast and nutella then this is place for you ;) anyways, great hotel, would recommend and stay here again! :Dx

Reviews.Title: “Really fantastic”
Reviews.Author: kjj83
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in October 2010. It was even better than I expected, although not quite in the location described, but still only a 10minute walk to the main tourist area, quiet at night, with some great restaurants very nearby. Room was really cool and contemporary, lots of fun little features- lighting, bathroom especially good. Breakfast was really great, something for everyone, lovely outdoor terrace to have breakfast when warm enough. Didn't get a swim fitted in, although the rooftop terrace looked pretty cool, and again in hotter weather would be great. Had no reason to contact reception, so can't comment on service, but room was cleaned daily and it really was a great experience. Would most definately return, and recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: joynyjuk
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, about 15 minute walk from the centre, but therefore away from the crowds, staff were great, my friend left her glasses on the plane on the flight out and they did their utmost to ring airport / travel company on our behalf, resulting in them locating them and enabling us to colect them at the airport on the way back. Modern and sleek, really pleasant place to stay. The staff also recommended good restaurants and places for breakfast. Thoroughly recommend

Reviews.Title: “Extreamly Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: MekoCleveland_Ohio
Reviews.Content: Showed up a day early due to strikes in France, no rooms avalible, but Maria and (sorry did not get the other girls name) at front desk went way out of there way to help me find something for the night. All front desk staff friendly and helpfull with all my questions. One of the best rooms for the money and I have travel all over the world. look forward to staying here my next tripback to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful design hotel - some quirks!”
Reviews.Author: Garfbambvan
Reviews.Content: Situation : it is not in the historic city center (but who in his right mind wants to stay on the Ramblas anyway?) ; with a metro stop in front. 15 minutes leisurely walking and you are at the lower level of Paseig de Gracia, close to Plaza Catalunya. Design : modern but really warm and welcoming. Ambience lighting (hot& soft) in the rooms. As per previous reviews I can imagine that the commands can be slightly tricky but they provide a small explanation booklet right beside the controls. We had a balcony room (7th floor) which is nice. Noise : rooms well insulated between each other (no toilet and TV noises) but even if we were at the back, a lot of outise noises (traffic, shouting etc) permeates the room and so I put in my trusty earplugs. Breakfast : selection is indeed quite small and invariably the same from day to day. I would rate it as adequate/average. Coffee is served in a thermos (yuk!) but you can get an espresso FOC, just ask one of the waitresses. I would recommend this hotel for a leisure trip without any problems, but for a business stay it is not really adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to stay in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Jewels_Gva
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 4 nights in October, in a terrace room. The room is quite large, tastefully decorated, with a terrace overlooking a square. We had a small bathroom, with bath and separated from the room by a glass wall with blinds. Not complete privacy if you are not staying with your significant other. The staff is extremely nice, and very helpful. Breakfast is ok, but nothing to write home about. The hotel is centrally located, but still a bit out of the way if you like going everywhere by foot. However, there is a metro station in front of the hotel. On the downside, the room is quite nosy. You cannot hear the neighbouring rooms at all, however, the traffic can be quite loud, and the square below is constantly populated and noisy until late at night. The beds are ok, although a bit firm for our taste. In the bathroom , the toilet was not correctly hung to the wall and every time you would sit on it, it would make a noise like it was about to be ripped off the wall! A bit weird at first, then you get used to it...Bathroom amenities are pretty cheap. Last but not least, during our stay, we came back every day around 4-5pm and the room had not been made 2 times out of 3. Wifi in the room does not work with iPhone or iPad. However, all taken in consideration, we had a nice stay and would probably come back as the hotel offers a good quality for a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Sleek sexy hotel”
Reviews.Author: loves2travel13
Reviews.Content: I would rate this a 3 1/2 star hotel. Front desk staff both very helpful & knowledable, gave us excellent suggestions for dining out. Our room faced the Gran Via, and unlike another reviewer, the noise did not bother us. Very comfortable king size bed, with high quality sheets & pillows. Very modern use of lighting, flat screen tv, & desk space if needed. Great computer room on lower level, always available for guests. If your rate does not include breakfast, make sure to go across the street to Escribe, or to other places in the nearby area. Make sure to try the restaurants along Enric Granados, a lovely pedestrian street, located a block or 2 behind the University. Beautiful area, with many wonderful. reasonably priced restaurants such as Stile (at #67) & La Polpa (next door), don't miss the rooftop bar at the Condes Hotel on Passeig de Gracia,#73 - beautiful view of Barcelona. Just got home, and I can't wait to return to Beautiful Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “great location aided us in our adventures in barcelona”
Reviews.Author: DianeC91
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with the location, near the metro and the airport bus across the street. The staff was so helpful, we did not do a lot of research beforehand and are geographically challenged, so we were in need of directions and information. We paid extra for a larger room and it was in the back on the quiet side. Our deal included breakfast, but if it not included, there are better nearby options for less money. The area was fantastic and we always felt safe walking home after dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Ok - But Read on...”
Reviews.Author: GLondonUK
Reviews.Content: This hotel looks great, The roof pool and terrace is nice (small - as always here). Rooms look nice and ours had a bath. Wifi free but unable to use with iphone (laptop fine). Beds comfortable and all clean... Breakfast was good... However. First night we arrived the air con did not work and they would not could not fix it until the next day. We were at the front and it is noisy anyway (bury road below) and opening the windows meant about 3 hours sleep. Not what you need after arrival. Some reception staff are nice (not necessarily helpful) others are just not nice or helpful! Request a room at the back

Reviews.Title: “Possibly the best hotel we've ever stayed at!”
Reviews.Author: Canada12365
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at many different hotels through our work and personal lives. The Soho was by far one of the, if not the best, hotel, we've stayed at today (including a number of 5 stars). Everything and everyone was impeccable. We recommend it without any hesitation. CANADA

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Michbain
Reviews.Content: This is a nice and well located hotel, I feel more in New York than in Barcelona because of the modern deco. I think they have good price, good breakfast included in fare, nice rooms. The only complaint I have is the service from the reception.

Reviews.Title: “A great birthday trip!”
Reviews.Author: JMMDublin
Reviews.Content: I just wanted to say that we had a great long weekend here at the start of September. We stayed in one of the superior rooms with the balcony overlooking the Gran Via. The room was gorgeous, very trendy and the balcony was great to have as it was roasting at the time! I had stated on my booking form that I wanted a nice room as it was for my boyfriends 30th birthday and when we got back from sight seeing that day there was a bottle of Cava on ice which made his day and really added to the experience. It was such a nice touch and really welcome. Everyone was really friendly in the hotel and we had a great time. So thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money, and the design on top!”
Reviews.Author: nike_d
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 1 night, and I would definitly recommend the hotel, breakfast was simple and nice, and the overall service from the front desk or in the restaurant was pleasant. I would stay here again on my next visit in Barcelona

Reviews.Title: “chic modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: simonok
Reviews.Content: If you are after old world charm then Hotel Soho is not for you. However that is the point, this modern minimalist hotel is a mix of contemporary style and modern technology and I simply loved the place. I would recommend this hotel and its location to anyone. It makes a refreshing change to be surprised by the quality, cleanliness and attention to detail in a hotel, I just wish all hotels could be of this standard and value. The staff are very friendly and will help you out with anything you need. They even speak good english. The hotel is very clean and has a modern glass lift to get you to your room and the rooftop swimming pool and chill out area. On my first afternoon after a 4hr train trip from france sitting on the roof soaking up the sun was the perfect way to unwind. You can order food and snacks from the terrace, you can take a tip in the pool or you could watch the world go by on the gran via. I was given the option of upgrading free of charge (I had the cheapest room) so I took the option to overlook the gran via. While you could just hear the traffic noise the double glazing was very good. The room was much bigger than expected with room for two single beds, a massive desk, two cool looking chairs, big lcd tv and small table for eating if you order room service. The lighting system is all electronic and is really cool. The decor of the room is all muted browns and light greens. The mix of glass and aluminium really works well and is far superior to any hotel I have been in, better than london and better than france (for the price). The location is perfect its not on the Rambla, its in the cooler more chilled out part of town. Anyone who complains about this is an idiot, and should go stay on Rambla with the pick pockets and tacky eateries. The best way to get about is to get a t10 ticked for the metro, it wont take you long before you are navigating the metro like the locals, and unlike london the tube has air conditioning. The buffet breakfast is very good indeed, you have the choice of croissants or pain au chocolat, Doughnuts, and other tempting pastries and cakes with coffee, tea, juice or just water. You can have cereals, bacon, sausage, scrambled eggs, bread, toast, ham, cheese, spanish omelet and a selection of melons for the more healthy types.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Guido046
Reviews.Content: This is a pleasant hotel with an excellent location. Friendly staff, rooftop pool (small), al fresco breakfast, restaurants and nightlife in immediate vicinity. Rooms are modern and a bit spare, no drawers, but comfortable beds.

Reviews.Title: “great location - perfect for 20 somethings”
Reviews.Author: Joymediator
Reviews.Content: Generally, it was fantastic - very well located, clean, we had a spacious room, and the staff was all very helpful. The room is very modern and spare. I liked facing the square in back - it was light and quiet, which was helpful since the hotel is on a main avenue. Cons: the pool is really only for dipping - it is the size of a postage stamp. Also, this is not a place for old people. The bathtub is very high and the lights take getting used to. We ended up in the dark a few times until we figured it out! Also, there is a glass wall between the bathroom and the room, which was interesting ...

Reviews.Title: “Just ok.”
Reviews.Author: SkinnyMinnyDublin
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in the Penthouse Suite. It was very expensive but we decided to splurge and we were disappointed. Room was very small and very minimal making it uncomfortable. It has a lovely huge balcony looking over the Grand Via but the room itself was what I suppose is supposed to be trendy but it lacked atmosphere or charm. Breakfast was ok. Staff could have been more helpful with directions and questions etc. Wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing stay at Soho Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WaterlooLondon
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, staff and location. Had a very relaxing and enjoyable five day stay at the hotel. I had read good reviews about hotel and day was due to leave read a not so good review. After my stay the bad review was unwarranted and that's why I am writing this one to balance it out. Staff very helpful, room and hotel very clean. Pool area great if short of beds.

Reviews.Title: “Not trustworthy”
Reviews.Author: Palsom
Reviews.Content: Soho was quite a bad experience for us. We were downgraded for three nights because of some repair works. The gut feeling was not very good, but we couldn't do anything. The room we got had a terrible smell of sewerage. The smell problem was solved, but reappeared on and off during the stay in that room. When we were to move into the superior room, with it's own terrace, we were told that we had to wait until the customers had moved out!!!?? This added up to our already suspicion that we were fooled, so we did not bother to complain to the staff. We were fed up, totally. Positive thing was the nice breakfast, design and central location. The place has potential, but needs staff, upgraded infrastructure and service mindedness. Despite this, we would not dare to recommend people to stay at SOHO.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience, great staff.”
Reviews.Author: Serge-Michael
Reviews.Content: Pros: very friendly staff, well equiped rooms(particularly with terrace), good location, good breakfast, excellent value. Cons: pools too small for the number of rooms: chairs never available. Some technology failures: internet did not work in our room, safe was not cooperative and had to get help from staff, no electricity on arrival: breaker had been turned off for the whole room. Should definitely have coffee machines in room. Staff could offer more suggestion particularly on dinning possibilities nearby (which are great, just a few blocks north-east) Other than that, we had a great time at this hotel: our room with terrace was facing toward the courtyard, very animated while quiet when night fall.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel,great location, would come again”
Reviews.Author: Carlashel
Reviews.Content: This hotel had a great location , with the aerobus stopping outside and being able to walk to all the main attractions. We loved the minimalistic style ,but the room was comfortable and clean.The air conditioning was perfect after a hot day in the city. The roof terrace, although small was a nice touch and a nice place to relax. Would not hesitate to recommend this hotel as a top of the list 3 star hotel ! and would be happy to return

Reviews.Title: “Liked 'Soho' but it's sister hotel 'B-Hotel' is better”
Reviews.Author: Seaforth35
Reviews.Content: The Soho hotel is in a great location, right next to a metro stop and only about a 15 min walk to the Ramblas. Our room was a good size and had cool decor. However, we stayed at 2 hotels during our stay in Barcelona, B and Soho, and B was the best. They are part of the same group but what made the B-Hotel stand-out was it's roof-top; both hotels have roof-top pools but B's is bigger with more seating, better views and a functioning bar. It was often quite difficult to get a seat at the Soho pool and the bar was never open so you had to call reception who would bring drinks up to you but charge you 2€ for the pleasure. Overall the Soho was a good hotel but when we return to Barcelona, we'll be booking B.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant...just sensational”
Reviews.Author: Geelong3219
Reviews.Content: We were absolutely thrilled to find out that the airport bus stops right out the front! So for 5 euro we got our transfers to the hotel. We met up with friends at the hotel, and we all agreed, the hotel was sensational. The rooms were spacious, clean with very comfy king beds. The roof top area was a great place to sit and relax for a drink before heading out for dinner. The location was perfect. Just a short walk to the ramblas, and there were plenty of great tapas bars and restaurants close by. The staff were incredible. They were always available to provide information about the city, good restaurants..anything really. Nothing was too much trouble. They ordered cabs for us, offered wake up calls and booked restaurants. The staff were truly wonderful. Couldn't recommend more highly.

Reviews.Title: “Too good to be true; A unique and unforgettable experience”
Reviews.Author: JCMenard
Reviews.Content: We would like to tell how this hotel is fabulous and how Barcelona has a lot to offer to any tourist in the world. It was just amazing. We spent 8 nights at the SOHO Hotel in July 2010. This hotel is great for many reasons: 1. The location is great; It is a 5 minutes walk from the University and about 8 minutes from Plaza Cataluyna. It is half-way between Sagrada Familia and Cathedral of Barcelona. There is a metro station, Urgell, just in front of the hotel (or very very close) 2. The staff is wonderful and always willing to help. You could learn and practice Catalan with them for those who like languages. They are fluent in English and Spanish. 3. The room was great. It is rated a 3-stars hotel. Indeed it is a 4-stars hotel without a doubt at the price of a 3-stars. 4. We took breakfast for two mornings. The food is great and the menu is quite elaborate for a breakfast. 5. We were in Barcelona when the weather was between 35 to 38 celsius for the whole week. Before going to dinner, we enjoyed the big jacuzzi (or the small swimming pool) each day. This facility is again just great. 6. After a long travel from Canada, we took the AEROBUS at 5.05 euros from the airport to the hotel. No taxi is needed. The bus goes on Gran Via de les Corts Catalanes, the same street of the hotel. So you just need to watch the numbers to be dropped practically in front of the hotel. SOHO hotel is located at 543-545 Gran Via. 7. The hotel and the room were very clean. The design of the room is unique. The conditionned air worked perfectly well. 8. It was a special occasion as we celebrated my wife's birthday. If you have a chance, buy tickets to see a concert or a show at the Palau Musica Catalina (metro Urquinaona). We went to see a concert of spanish/catalan guitar. The price was reasonable. 9. I would recommend to anyone a stay at the SOHO hotel with no hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel. Great staff who really...”
Reviews.Author: mtrager
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. Great staff who really know the city. Good location about a 10 min walk from old town and centre. Rooms are clever and trendy. Only negative there is no gym.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Soho - relax and enjoy.”
Reviews.Author: 2000sj
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 great nights at the Hotel Soho in the middle of June 2010. By making an early reservation, we were able to secure a rooftop room with terrace. It's always difficult to know what a hotel will be like especially the room chosen. We were very pleased on both counts. The hotel location is about 10 minutes walk from the start of the old town in one direction and a similar distance from the Placa Espanya, in the other. There are many restaurants in the vicinity. Coming from the airport, we caught the Aerobus which stops a couple of hundred metres down the street from the hotel at Urgell. These run every 10 minutes or so and the fare was only €5. - a very easy trip. The hotel is described as minimalist, but don't let that put you off. It has all that you could want, unless it's carpets in the bedroom. The designer has managed to squeeze everything into a space between 2 buildings, but at no time did anything feel cramped or oppressive - all very stylish. Our room was large with a sitting area and terrace. This was at the front of the hotel and we were initially concerned that it would be noisy from the street below, especially if we slept with the terrace door open. There is some traffic noise, but the air conditioning in the room was so unobtrusive that we could close the door and sleep in comfort. Another concern was the louvered blinds to the windows and bathroom - would these be effective? No problem at all - the blinds are between the panes of double glazing and operate at the push of a button, as does the room lighting. Mood lighting at the touch of a button - you don't see this very often in a hotel room. In addition, there are conventional blinds on all of the windows which keep out the morning sun. The room was very clean, the bedding and towels being changed every day. We only had one minor problem - the batteries in the room safe needed replacing. We reported this and it was done immediately. The hotel has a breakfast buffet, which initially seemed minimalist too. However, there was fresh orange juice, teas, coffee, cereals, fruit, cheese, cold meats, eggs, bacon, mushrooms, breads, crousants and pastries - all you could want and all replenished as necessary. When we make a return trip to Barcelona, we will not hesitate to stay at the Hotel Soho again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel and location!”
Reviews.Author: Pilar/Santiago
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a one week stay at the Soho Barcelona and could not have been more pleased! The location was excellent, we walked everywhere and had no trouble finding our way around. Rooms are indeed very stylish and comfortable. The staff were very helpful and gracious, a special thank you to Alessio for his help with our wi-fi issues and his recommendations for getting orientated on our first day in the city. I would highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great value modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: cath31
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 3 night stay at the Soho , as in previous entries very modern hotel , good location 10 mins walk to La Rambla area . Hotel was busy but no noise from other guest , no banging of room doors etc . E-mailed hotel prior to visit to request room at back of hotel which we got. Pretty noisy from the park area on first night as there are flats surrounding it and it was Saturday night . After that no problem park used a lot day time but no other noise at night either that or we were too shattered to hear any noise !! Great having the pool area to relax at the end of the day before going out at night . Staff very helpful with any enquiries we made . Overall a great stay .

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: rbt2010
Reviews.Content: very convenient yet quiet location. close to metro and within walking distance to most sights. staff very accomodating and helpful, room was quite comfortable, the morning breakfast is very good. enjoyed our stay very much.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Barca.”
Reviews.Author: ford maverick
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 2 nights here on our first trip to Barca. We drove in from France - car parking was available down a steep ramp and 20euro/night was okay. Room was ready for us - very friendly & welcoming young lady who spoke good English at reception. We had booked a room with a balcony overlooking the rear of the property. This looks over a public square where kids play football and people meet - Not quite Barca V Milan but entertaining non the less. Could get noisy in the evening but then the kids go in at about 9.00.!!. Not a quiet location but you are in the city. I think the rooms to the front would suffer from road noise as it is on abusy road. Roof top terrace was very nice to sit - no bar or phone for room service - just bring your own. Pool was freezing - not particularly large and a few loungers - nice area to sit and chill though after a busy day in the city. Location is great - about 1/2 way between LaRamblas and Place Espania so makes a good route round the city. The food was good for breakfast - self serve buffet and although not lots of food was sufficient choice. Room service was prompt - my Cava was nicely chilled.!! Free wifi throughout hotel was good. In summary if you want somewhere trendy & cool, just off the main area this is the place. dont think I would take the children though.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful friendly trendy hotel”
Reviews.Author: appleandpepper
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the Soho Hotel (21-22 May) after a two night girllie weekend. The hotel is on a main road (ask for a room at the back) but well worth 10-15 minutes stroll into town. Our room was clean and queit, the pool good and the terrace area excellent. The hotel also offered free internet access which we used daily. Breakfast was well thought out with hot and cold buffet and fresh orange juice, pastries, cakes/bread and fresh fruit. We felt safe walking back to the hotel very late at night, although cabs were easy to find and reasonable. Special thanks go to Erica and Alesso on reception who helped find us the best club in Barcelona (Opium - fantastic!!!). We hope to return next year with two other firends and will return to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “a great choice for Barcelona first-timers”
Reviews.Author: d956
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Soho Barcelona for three nights, May 1, 2 and 3. Chose the place due to tripadvisor ratings, it's accessibility for the Barcelona shuttle bus to and from the airport, along with a great rate obtained on the hotel's website. In fact, we obtained their spring/summer package which included an upgraded room, with breakfast each day, a bottle of cava and tapas one night, all taxes, for 378 Euros total. An average, per night, rate of about 126 Euros, which, after lots of research, turned out to be an outstanding rate for Barcelona during the period we were there. As others have stated, the rooms and facilities are very nice, very hip and very contemporary. We were in a room facing the courtyard at the back of the hotel, so it was very quiet. We found the bed to be quite comfortable, and the room spacious enough for our needs. Enjoyed the breakfast each morning, also, which was completely adequate, as was the bottle of cava, with tapas, in the hotel's breakfast room the night we arrived, too tired and worn out to go out exploring for restaurants, after a very long 20+ hour, multi-stop, trip originating in San Francisco. About the only complaint (and this isn't much of a complaint) is that we'd have preferred a location maybe two blocks closer to Cataluna Square, from where most of our sightseeing began. But the walk wasn't bad and, as stated earlier, the hotel's location on Gran Via was absolutely perfect for the Barcelona airport shuttle bus which stopped at the intersection of Gran Via and Urgell, only about a block and one-half from the hotel. Return shuttle to the airport was from a location about another block further away which runs parallel to Gran Via. This hotel is a real find, especially if you can get it at a rate as good as that which I found. But even if at a higher rate, we'd highly recommend the Soho Barcelona, in all its aspects. And Barcelona itself is really a fascinating destination. Our days (2 full days and until about 500 p.m. the third day) were filled from early each morning, until late each night. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, clean friendly hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: ddocphiladelphia
Reviews.Content: Prevented from flying home from our cruise on 4/18/10 by the volcanic ash, we hustled to find a hotel in Barcelona. Luckily, we found the Soho and its staff. We were a group that needed 6 rooms and they welcomed us with open arms at a fair price. Hotel is clean, modern, conveniently located, and offeres a great breakfast plus free access to the computers. The staff couldn't have been any nicer even extending our stay when needed. We got a great value and I will stay there again when I go to Barcelona in 2011. Thanks to all, especially the manager, Asun.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel with amazing service”
Reviews.Author: af1977
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three days on our first visit to Barcelona. The hotel is in a great location and the rooms are very modern and very comfortable. But the best part of the hotel was the friendly and helpful staff, especially Johan at the front desk. He was the most helpful front desk person of any hotel I have ever stayed in! I would highly reccomend this hotel to anyone going to Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Volcanic Ash Stay - Soho Hotel, Gran View, Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: jbcosgrove
Reviews.Content: Recently the Barcelona airport shutdown due to the Volcanic Ash from Iceland. Instead of going home after our cruise as planned to Philadelphia on April 18, 2010, we had to scurry for a hotel. We were lucky to find this hotel with a wonderful, full breakfast for 110.00 Euros per night. The staff were all so kind to us -- everyone there, from the front desk to the housekeeping and kitchen people -- they were great. They extended our stay and did not charge extra as many of the hotels were doing at that time. The hotel was clean, reasonable with free computers and internet. I would highly recommend this reasonable, clean, nice hotel to anyone coming to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Sleek Modern Hotel in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: TwoGuysCalgary
Reviews.Content: Very modern styled hotel in the Eixample district of Barcelona close to all the great sights of this city, walking distance to everything. The hotel staff are very friendly and willing to help with directions. And the rooms are comfortable and very clean. Great beds with a great bathroom. All very modern designs with orange and grey every where. Breakfast was included and was an average hotel breakfast but served from 7 till 11 AM. Well worth money when staying in this great city.

Reviews.Title: “neat little hotel close to university”
Reviews.Author: angrylilazngrl
Reviews.Content: soho was a nice little place. the rooms are strangely super-modern, but otherwise clean and comfortable. front desk service is multilingual and very friendly, and breakfast is more than ample. free internet in the lower level was also a nice touch and the location is close to the university/urgell metro stops. recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Stylish hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: RichandKerry
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in March with my wife and 1 year old daughter. Booked online and got an almost immediate confirmation from the hotel itself rather than just the booking system which was nice. Also received reminder email close to the departure date. A baby cot was provided for us at no extra charge upon my emailed enquiry about one as well which was great. We stayed in a standard double room. The rooms are very modern with a funky design you'll no doubt read about in other reviews. I loved it personally. Even for our one year old toddling about the place they were pretty good although the tiled flooring is always a hazard over carpets for youngsters prone to taking a tumble. But no issues with us. Only minor problem was lack of storage in the rooms. There's one rack with a fair bit of coat hanger space but no drawers for underwear or t-shirts etc. Particularly tricky with all the baby stuff. Managed with the shelf space in the room (2 by the rack and a long space above the bed) but it wasn't ideal and would have been nicer to have been able to tidy it away a bit more. A price worth paying though I thought for the stylish room design. Location on the gran via is great and from there we managed to walk everywhere (Placa de Madrid and the fountain is 10 minutes walk, as is top of La Rambla). Hotel is pretty well soundproofed and heard minimal noise from other guests or outside. Breakfasts were very good as well (7-11am) with particularly nice fresh coffee and orange juice. The cakes were nice too if you're into your cafe und kuchen Deutschland style :-) Only other issue was lack of a bar in the hotel which might have been useful on occasions where we didn't want to wander out. There's limited room service (which we didn't use) but that's not quite the same. Can heartily recommend the bar at the nearby Casanova hotel as a close by alternative for a relaxing drink (even with baby in tow )

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, not so great experience.”
Reviews.Author: strangename
Reviews.Content: Smashing boutique hotel in a great position. Generally staff were excellent. But; my trip was to commemorate a 'special' birthday (one involving a zero) for my wife and was organised many months ahead, I swapped several confirmation emails over the intervening period and one just 2 days before my departure from UK. When I arrived the terrace room I booked was still occupied by the previous people "who wanted to stay another few days". I was demoted to a lesser room until they left two days later...BUT I'D BOOKLED THE ROOM, NOT THEM! My conclusion is that this was a commercial decision by hotel management, who didn't even talk to me about it at any stage. I was not happy. Very bad decision Soho - so be careful not to rely on your room booking.

Reviews.Title: “Best designed hotel I have ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: travellerfromvan
Reviews.Content: Excellent design and everything was clean and worked! Staff was very helpful & friendly. Breakfast was great - location was fabulous and price was good. Would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Very Chic - great find”
Reviews.Author: Mcd05
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay in this very chic minimalist hotel. We stayed in one of the 4 terrace rooms which had tons of space, very smart design, clever adaptable lighting and a fantastic terrace complete with smart chairs and sun lounger. There is also a sun terrace and plunge pool on the roof of the hotel. Breakfast good - a buffet style but everything you could want. Definitely strongly recommend. Also - a great tapas and fish restaurant imediately opposite the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: H75
Reviews.Content: Modern, design hotel at a good rate. We bought a package including tapas and wine on the terrace (recommended) and an upgraded room. The price for this was very reasonable compared to other similar hotels. The location is good, close to the metro. A trip to the beach for instance is easily done via the metro. The hotel has a great terrace on the top of the building with a small pool. The breakfast was plentiful and good.

Reviews.Title: “super hotel, great value and will definitely be returning”
Reviews.Author: GreenFrogiano
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Soho Hotel for a long weekend after reviewing many of the recommendations from this site and others. I was totally satisfied with everything the Soho delivered. We stayed in one of the four top floor bigger rooms which had a private balcony over looking the Grand Via. Yes the road is busy and, in the mornings, the road can be quite noisy but thats part of the experience of being in the heart of a vibrant and lively city. If you live in any city, you won't notice it, I didn't. The room was clean and well appointed with a large flat screen TV, seating area, mini bar, safe, and nice little touches like various different lighting options and remote blind operation for the bathroom and the floor to ceiling windows. The staff at the front desk and others we encountered during our stay were polite, friendly and always willing to help despite my appalling Spanish. Breakfast was included in the price of our room and was always good. They provided a buffet selection of hot and cold food; providing lovely fresh fruits, cereals, baked pastries, bread cold meats and cheeses, to hot scrambled eggs, bacon, sausages and more. In terms of location we felt it was perfect. Close enough to the center for walking distance to all the major sites but just far enough away from the 24 hour noise and bustle of las Ramblas and similar areas. And if you don't feel up for a walk in the morning, due to slight over indulgence the night before, Urgell Metro is 20 yards from the front door. This was a great hotel, don't go expecting 5* luxury, but I think it is under represented only having 3*s. We will be returning to Barcelona and we will be going back to the Soho Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Super fancy for no reason”
Reviews.Author: hitchdovar
