Reviews.Content: We were attracted to the flash of this place and oh it is flashy - the rooms are so cute high tech - the lights are on buttons that say warm and cool (I couldn't figure out how to work them) - the shower is open into the room until you press this button that closes the blinds. It's a cool place - and they have MTV Austria which has the funniest commercials in the world. It is right in the eixample so you are really close to gay bars and world class eating. But it is right by a public park that people really use - try to nap and there are school kids yelling at night more quiet, but sometimes dogs - make sure you get a room that is not near the walking entrance to that park and you should be fine - we weren't. It was a pretty good deal for money, although I will say no one told us that we were paying for breakfast everyday until we checked out which would have been very useful information. (I normally don't believe in taking breakfast at the hotel and would recommend old man bars in Barcelona for tortilla and cafe con leche, so cheap and delicious - but sometimes you're hungover and could go for easy conveniences that you had already paid for...)

Reviews.Title: “Great design hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ad_art
Reviews.Content: Soho is a great design hotel situated in the Gran Via very close to the Urgell metro station. I think it took as 5 - 10 minutes on foot to get to Placa Catalunia, Barcelona's central square. It' s not directly in the old city, but very very close to many major sights and the shopping area of Passeig de Gracia. The room was wonderfull and knitly clean (I especially liked the lighting and the glassed bathroom!), the bed was fine and there was no noise from outside as I read in other reviews (our room was in the back of the building). Breakfast was very nice also with a variety of stuff. The personnel was very kind and helpful, especially when we asked about places to eat at night (the girl at the reception told us about 2 places in Barcelona where we had our best meals). We didn't use the pool because it was very cold outside. Overall, it is an exceptional hotel with great design and well-priced (at least during winter season). If I return to Barcelona one day, I'm planning to stay there again...

Reviews.Title: “Great hip hotel in the heart of Barcelona.”
Reviews.Author: MissMartinih
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on the days before NYE as the weather in Madrid was so bitterly cold we decided to take the AVE to Barcelona to enjoy a milder climate. Weather was sunny and around 13-16C. The hotel has an incredible location in Barcelona's Gran Via and even though it's smallish it's very hip and truly comfy. I've stayed in many places in BCN (Silken, B-Hotel) and given the city's abundance of fantastic contemporary hotels we chose SoHo for its convenient location. The hotel's deco is chic and trendy although given the hotel's age (I believe it's only 4 years old) the fittings and features of the room are starting to look tatty in places. Some walls were dirty and damp stains where present in various places but that's the only bad point I can think of. The hotel is a little gem. The lighting in the rooms can be changed depending on your mood, they have a very cool lounge where you have access to computers (in addition to free wifi on the rooms) and the roof terrace has nice views and a adequate pool so you wont be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: LINHUS
Reviews.Content: Great hotel.Location only 10 minutes walk from las ramblas and boutiques.Room was clean comfortable and just perfect.Staff were very helpful. Breakfast was lovely. And price for the hotel was reasonable. As our flight was late in the evening they put our luggage into a luggage room which was excellent as we were able to enjoy our last few hours sight seeing and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Funky Design & Cool Gadgets”
Reviews.Author: Ohjustpeachy
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located within three min walk to Airport buses and about 15 to Las Ramblas. Getting the bus is easy and saves a lot on taxi fares, I'd highly recommend it. The staff are helpful and friendly. The lighting gadgets in the rooms were enjoyed by my oh and the bathroom design with see-through glass (can be blocked by blinds) is cool. The room is spacious and modern but if you can, ask for a room at the back because the front of the hotel is very noisy. We live in a city but still found the sirens and street noise woke us a lot. The free internet access is useful and the in-room safe is handy. The only downside was the breakfast which my oh found lacking; enjoying sweet breads etc for breakfast is my thing and he would have appreciated some cereals. Overall though it was a good stay and I'd recommend the hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel with helpful friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: WindyJoe
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Soho in late October. On checking in we were given an upgrade by Alessio. The room was modern & comfortable with mood lighting and a balcony . . Air conditioning worked very well and was quiet. Our room was at the back and generally was quiet. The breakfast was varied and was good. We found the staff friendly and helpful I woul definitely stay there again. Montserrat is breathtaking

Reviews.Title: “LOVE of SOHO”
Reviews.Author: fillelectrique
Reviews.Content: Finally getting around to writing reviews about our 3 week honeymoon in Spain - First stop was 6 nights in Barcelona at the SOHO Hotel. I read the reviews on SOHO, perfectly within our price range (mid-priced), super close to the metro (Urgell, red line), nice rooms, etc. The only hesitation is that it's not in the middle of of everything... but close enough, and that was good enough for us (we're not afraid of a little walking). We had a very clean street facing room during our stay; Queen bed; very cool/sexy see-though modern bathroom; flat screen TV; free WIFI. There was only once during our stay that street noise even bothered us - the local Bombers (Firemen dept) were having a protest/march down Gran Via, setting off flash-bombs. What a way to wake-up! We actually laugh about it now, for we originally thought it was a parade for the La Mercè festival. Of course there is nothing that the hotel could've done about this. The Positive: — Perfect amount of breakfast to get your day started; eggs, yogurt, cheeses, jamon, fresh fruit, coffee, juice selection, cereals, breads. — Great roof top view & very inviting-looking pool (it was too cold outside to use) — Modern/sexy hotel room — Fun decor throughout the hotel — Location - we felt safe in the area around SOHO and Gran Via, but we're also big-city folks. — Metro is right there! — Staff was always helpful and nice, even with our butchered Spanish. — It was raining for 2 days straight while we were in Barcelona, and SOHO lent us an XL umbrella to keep dry. That 1 small gesture sealed our LOVE of SOHO. The Negative: — Their hi-tech push button "Do Not Disturb" did not work in our room. Or we're too stupid to figure out how it worked. — No iron in hotel room. We had to call the front desk and ask for one. Then they only brought us the iron board. Miscommunication?

Reviews.Title: “Smart & Stylish”
Reviews.Author: Hotelero1
Reviews.Content: Our four night stay at the Soho was very comfortable and thoroughly enjoyable. Based on the recommendation of a previous post, we requested a corner room at the back of the building. It was a good choice as the road works were still happening at the front along the Gran Via. The corner rooms are more spacious and overlook a large interior courtyard, which was full of children playing and local residents chatting everyday from 5 to 7 p.m. The hotel is very modern, sleek and stylish. We loved the touch lighting, electronic blinds, vinyl flooring, the simplicity of design. The beds were very comfortable and the shower had ample hot water and pressure. Except for a few dusty spotlights, the housekeeping was excellent. Some might prefer to stay within the atmospheric yet tourist-mobbed Gothic Quarter, but Soho's location was perfect for us. El Raval and Las Ramblas were 15 minutes by foot, a metro stop was a half-block away, and the great restaurants and bars of L'Eixample were at our doorstop. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Slick, polished, beautiful, but a little loud”
Reviews.Author: jeffbnc
Reviews.Content: This little hotel is very stylish. There are many cool touches in the rooms, such as a range of mood lighting controls. Everything looks good and functions correctly. I love the modern art design and calm modern music in public spaces. The staff is friendly and efficient. Breakfast is delicious and plentiful with a variety of choices. I have just one warning. Noise is a problem, at least for our room, number 31. I am not normally sensitive to noise, but it is a real issue here. Conversations from people on the street and in nearby apartments are surprisingly loud. The open area in the middle of the building that our windows look onto somehow amplifies every noise from the surrounding area, even with the windows closed.

Reviews.Title: “Strange futuristic room, Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: DG55
Reviews.Content: This is a small hotel in a fairly central location on Gran Via, just a 10 minute walk from La Rambla. The idea behind this hotel is sort of like futuristic stylishness meets technology. The rooms are very small, with glowing orange lights running along the wall. Everything has been thought about and finished very well - everything lines up correctly, you'll find blinds integrated inside the windows, buttons to change the mood of the lighting (orange to blue), even buttons to switch on a 'do not disturb' sign illuminated outside. The bathroom is similarly sleek, with sliding doors and appropriately minimal fittings. Other features in the hotel include a very small swimming pool on the roof terrace, along with some shaded seating and sunbeds. This hotel is definitely unique in a way, its worth a look. The whole experience was a bit cold and uninviting, but that's only a minor point in a hotel which is otherwise fairly faultless.

Reviews.Title: “Hip Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HeidiwaxBrisbane
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at Soho Hotel. The staff were friendly and helpful and even gave us a room upgrade. The room was large and very comfortable, room service was fast and delicious and the breakfast was great. I also loved being able to chill out in the rooftop pool and lounge area. The only reason I've marked this hotel down is that although it was not too far a walk to the nearest metro, the hotel was not really in the thick of things. I wouldn't let that stop me from staying there again though as the good points more than made up for it.

Reviews.Title: “Details that counts”
Reviews.Author: Finpol
Reviews.Content: Like 'do not disturb' mark to place on the handle, lighting, bathroom, swimming pool, entrance to the hotel with interesting glass door ... Nice place to stay at. You can enjoy the fancy solutions all around you. Well-furnished rooms and very helpful personnel. The only minus is location, but you can't have all.

Reviews.Title: “Expected better”
Reviews.Author: chefshaw
Reviews.Content: The Soho is a nice, clean and modern hotel but just lacks a bit of personality, the rooms are dark and the whole feel is a little cold, the double bed was 2 single beds put together, with bedding that wouldnt of been out of place in a prison. With so many hotels to choose from in Barcelona i personally feel there is alot better out there at a similar price.

Reviews.Title: “Modern & Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: lrincon
Reviews.Content: Not a 5 star hotel, but fun and very stylish. The staff was not very helpful, but Barcelona is just a wonderful city, so curiosity takes you very far.

Reviews.Title: “Hip, clean and very centrally located hotel”
Reviews.Author: HornTraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 days for getting to know Barcelona. Modern, clean and well-equiped hotel room with availabilty of Wifi internet connection for reasonable price. Must admit: on 6th floor the signal strength was not very good. Good beds, nice bath and rather quiet whilst staying on the front side of the hotel above Gran Via. Tube station Urgell is right across the street. Located close to the Barri Gotic, Plaza Catalunya and Plaza d'Espagna. Breakfast is rather simple, but OK. Small swimming pool and lounge area available on the roof (8th floor). Open from 9 until 21 hrs. Unfortunately not open for early morning swim. Covers all needs, would stay there again absolutely.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Cool place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Brodiej
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights. Its situated right next to Urgell tube, so you can walk to the sea in 20 minutes or take the tube no problems. Rooms are super modern with lots of fancy gadgets and touches. Lovely rooftop plunge pool and terrace. Don't bother with breakfast, go over the road to Escriba and enjoy pastries and coffee for 10 euros for 2. Only moan was that they were digging up the road outside....if you're booking for now, ask for one with an internal view....you might not get a view of the Gran Via, but you will get a good nights sleep. We did.

Reviews.Title: “Unforgetable!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: akefala
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend proposed to me upon a Bus Touristic at Placa Catalunya ....How can I forget Barcelona? Soho Hotel , a very modern decorated boutique hotel was what we wanted. Room 65 was quiet, with nice view, very clean with all that mystic athmosphere that makes relaxing a great pleasure. The personell was very polite, never forget Alexio....I would stay back any time visiting Barcelona in the future!!!!!Anna, Athens Greece

Reviews.Title: “Good location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: helgeandreas
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Soho for 4 nights in the end of september. We did find the Hotel perfect for us and for our stay in Barcelona. The design and interior is exciting and quite modern. The room had a lot of space and contained all we needed. We did choose a room to the street. Traffic noise doesn't bother us. But if You are sensible of traffic a room on the back might be the best? But with room facing the street You can have a look at the Gran Via and watch "life" and notice the difference from morning - mid-day and night. We like that! We didn't have breakfast at the hotel. But there is a café/choccolateria/bakery right across the street. They have coffee/choccolate and all kinds of pastries. A perfect way to start the day. The location was perfect for us. Just a walk away from Plaza de Catalunya. Or a short ride with the metro. The nearest Metro station, Urquell, is less than 100 meters from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cool hotel, kind staff, in a classy area - wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: sandgb
Reviews.Content: Had a lovely post cruise stay here last week. Checked in early, as ship disembarkation was around 9am. Taxi from cruise terminal a breeze, around 15-20 euros. Erika and kind staff very efficient, very helpful with our suitcases, which they locked away, with a ticket system for retrieval. Made us relax and feel safe. Also a good safe, set in room wall, for our cash and passports - v. secure. Bed was large and very comfortable, room spotlessly clean, very boutique/modernistic decor, really cool! Small pool on roof, great lounging area with sunbeds and sofas to relax on, great retreat after hard couple of days exploring the city. We think the location, close to the University, is actually way better than Las Ramblas, as you are already in a cosmopolitan area, nearer to the classier shops at the top of Las Ramblas/Placa Catalunya. Easy for Las Ramblas, but also much easier to walk to the Passeig de Gracia to see the Gaudi buildings on the Ruta Del Modernisme, and the REALLY expensive shops!!! Breakfast was great, Soho is near many restaurants, and directly opposite one of the best/tastiest patisserie/pastry shops we have seen in a long time. The roadworks, prevalent all over Barcelona, seem to be almost completely finished last week, and should make access to the hotel even prettier and easier. Staff booked us a taxi to take us to airport which arrived smack on time. All in all, thanks so much Erika and all the staff for your kindness and for a wonderful relaxing stay - we heartily recommend the Soho!!

Reviews.Title: “Cool, Modern Boutique Hotel.....but bring earplugs!”
Reviews.Author: bobyankee
Reviews.Content: The Good Cool room, with push button lights and shades. Nice size room. Cooperative front desk. OK location. The Bad We asked for and received an early check-in time since our overnight flight arrived at 9 AM. After bringing our bags up to our room, we settled down for a much needed rest. As our heads hit the pillow, we were jarred by the sound of a jackhammer right outside our window. We called the front desk and were given a room on the back side of the hotel, which was quiet....until after 10 AM when the locals across from the hotel decided to have a loud party. We asked the desk if this was normal and they said that they have had to call the police before but it didn't do any good. No bellmen to cary luggage. Only two English TV channels (CNN and BBC).

Reviews.Title: “No double bed!”
Reviews.Author: BridB
Reviews.Content: The Soho is a very nice, clean and modern hotel but it lacks a bit of the 'personality' that Barcelona is not short of. It is stylish but feels impersonal. I could not fault the very charming and helpful staff and the room was spotlessly clean and very comfortable. I was disappointed to discover that the double bed was twins put together - no double bed - and we were too tired to requst a different room! So much for the romantic weekend! The breakfast was lovely and the staff were very prompt in replacing anything that had run out. There is a lounge but it was deserted both nights we looked in. We liked the hotel but if we were returning to Barcelona we would look for something closer to Ramblas and with a bit more atmosphere. (And a large double bed!!!)

Reviews.Title: “Great city break base with good design”
Reviews.Author: jools58
Reviews.Content: The room (32)was very spacious , light and quiet overlooking the small park at the rear. The road works continue at the front so it may be a little noisy there. We loved the design throughout the hotel but yes, only share a room with someone who is happy to be seen naked through the bathroom glass wall ! The breakfast was absolutely fine but it was included in our deal. The staff were helpful although we didn't need much assistance. The pool is tiny but the deck area looked very attractiveThe location is a plus and a minus - at times I felt it would be better to be somewhere slighter closer to the galleries, gothic quarter etc but my partner felt it was a big plus to be a little distant from the hubhub and in a more classy area. So everyone to their own taste.

Reviews.Title: “overall good hotel”
Reviews.Author: wendywuredhill
Reviews.Content: Great adult only hotel. Easy walking distance to the centre. Breakfast very good. Roof top pool lovely. Staff very friendly. Design of the hotel very funky. Only down side was it cost nearly 70 euros to keep the room from 12 to 5pm. But i would use it again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, fairly central and good service, value”
Reviews.Author: LisaRichmond
Reviews.Content: Overall very nice hotel and if it wasn't for the roadworks outside the front door (outside our window) our stay would have been fab. The hotel is clean, modern with great rooms. The roof terrace is gorgeous though there are only a few sunloungers so we never got a chance to use them as they were always in use by someone else. Breakfast was great. The only downside is the hotel car parking is very expensive and this wasn't communicated to us until we left and it was 40 euros for under 48 hrs Pls check with the hotel that the roadworks has ended as the drilling got very annoying!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: berg84
Reviews.Content: I could not have been happier with my stay at the Soho Hotel. The design is superb, definitely worthy of more than 3*. Huge bed, TV, floor space, and the toilet is quite funky yet functional. Great location, very close to some of Gaudi's greatest, as well as Mont Juic and the more touristy areas. True, there's some construction work taking place outside on Gran Via, but the drilling doesn't start too early and is hardly audible. Saying that, one of the rooms facing the cute courtyard at the back is probably the safest bet for guaranteeing peace and quiet. Try to get one of the corner rooms ending in 4. The pool on the roof, though small, is perfect for cooling down, and the large terrace area makes it all seem rather luxurious. So all in all, great hotel, you get more than you pay for, and I would highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: naomiruth83
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the last couple of days of our honeymoon and had a fantastic time. We were in room 75 with an amazing terrace. We were completely overwhelmed with how good the room was! Both of us had never been to Barcelona before and found this location to be just right. Its is walkable distance to most places, but there is a metro stop 5 mins away. So very quick and easy to get anywhere. The staff at the front desk were polite and very happy to help with any problems. The breakfast was included in the room price. It was served from 7-11am, which was great if you wanted to lay in! The food was very good with a wide selection, we were very impressed. It was regally refreshed during the morning. Even at 11am they brought out more food! I would absolutely recommend this hotel to friends and family, and would like to return very soon!

Reviews.Title: “Been twice, still puzzled over this great value4money hotel”
Reviews.Author: ANicolai
Reviews.Content: SOHO was rather new last year when we went there, due to location, price and the cool design judging from the pictures. I am sceptical usually to 3 stars, but this one is really good. Nice rooms, excellent location, cool design, friendly staff, room service/pool service and to a very reasonable price. Thats why we went back this year and was not disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel In An Excellent Location !”
Reviews.Author: Lucifair
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Soho hotel for 4 nights booking via the hotel's website a special winter offer inclusive of tapas, cava, late check out and free upgrade to Urban Room. The hotel is located in Gran Via, only 10 minutes walking distance to Plaza Catalunya and 15' to Plaza Espanya. In case you prefer not to walk, just outside of the hotel, there is metro station ''Urgell''. The room had a minimalistic and stylish look full of innovations. It was very spacious and was overlooking the back side of the hotel, so we did not faced any problems with noise. Breakfast was ok, although i had expected something more.. Staff was friendly, specially Alessio. Overall, it was a very good exprience, bearing in mind that is a 3star hotel ! I highly recommend Soho Hotel..

Reviews.Title: “Up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: TDmize
Reviews.Content: Located right outside of metro stop ‘Urgell’ on the L1 (red line). Taking the metro from the airport involved a few switches of lines. The hotel is great, very nice front desk people, greeting us and helpful with all questions. I personally liked the whole ‘futuristic/sheik’ look of the hotel, it was very different from any hotel I have ever stayed in. The rooms were great, flat screen TV, little desk area for my laptop (free WIFI in all of the rooms too). The bathroom was a little odd, with the see through shower and swinging door to the toilet. There is an ATM machine located right next to the hotel. Walking distance to La Rambla was probably 10-12 minutes. The only knock was the room was a tad on the noisy side at night (our room was on the backside of the hotel).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent !”
Reviews.Author: widdre
Reviews.Content: We chose the Soho Hotel because of the good reviews on Tripadvisor. We stayed for 5 nights and overall we are very happy with our choice. When arriving we asked for a room with streetview despite the reviews about the streetnoise. Indeed, if you are a bad sleeper, streetnoise can disturb your sleep. But, the streetnoise didn't keep us awake at all. The Soho Hotel is very trendy. The rooms have some funny technical surprises, and are cleaned very good. Although my girlfriend is very picky, even she found the breakfastbuffet was very tasty. The rooftoppool, although not very large, is very welcoming after a warm day full of sightseeing, shopping,... The location of the Soho Hotel is within walking distance to the Placa Catalunya (15min). There is a metrostop in front of the hotel. The staff was very friendly and helpfull. Overall, for us Soho Hotel was a very good choice and we would stay there again next time.

Reviews.Title: “Did not reach my expectations”
Reviews.Author: kateAndover_Hants
Reviews.Content: When we arrived on Tuesday we were greeted by friendly staff. I had been really looking forward to the trip as the reviews made it sound promising. We had booked a summer fun package which appeared to promise lots, such as upgraded room, tapas and late checkout, however these promises were not reached as much as desired. We were told our room would face a courtyard, this was not the case. We had a room, which although large and clean, it was facing the road, which was noisy even when the windows were closed and the tv was on.. We were told ‘that’s what happens when a hotel is on a busy road.’ My thoughts are, ‘maybe get some better sound proof then.’ In our package we were told we would receive tapas and cava on our first night. We were advised we had to phone 30 minutes beforehand to let them prepare. Over 90 minutes later, and after 2 phone calls; a sandwich, red wine, pringles and cold tomato bread (which was more like soggy toast) arrived. I complained as it was not what was not up to standard. I was told that they have served tapas lots of times, but I explained I have never had pringles with tapas before. We were then offered a refund. On top of this on our first night we opened the windows to get a better view of the city. However, on one of the windows a metal piece from the inside fell out and the window could not be shut. We contacted reception twice and they could not close the window either. They told us maintenance would come and fix it. We went out for the evening and when we arrived the window was still open. This made the road even noisier and the air conditioning was facing directly opposite the window, meaning the cold air was going straight outside. When I complained about the tapas I explained our room situation but they said there was nothing they were full so we could not swap rooms and maintenance would fix the window to which they did. The pictures of the pool on the website are extremely deceptive. It is only 90 cm deep and about 3 metres long, so we only went to use it the once. However, the shaded terrace was relaxing. Overall I think the hotel looked nice on the outside but looks can be deceiving. Staff, although friendly, could do little but apologise for any issues.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with amazing roof pool....”
Reviews.Author: Saffagirl82
Reviews.Content: Was very pleasantly surprised by this hotel. The staff were friendly and helpful, the room was lovely and clean and cool (just what you need after the heat of Barcelona!). The shower was absolutely divine but make sure you're sharing with someone you're comfortable showering in front of....We had breakfast included which was another great surprise as I had not read good things about but on our first morning walked into full cooked breakfast, fresh fruit, hams and cheese and gorgeous little pastries. Free wi-fi and internet access in the media room. The best part was the roof terrace with shaded area with comfy sofas and pool (not deep but very refreshing!) with deck chairs to fall asleep on. Big fluffy towels provided by hotel. The only draw backs I would say are that the lighting in the room is not great (I struggled to do my make up) and the staff were not entirely helpful when it came to suggesting places to eat (think that they get a commission from one restaurant which is the only one they suggest). BUT they were very helpful with keeping our bags before check in and after check out and even let us chill by the pool after check out when we were waiting to go to the airport. Reasonable for what you get and about a 5-10 minute walk to La Ramblas and 20 min bus ride to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoHydrangea
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 6 nights while traveling for business and pleasure. The rooms are very fun, and the bed is super-comfortable. If you're sharing a room, make sure it's with someone you don't mind see you shower. The staff were very friendly, helpful and speak excellent English. The breakfast was great--plenty of fresh fruit, yogurt, breads/rolls, cheese, etc., as well as juice, water, coffee and tea. My room looked out over a courtyard, and was pretty quiet; there are also interior rooms and rooms that face out directly onto the Gran Via. The location is great--right next to the Urgell metro stop, although I usually walked. You can walk to the Barri Gotic within 10-15 minutes, and the Born in 20 mins or so, depending on your pace. Eixample, the Raval, the Ramblas, and everything else is really quite walkable from the hotel. The rooftop terrace with small pool is a great area--perfect for relaxing/soaking after a long day of walking, etc. The Soho is a notch above most 3-stars in Spain, and should really have a higher ranking, imho. I would recommend this hotel to both business and leisure travelers, whether you're on your own or with so/family/friends.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT for honeymooners!!”
Reviews.Author: Lovebird09
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Spain for our honeymoon and the first city we visited was Barcelona. Since it was our honeymoon we booked our hotel way in advanced. Right away we were greeted by a very friendly receptionist who booked our hotel room and gave us a complimentary upgrade!! This hotel is very chick and modern and the service is AMAZING; The staff is knowledgeable about Barcelona and its surrounding cities and give the best tips and advice for eager travelers. It is walking distance from the Univesity of Barcelona, thus the surroundings are full of restaurants and bars. It is about 3-4 blocks away from Las Ramblas so it is close to the center of activity but you don't get the hustle and bustle of people being loud in the street. The breakfasts are DELICIOUS, they have absolutely everything that you can imagine from eggs to manchego cheese. It has a cyber lounge were you get free internet access 24/7. The rooms are very modern and comfortable, fully equiped and very spacious. WE HIGHLY RECOMEND this boutique hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, nice look and amenities”
Reviews.Author: sameoldg2
Reviews.Content: The Soho is a great choice if the price is right and you're going to Barcelona. The hotel is only a few years old and the touches are incredibly chic and modern, and the location cannot be beat. Your room has dark hardwood floors, a bathtub and shower, floor to ceiling windows, a great bed, and automated lighting and blinds controls (this is really excessive but a great novelty). Of course there is a flat screen TV, and of course it only carriers standard definition channels (someone let me know when they find a hotel that carries HD content!), and as with other hotels in Spain there are no tissues. I also for some reason had a really hard time with drainage in both the sink and the bathtub (in the bathtub, even if I removed the stopper the water wouldn't recede from the tub for more than 10 minutes after a shower). The hotel also has a roof deck with a pool and covered seating area - this is a great way to relax after a day of sightseeing in the summer Barcelona heat. The breakfast was included in my rate and it was underwhelming but I didn't expect much. The hotel is right on Gran Via, which means it is super convenient (walking distance to central areas and metro is right on the corner) but it also means that a street-facing room gets lots of noise at all times of the day (Barcelona never sleeps!). This wasn't a big problem for me because I was so tired every day that I slept through everything but this section of Gran Via seems to be a popular ambulance route, so do be aware of that. Overall, definitely a great place to stay in Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Ultra Modern Hotel with the best ever staff that's tucked in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: Ready2GoNArkansas
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Soho and enjoyed every aspect of it. The friendly and helpful staff, the ultra modern style, the fantastic breakfasts, and the central location. We had a great experience and felt the need to express this in a letter to Hotel Soho. I am including it here so that you can see just how lucky we were to have stayed in this hotel..... "...Dear Hotel Soho and NN Hotels, We feel the need to tell you how impressed we were with the exceptional job performance of Caroline Gasquez at the front desk during our recent stay for the week starting 20May2009 and ending 26May2009 at Hotel Soho in Barcelona, Spain. Caroline was remarkable and went above and beyond our expectations in helping us throughout our stay, but most importantly on our departure. After we left Hotel Soho on 26May2009 and we were checking in at the airport, we realized our camera and camera bag with all our vacation pictures of beautiful Barcelona and Spain were missing. We had no idea where we had left it? In the room? In the lobby? In the taxi? My husband contacted Carol Gasquez at Hotel Soho to check the room and lobby and she immediately contacted the taxi company and found the driver who fortunately had our bag. Carol not only located our camera bag, but then made the arrangements to have it sent back to us via friends we had still staying there. It was remarkable that she was able to find our camera and get it back to us! For this, we are very grateful! Without her help we would not have been able to communicate fast enough with the taxi company to find our camera and still be able to catch our plane and continue with our vacation plans. As a result of Carol’s help, we were able to board the plane knowing that she had found and would return our missing camera and bag. Thank you very much for employing people like Carol! As a direct result of her willingness to help, combined with our overall experience at Hotel Soho Barcelona, if opportunity arises, we will plan to stay there again or at another NN hotel. Gratefully yours, Gary and Michelle ...."

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel in ok location.”
Reviews.Author: vason
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights here and overall felt it was just a little above average. The hotel and room were very clean and the location was not bad but a little bit of a walk to central Barcelona and the Gothic district. Our room was on the 7th floor facing inside with no kind of view but we asked for this so as to not hear outside street noise at night. The room was average size and very modernistic with lots of electronic gizmos for the lights and blinds. My main problem with this hotel was the room lighting, it was very dark in the room even with all the lights on. The bathroom was ok but again the lighting was not great and the design was just odd. Breakfast was decent and included in the price that we got. Internet use was free and with no wait every time we went to use it. The rooftop deck with pool was relaxing and a nice touch. The staff at the front desk could have been a little more helpful when asking for restaurant recommendations and such. Another thing to note is that we took the airport shuttle bus from Plaza de Catalunya to the airport for a little more than 4 Euro per person instead of taking a taxi which would have been around 30-40 Euro. The plaza is a 5-10 min walk from the hotel. Again, a nice hotel but I would maybe stay at a hotel that is more central next time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, decent location, nice room, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: LA-DCguy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the SOHO for 5 nights. I booked the trip directly with the hotel and found that was the best price (it was more expensive through other websites). We upgraded to a balcony room which was great. It wasn't that much more a night and our room was big. We were on the back of the hotel, which made it quieter (though the view is nothing special). But the balcony is nice and relaxing and large. We had to move to a smaller room for our last night and that room was nice too. It was on the front of the building, which was a little louder but we still slept fine. It is very modern, with all kinds of lighting options. Both rooms have covered glass walls between the room and the bathroom, and pocket doors, so the sound privacy is not great for those who like a little more privacy in the bathroom. Also, the amenities they give are a little cheap--might have expected more from this class of hotel. The bed was more comfortable than most we encountered in Spain--not as hard as our other hotels. The location is both good and slightly challenging. You can walk to a lot of places and the metro stop is just steps from the hotel. But it is a bit farther from parts of the older city and the shopping districts than it looks. We definitely got a lot of exercise. Ideally, it would be located about 4 blocks closer to the placa de catalunya. It isn't , so knowing that is good for setting expectations. It is, however, right across the street from an Escriba pastery shop, which was a must stop every morning for the best pastery in town. Oh, and I don't agree at all with the suggestion that it is an unsafe area--this is completely false. We always felt safe and never saw anyone menacing at any time of day or night. The staff is friendly and tried to be helpful. They do not have a concierge so restaurant recommendations were not that good. But we had done our own research and found great places nearby for meals. They did call places for us and make reservations, which was nice. The night team did seem to get overly worked sometimes, but we never got locked out and never saw the front door locked even when we got home very late. Our one big hiccup was with the laundry. Not surprising, it is very expensive, but the form is very confusing. We thought we were marking wash only, but because of how the sheet is set up, they thought we were asking for our socks and underwear to be ironed. in fact, when we first read the laundry prices, it looks like socks and underwear are free, but that is not true. In the end, they understood that they had made a mistake and didn't charge us for ironing. On a related note, however, they do not have an iron in the hotel that you can use (not one in your room or even from housekeeping) meaning that you HAVE to pay them to iron. This was a sore point for us and we looked for a cheap iron to buy but then decided to just be a little messier than we'd have liked. Tip for the hotel: 4 and 5 star rooms have irons! We did end up eating breakfast twice in the hotel. It wasn't bad--nothing fancy, but it worked when we were very rushed. The food was fresh, which is better than we saw at some other places. I'm sure that restaurants down the block have better choices for less money. The free internet downstairs was great. We rarely had to wait for a computer, though they might want to add one or two more just in case. The pool looked great on the roof. Unfortunately, we never used it. Barcelona has too much to do and see!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Soho Hotel *****”
Reviews.Author: kwstas
Reviews.Content: I were with my best friend in Barcelona a few days ago. We stayed in Soho hotel for 5 nights. We had a really good time in it.The hotel is very close to metro station (Urgell) and 7 minutes walk from placa Catalunya and La Rambla. As the building’s decoration has very modern line, as the rooms too. Our room was very comfortable with a lot of facilities, as we had asked at our reservation.The view from the window (in Gran Via) was excellent. The staff was really convenient and very polite to us. We are very pleased from our stay there and i would like to recommend Soho hotel, to everyone who want to have a great stay in Barcelona. Many thanks to all staff!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: Rinkman
Reviews.Content: Nice modern hotel....Balcony was a nice touch to our room. Breakfast I thought was a pretty good way to start the morning....Ours was included. I wish the poll was open a bit longer and that there was "a small bar" maybe up there but that is really being picky! I cant say I liked the location as if I ever went back to Barcelona (which I doubt) I would stay near the Born district....walking to Born from here at night takes you by way to many shady areas....

Reviews.Title: “not impressed, not recomended for female travelers”
Reviews.Author: bigdreams2008
Reviews.Content: rooms: small, confusing, trendy/futuristic, minimalist, very masculine, lots of metal, neon lighting, some toiletries (we expected more for the price we paid), confusing when trying figure out how to turn off lights, unplug the sink and bathtub, hidden buttons everywhere in the room- weird, not fun to figure out if you arrive late and are tired, bathrooms are not very private -doors do not close all the way- so you can hear when someone is doing their "business" loud and clear- wouldn't recommend for a romantic vacation, room 35 is missing thier safety lock box internet- free wifi! good bonus, two computers available for free use roof top terrace- nice atmosphere, didn't try out the pool but it locked enticing package deal: breakfast included - kind of gross with a small selection of items, but was able to find a couple things to snack on. The tapas and wine included- really liked this, good selection of items and the wine was pretty good, it would have been perfect if it included water also, since it doesn't come with it. staff: okay but could have certainly given better advice. they told us the best way to get to most of the sights was to walk, this would have been fine but thier location is pretty far away from everything, 30 minute walk to Casa Batllo, almost hour to sagrada familia, remember you also have to walk a lot once you get to the sights. We were there long enough to get smart- our advice is to use the metro to get everywhere- it is faster, inexpensive, and will save your feet and energy to enjoy yourself more in barcelona. location: we wish would not have booked this hotel because of this. they are not exactly in good place, didn't feel that safe and was far from the sights. My suggestions is to find a hotel located on or next to the "Passeig de Gracia" street- lots of shops, restaraunts, casa batllo, and casa mila located on this street. If you find the right place near these sights you will also be closer to plaza catalunya than where the SOHO hotel is located. Also, there was a lot of construction going on in front and behind this hotel- which made walking to and from the hotel tricky. eating breakfast outside on their bottom terrace was loud- not a very nice out door atmosphere for enjoying a meal- ugly view behind the hotel. you can choose to sit inside if you want. tip: take the bus from the airport to Urgell & Gran Via; it is really easy to get there even with luggage, it is only 4.25 euros; take a taxi on the way back to the airport though- bus doesn't have the same route 1st impression: we let them know we would be arriving late. When we arrived around 12:30pm they had locked the door to get into the hotel and there was no one at the receptionist desk. I have never had this happen before in all my travels. The neighborhood didn't appear to be the safest, with several drunkards walking by and giving us trouble while we had our bags in hand. It was quite scary to show up to find our hotel closed. We decided to look for another way to get into the hotel. We walked around the front entrance into the basement parking garage and found another door that was also locked. we dialed the receptioist desk several times via the key code machine located next to the parking garage door to the hotel. I eventually sent two emails to the hotel letting them know we were standing outside. A anonymous man in the garage offered to help us by stading at the front door while we stood in the parking garage. After 20 minutes the receptionist finally answered the line and unlocked the door. Needless to say we were furious with this welcome and asked the receptionist where he had been. He stated he was helping someone with thier key to their room and stated he had only been away for five minutes. It was frustrating to to find out they lock the door at that time of night and that the receptionist can be called away at anytime to help someone in the hotel, where in which he has to lock the front entrance when he leaves. They could have put up a sign letting us know or better yet higher another employee to man the desk at all times. Needless to say, we always came back to the hotel at a decent hour for fear we may be locked out again at strange hour of the night. The next day another staff member at the reception desk asked us about our experience and let us know that is just the way they do things at the hotel and was nice to us about the unfortunate experience. They sent a small box of chocolates up our room with card apologising to us, which was a nice gesture.

Reviews.Title: “I had expected more”
Reviews.Author: BBestate
Reviews.Content: We visited the Soho Hotel in May 2 adults and 2 teenagers. I have a year ago visited B- Hotel and was very pleased with the service, the decoration and the breakfast. Soho has a better location closer to the centre of Barcelona, so that is why we picked this. We felt that the service was very general, they did not bother so much. The first morning we asked for a Cappuccino and we were told that it was not possible; we could take coffee from a can at a table. The staff at breakfast did not want to make it, but we insisted and got it the next day from a very ignoring waitress. We asked the desk for reservation for a restaurant for the next evening, and we were told the following afternoon late - that "by the way, it was not possible to get reservations". The girl at the counter was much more interested in watching her computer than to help us. Soho has as many of the other NN Hotels in Barcelona an area with pool and nice chairs at the top of the roof. But no service here either, that is a shame. I had expected more after my 1. Stay at NN hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Boutique Hotel in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: VAVoyager1008
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Soho Hotel last week and it was terrific. The hotel is stylish and immaculate and the staff was friendly and helpful. There are two computers available in the downstairs lounge area, and we appreciated being able to check our e-mail and various travel confirmations so easily. We had a superior double room, which was very comfortable. We were at the back, overlooking a park. Aside from a little basketball-playing in the late afternoon (and the understandable celebration when Barca won their important soccer match), it was nice and quiet. Breakfast was included with our rate, and it was quite good and also very attractively served. The hotel is conveniently located one block from the Urgell metro stop and just an 8-10 minute walk from Universidad and Catalunya squares. We actually ended up just walking to most sights- Nothing was more than an hour walk and it was fun to explore the city that way. The blue airport bus has a stop at Urgell, and it was great to be able to step out from the terminal and find our way so easily and inexpensively.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique-style hotel - very Cosmopolitan feel..”
Reviews.Author: VWCamperVan
Reviews.Content: We looked very carefully at the other Trip Advisor reviews before booking this hotel. By and large, the other reviews were pretty accurate. I am a designer by profession so am fussy when it comes to hotels but I was pleasantly surprised how good this place was although the slightly quirky design features may not be to everyone's taste (for me, I thought they were great). A few complaints only: Our room faced the Gran Via and was a little noisy on the one night (there had been a football match in the centre that night). Not the hotel's fault. There were no in-room tea / coffee-making facilities so we had to rely on room service which was a bit of a pain. There was no in-hotel bar as such.

Reviews.Title: “Very trendy hotel”
Reviews.Author: ronadebra
Reviews.Content: Great friendly staff, large room, extremely clean, nice breakfast and near enough to sites for convenience but also not on top of them to make the right in hotel the center of Barcel hustle. Maybe being a little older I found the room's lighting a little dim especially to apply make up. Also a little too minimalistic for my taste. Construction and road work noise was annoying but the fault of the hotel Bed was comfy and flat screen tv a nice touch Also liked the free internet we enjoyed the roof top to relax and also since my husband smokes. we did not know it was a smoke free hotel until we checked in.

Reviews.Title: “A practical and classy place to stay in the Grand Via. More like a boutique hotel.”
Reviews.Author: marzuaga
Reviews.Content: Some of the front desk staff are very friendly and accessible. Others fall short of that description. Nice pool/roof top deck.

Reviews.Title: “Great little place - but more of a posh B&B”
Reviews.Author: Lucy_Jones
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and there were things we liked and things that we found weren't so good. We loved the funky rooms and bathrooms, the rooftop deck and the location (just far enough away from the centre of things to be less frantic, not too far to make it a trek). We also thought Alessio on the front desk was brilliant - his restaurant recommendations never failed us and he had an amazing ability to juggle everyone's demands (no mean feat given the front desk staff seemed often to be there alone and have to act as room service/concierge/check in desk all in one). Not all the front desk staff were as consistently good. Things we didn't like so much: 1. The room lighting. Ok, so its funky and that's great, but you still need to be able to see in the mirror to put make up on/have a shave. 2. Breakfast. Which was generally ok but could have been better e.g why not fresh coffee instead of a vacuum jug, more choice of fresh fruit (one day there was only fresh pineapple and tinned pineapple), better quality yoghurt, another choice of juice other than orange etc. Breakfast was not included in our rate and we did feel a bit short changed paying extra for it. 3. Lack of services. This was our main gripe. There is no restaurant, bar or lounge area where you can get drinks or snacks - not even a can/snack machine, coffee machine or water dispenser anywhere we could find. The lack of a restaurant is not really a problem as there are loads of places to eat nearby. But it would have been nice to have had somewhere to get a drink/snack. A basic room service menu is provided - but with a €5 charge for delivery to the room (or €4 to the pool) its uneconomic to use it just for a beer or a tea/coffee. The only other source of refreshment is the in-room minibar - which we did use and was fairly reasonably priced by minibar standards but was only replenished once a day. There were no tea/coffee making facilities in the room. We were out quite a lot and so this wasn't a major problem but it contributed to our feeling that this was really more of a B&B than a hotel - admittedly a very smart one - as the facilities were quite limited. There is a seating area on the pool deck and a small area with a TV and four chairs downstairs on the lower ground floor. There are also two computers there with internet access (but no printers - although anything to be printed can be emailed to the hotel and they print from reception). Would we stay again? Possibly, provided the rates were good - and I'd try to get a rate that included breakfast next time.

Reviews.Title: “excellent manager”
Reviews.Author: Patti417
Reviews.Content: I was interested in staying at the Soho and made an inquiry via e-mail. Ms Lopez, the manager, responded promptly with an excellent offer. She was extremely nice, informative and helpful. Unfortunately, I'm a smoker and decided not to stay at this smoke-free property. Foolish, I know, because if Ms Lopez is indicative of the quality of the Soho, it must be a wonderful place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great value choice in Barca”
Reviews.Author: bigbadbob77
Reviews.Content: Just as advertised and more. Trendy, minimalist but with everything you need, great location, great included breakfast, free fast internet, and excellent price. Close to Plaza Catalunya (4 blocks) but not on top of it. We arrived in early morning, they stored our luggage and by the time we returned, it was placed in our room. Buffet breakfast to suit all tastes--lots of cold cuts, fresh fruit, pastries, eggs and bacon, fresh hot coffee. David, the evening clerk, was VERY helpful. Able to walk to great restaurants and back each night. We'd definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great design hotel in a great design city”
Reviews.Author: thepolarbeer
Reviews.Content: Thoroughly enjoyed our stay in the very funky Hotel Soho. Very cool design flavours, well fitted and thought out, fully automated room controls, great bathrooms. Rooftop deck and pool provides good space to enjoy. Very helpful staff, committed to finding the best option for guests. Well located on Gran Via, close to tube and well positioned for exploring most parts of the city. Ten Euro taxi to the bottom of La Ramblas and the waterfront. Moderate noise levels. Double bed option is two single beds pushed together, made up separately

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: EireSonya
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay in! Excellent location, price (with breakfast, though booked a month ago), room service, breakfast, nice and helpful, yet not pushy at all staff. Quite quiet area. Design is really awesome and tech-y.

Reviews.Title: “Would not mind paying more for a better hotel”
Reviews.Author: cendut
Reviews.Content: Having searched trip advisor for Hotels in Barcelona, we found two prime candidates: 1898 and hotel soho. What really lured me was the price. Booked almost three months prior, we got excellent prices, plus breakfast! The staff were not as helpful nor friendly as said on the reviews. Allesio was the best of the bunch, but we found him on checkout day, during checkout :( The others were a bit stiff, unfriendly, even compared to our previous hotel in Paris! Granted they work very hard, being your reception+concierge+room service all at one. The rooms were nice, we got the balcony rooms (with the word SOHO) but electrical problems were common! AC would turn on at 10 PM for 2 days (no we did not use/tamper the timer), the safe deposit box was constantly on 'low battery' so we did not use it, and on our last night (we stayed for 4) the moodlight system turned on by itself (we were sleeping with only the bathroom light on, then suddenly it was all red in the room, the HOT setting was on) about twice in the wee hours of early morning - 3 or 4 am. No, we did not touch it. The location was ok, for the price, but there were constant sirens (police or ambulance) about 10 times every day during our stay. We stayed there a day before champions league match vs lyon, but the sirens kept on blazing until 3 nights after the match. is it a 'dangerous' neighbourhood? On our last night, we went for dinner in zian pizzeria nearby (about 2 minute walk) and lo and behold, a guy with his head bleeding sat outside, with the manager and policemen attended to him. Now, is this a dangerous neighbourhood??? I would not mind paying an extra 40-50 euros a night for a hotel in a higher star rating (I think this was a 3 star) with the extra benefits and location. The breakfast was good though, and room service, although very limited, has some nice sandwiches. And the free internet was great! Room too dark though. And I'm only 28.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel! my home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Ukaisrael
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend took me to Barcelona as a surprise for my birthday He knows my attraction to boutique hotels (I also work in a boutique hotel in Jerusalem, Israel) and his choice was really the best! We liked the location, the service, the breakfast, the computers area and the room (#64). We also liked the restaurant- Iurantia which was part of the romantic package and return there the day after as well... We will recommend the hotel to all our friends and we will be back to this amazing hotel next time in Barcelona for sure!

Reviews.Title: “design hotel near the university and placa catalunia. Try it!”
Reviews.Author: girl_in_litte_oslo
Reviews.Content: We were very excited to see what this design hotel was like. And what met us was just great. Friendly and professional service, an inviting, quite large room with everything very clean and nice, and of course, the design. I would not have chosen the designer solutions for my own home, but for a few days it`s just funny and really exciting to try. We were sorry it wasn`t warm enough to take use of the swimming-pool on the roof. Breakfast was nice too, and I would definately go back next time!

Reviews.Title: “Sensational Soho”
Reviews.Author: Tracy15
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Barcelona and stayed at the Soho pre and post cruise. Awesome hotel and location.....The staff is amazing and very helpful! Thank you Carol and Erica for making our group check in of 28 so smooth! Excellent location, easy walk to Las Ramblas and lots of restaurants! Great choice! everyone in our group raved about it! Tracy Destiny Tours , Guelph Ontario

Reviews.Title: “wonderfull hotel, amazing staff!!”
Reviews.Author: shannonw
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights at the end of February, got the Ryanair flight so didn't arrive until about 11.30 to the hotel. When we arrived we just went upstairs got changed and then said we would ask the receptionist, Alessio, for a recommendation for somewhere to eat, he was so helpful and recommended the perfect place, a ten minute walk with beautiful tapas and a great atmosphere. We were delighted it was just what we wanted. During the daytime, we walked from the hotel every morning, it was the perfect location to everywhere and the metro is just outside the door. Every night of our stay we asked Alessio at reception to recommend a restaurant, and every night he had the perfect place, he was just so helpful, couldn't have been nicer. He pretty much made our stay as good as it was! I would definatly recommend this hotel, our room was not noisy at all because it was at the back and it was in a great location, but the best part of the hotel was the brilliant helpful staff, especially Alessio!

Reviews.Title: “OK stay”
Reviews.Author: SamMaes
Reviews.Content: We are currently at the hotel SOHO. It´s location on the Gran Via is very easy to explore the city, and a metro stop is next to the hotel. The room is modern and OK. We have an urban room on the street side is quite noisy. The breakfast is OK, not a very huge assortment, but what they serve is OK, however despite all other reviews, we don´t find the breakfast staff very helpful... Even so for the reception staff, some are friendly and helpful, but not all of them... The only big minus is the so called ´lounge´... Nothing too see at all, only a little menu, and you need to make a phonecall for service. Lots of room for improvement there... I would recommend this hotel to friends because it good location and price, but I think I´ll stay somewhere else next time...

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great position, great rooms”
Reviews.Author: elliotjackson84
Reviews.Content: 8 minute walk to Passage de Gracia and Rambla de Catalunya so its positon is perfect. The rooms are modern, stylish, comfortable and good value. The best thing about the stay was the helpfulness of the staff. They provided tips on the best places to eat and drink as well as being very accomodating in helping us move rooms as the one we stayed in was a little noisy. If you are looking for a hotel as a base rather than one that you will be spending a lot of time in (i.e. as opposed to those with restaurants, spas and gyms) then this place is excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Cool and stylish, very well located, nice and friendly staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: gbmolinar
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights on a double room on the 6th floor facing the back of the hotel. With free wireless internet (not that functional thow, just enough for the basic stuff) The room was spacious and very well decorated, with a minimalist very actual and stylish look, very architectural and with cool design stuff! Located just a couple steps to the metro and 5 min.walk to all the action.

Reviews.Title: “Superb service, perfect location, great atmosphere, very nice rooms and delicious breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: HCBS
Reviews.Content: We visited this hotel with 33 persons from the Holland Casino Business School and have enjoyed it very much. The staff is great and the Hotel very special: modern and comfortable with a lot of extras on a excellent location with the Aérobus and metro right in front. Although the Gran Vía is a busy way you practically don't hear nothing because the rooms are very well isolated. Excellent value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Rooms, Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: hedylarue
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent four nights at the Soho and thought it was just great. The location is really nice. The Urgell stop on the Aerobus is just a couple of blocks away so it's easy to get to from the airport. Unfortunately, the bus does not stop there on the return trip so you would have to get to another stop or take a taxi. A taxi costs 25-30 Euros. It is close enough to walk to many attractions, but the Urgell Metro stop is right outside so you can also catch the train anywhere. I loved that it was so close to everything, but far enough away that you aren't constantly surrounded by crowds. The rooms are a bit dark, but they are a good size and comfortable. The bathroom was fully stocked with toiletries and housekeeping was good about replacing everything. There is no alarm clock, but the front desk is reliable for wake up calls. The Do not Disturb sign is actually a button next to the door...it's kind of funny. We were in an Urban room at the back on the 6th floor and although we could hear street noise during the day, it was very quiet at night. There are two computer terminals with internet that guests can use for free and there is also free Wi-Fi if you have your own computer. There is a very cool looking lounge and pool on the roof, but it's not heated so we didn't get to use it. The staff spoke perfect English and was very accomodating. I would absolutely go back to the Soho and recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Modern but noisy”
Reviews.Author: COgal7
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Soho following a cruise. The hotel is very modern, free wifi, interesting rooms, especially the lighting. The staff was very helpful, storing our bags securely until check in. It is well situated, on the Grand Via close walking distance to the Ramblas, the University, and Casa Batillo. Lots of cafes and mix of locals and tourists. Other reviews mention the lack of soundproofing and I found this to be a real problem. We booked a Jr. suite and I asked for a back facing room off the street since we had an early flight and wanted to get to bed early. Unfortunately we could hear the people in the park like they were in our room and we could hear our neighbors' conversations word for word. Every toilet flush, every cough. Even the earplugs didn't help. I'd recommend the Soho for those who can sleep through anything. The Monte Carlo is right on the Ramblas, but it proves that a soundproofed room can be quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Design over function”
Reviews.Author: FrequentTripster
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel...booked directly with front desk and was able to negotiate a better rate than on any web site. The hotel is well situated and no more that an easy 15-20 minute walk to most of the major attractions in BCN. It is also next to a metro stop making further distances easy to access. There are plenty of good restaurants in the neighborhoods adjacent to the hotel. Rooms are very stylish and are comfortable...the front desk upgraded me on arrival without my asking. The staff is very knowledgeable and helpful and resolved my one room issue quickly. The only downside (and it is a big one) is the level of street noise at night. Rooms facing the street are not well soundproofed and the hotel is close to a major hospital with lots of ambulances at night...so either request a room in the back or bring ear plugs...I used mine from the airplane.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: paikan07
Reviews.Content: I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone: great service, clean rooms, very nice design (and very nice swimming pool on the roof), almost no noise from the street, not far from the center and very close to the metro station! The only thing I didn't try was the food.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, but bring earplugs”
Reviews.Author: JackR46
Reviews.Content: Positive - Extremely friendly and HELPFUL staff (thanks Alissio). Good location. Close to a metro stop -beware of pickpockets!!! - or just a 10 minute stroll to the top of the Ramblas. Rooms (was given a different room after the first night due to "plumbing problems" in the first room) are reasonably spacious (although first room was larger and better laid out). Free computer use. Negative - Ineffective "soundproofing" of rooms. We could hear every footstep and voice as people walked down the halls. When people were opening the doors next to us, it sounded as if they were entering our room. Outside noises were such that it seemed as if we had the windows wide open, instead of all closed. Noise problem is not just the rooms facing the main street. Glad we brought along earplugs for sleeping.

Reviews.Title: “it worths”
Reviews.Author: cabaFlorence
Reviews.Content: Very modern hotel in a central postion. 5 min. walk from the metro station and 15 min. from plaza catalunya. the room w/ a modern and minimal design was confortable and very clean. In the bathroom maybe it should be a light on the mirror. Shaving was shady. The rate was good. Nice, young and very very helpful staff. They also gave us a backyard room, probably the rooms on Granvia are little bit noisy. I suggest it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: manos_xen
Reviews.Content: Except my luggage lost from Alitalia and my iphone robbery by a 5year-old kid(what's out the trick with the newspaper), the services and the stay in Soho Hotel was excellent, all the staff in the reception were very polite and the room-services very fast and very kind.Central location,marvelous design and bathrooms. Its worth every penny for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: vagzoi
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed for a week at SOHO.SOHO Hotel deserves every penny.Room well designed, service kept it clean every day,breakfast was plenty and in good quality (Fresh Orange juice, good ham and cheese,sweets e.t.c). Allessio and Erica at The reception have been helpfull in booking restaurants and providing useful information for the city.THANK YOU SOHO. ANGEL and Zoi

Reviews.Title: “Great value for low price!”
Reviews.Author: KennyMcKormick
Reviews.Content: First time in Barcelona and wanted to be close to city center. Location is great (10 minutes walk to La Rambla and to the main tourist Information Center where also all Tour Buses start). Hotel is great for a Romantic getaway and if you like some stuff to play around with in the room. You have a few buttons next to your bed that let you choose between hot/cold/normal lightning. Also the bathroom is very special as between the shower and the bedroom there is only a glass wall. In the glass there is a curtain though that can be closed electronically. Other pros: The Hotel was very clean, safe was for free, nice Flatscreen TV. Negative things: Only two English TV stations, doors and walls are not too thick so it can happen you wake up once in a while at night, The swimming pool on the roof could be amazing because it includes a whirlpool but in the winter it's not heated so you can't use it.. Overall a great experience especially for young couples. Cheers

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at the Soho”
Reviews.Author: carlbob
Reviews.Content: Stayed here before for one night while transiting, and loved it - so booked in for 4 nights this time when coming to Barcelona for a short city break. They didn't disappoint. The hotel decor is excellent, service friendly, breakfast tasty (although, in common with all hotels, probably a bit too pricey) and bed comfy. What more could you ask for? Definitely my first choice next time we're in town.

Reviews.Title: “Trying to be too hip in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Marie Jonathan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Soho in Barcelona on the evenings of November 29th and 30th. We paid 155.00 Euros per night for a veranda balcony room. (The room had a large veranda that overlooked the Grand Via - too bad that the weather was cold and rainy and therefore prevented us from utilizing this great feature.) Our rate also included breakfast for both of us. We must first confess that, as a couple who are north of 40 years of age, we are probably too old for this hotel. The hotel really feels like it was design for a younger audience. Great attention has been paid to the design of the room. But many of the features are a bit impractical. For example, there are three types of mood lighting that you can choose from for your room; however there is no real good lighting for reading a book in bed. All of the fixtures and furnishings of the room look great, but none were really comfortable to sit in. The tub is surrounded by glass so that your partner who is in bed can have a great view of you while you are in the shower – very sexy --- when I was 20 years old and a few pounds lighter than I am today. The single sink/vanity was a decent size for one person to get ready and apply cosmetics. The room and public spaces in the hotel were very clean. The bed was firm but comfortable. This small hotel is a winner because of the staff at the hotel. They were very helpful and very accommodating of every request we had. The breakfast was tasty and filling. We also made good use of the free internet terminals. The location is okay, as it is about a 1 kilometer walk to the Placa Catalunya. This is walkable if the weather is good. If the price is right, book this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fun over the top 'Austin Powers' style, great location, welcoming staff”
Reviews.Author: rwchicago
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel after I read other travelers' reviews here on tripadvisor and saw the pictures of the rooms. Also, it was well-located to the sites I wanted to see. I had a great stay - the room they gave me was just like the Austin Powers geeky-James Bond 007 look in the pictures, with different lighting settings (including "hot"), a see through shower wall (complete with electric venetian blinds). Lots of hot water by the way. There's also an outdoor pool and patio on the top floor that's pretty nice, although it was too cold in November to consider swimming. The hotel is in the "L'Eixample" district, right next to the Urgell subway stop, and within east walking distance to the Rambla and the Passeig Gracia (where Gaudi's houses are), and felt pretty safe. There were a lot of restaurants and shops on side streets. The staff was very, very helpful. Allessandro was especially top notch at the front desk, whenever I asked for directions or suggestions, he took the time to explain things to me and even looked stuff up on the internet that he printed out for me. (Note, there are also free internet computers that you can use and make printouts in the downstairs area.) I think it's an unusual, fun, reasonable cost and memorable hotel that's worth checking out.

Reviews.Title: “nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Coeury
Reviews.Content: We staid at the Soho for one night. Booked via internet. The price/rate was excellent (135€ for a deluxe dble room). Room was cosy and confortable. Even though small details not perfect. Nice to have Wireless free connection. Avoid tips from staff as it came out she gave us a totally touristic and overpriced adress (to wich we did not go hopefully but only walked by;). It seems they were working on reduced staff team. Avoid parking under hotel (overpriced 21€/night).

Reviews.Title: “Loved the roof terrace!”
Reviews.Author: scubagirlUk
Reviews.Content: I'd read reviews that said some rooms facing the road can be noisy so when I booked via the hotel's website I requested a quiet room if possible. I was very pleased that they were able to fulfill this request and give us a room at the side of the hotel, we heard no noise at all while we were there. The room design is very funky and cool, we had great fun trying out the different lighting effects within the first 5 mins of arriving in the room! It is a bit annoying that none of the bathroom doors shut completely, but not a major issue. Without a doubt the highlight of the hotel is the rooftop terrace - even on a freezing November day/evening! I can only imagine how nice the pool would be in the summer but we were happy to just sit up there and watch the sun set over Barcelona with a beer. Breakfast is good, and the free internet is a real bonus. We didn't see many bars/restaurants near the hotel which was a shame (but maybe we weren't looking in the right places!); instead we just headed to the Barri Gotic to eat and drink. Overall I enjoyed my stay in the hotel, it's in a good location for getting to the sights- about 10 mins walk to La Rambla, and there is also a metro stop right outside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Design and a Sign”
Reviews.Author: sobakasu
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights at the hotel in November 2008. Was glad that I booked one of the large balcony rooms (74) and was even more impressed by the wonderful metal and wood SOHO sign on the terrace ledge. The room itself was very well organised, with an excellent working/living space and a comfortable bed. Different lighting combinations could be set to make the room look warmer or cooler. Breakfast was included in the price and it was very attractively presented in a funky environment. Street noise was slightly annoying but this is to be expected on the Gran Via. I would definitely consider coming back to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “tasteful design but poor functionality”
Reviews.Author: Rebeca6
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights. The design of the hotel is tasteful but the functionality of the room design is poor. The wardrobes are small, there are no drawers, bathroom doors do not close properly and its glass walls flood the room with light if turned on during the night. What is worse, however, is the noise. The extremely busy avenue is well heard inside the rooms that are far from sound proof. So, expect to hear cars, ambulances and police cars all through the night. Location is not too bad, if you consider taking the underground. The feeling is really of too much design to poor return in comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Soho is THE BEST!!”
Reviews.Author: cruzluvers
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 4 days (a precruise stay in Barcelona) at this wonderful "funky" hotel after reading the great reviews on Trip Advisor and finding almost all comments to be true. I cannot thank David Iturbi (at the Front Desk) enough for all the help he gave us. First, he recommended the Romantic Package which was a much better deal than the original regular room booking we had made online. It came with a complementary hearty buffet breakfast every morning, a bottle of Cava and Chocolates in our room , a delightful dinner around the corner at Iurantia with Wine AND an upgrade to a beautiful Terrace Room. David also helped us with making reservations for 18 of our fellow Cruise Critic folks who met for a precruise dinner the night before we sailed at a great local (non-touristy) restaurant, the Taverna cam Margarit. Would have been hard for us to do from the US since they didn't open until 9pm Barcelona time and didn't speak much English. All in all, a great time was had by all. We found all of the Front Desk staff to be most helpful with suggestions and directions. Hotel Soho cannot be beat for value and great ambience. WE WOULD DEFINITELY STAY THERE AGAIN!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, good location but not prefect!”
Reviews.Author: globaltraveller12
Reviews.Content: Having stayed here for a long weekend earlier this month I found it to be of a general high standard with a few problems. The 'Pro's' for me were the all the high tech gadgets in each room and the contemporary and modern style of the hotel. I felt the service was good and the free access to the two computers with free internet was a welcome extra, I find most European hotels now charge for use of the internet!. The biggest 'con' for me was the constant traffic noise from the Gran via (a major road through the city) this eight lane highway is situated right outside the front lobby. I will assume that rooms situated at the back of the hotel are probably much quieter so I would try and request one. Having stayed on the front side of the hotel I found myself unable to get any sleep, perhaps people used to traffic noise would be ok but I'm used to living in the countryside!. Having no sleep was obviously going to be an issue with a day full of busy sightseeing, so I had to visit reception the following morning and after initially seeming to be a little uninterested the gentleman was very helpful and moved me to a quieter and larger room. I can't say there is much else to be 'wary of' staying here, perhaps a few more English channels would be nice, there seems to be a large proportion of German and French channels and BBC world can get a little boring at times!! It might have been nice to use the pool, but I guess it's normal procedure to close it doing the winter. Apart from this a gym and spa would be a nice bonus, but if you want a good base for sightseeing the location is ideal. I have attached three photos of the Hotel : Photo 1- Shows the stylish front of the building from the Gran via. Photo 2- Is a typical scene from just outside the front lobby of the busy Gran via. Photo 3- Is a typical standard double room at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: us_LN
Reviews.Content: Hotel SOHO Barcelona is excellent. The room was clean and spacious. The service was top notch and courteous. The breakfast was very fresh and provided many options.
