The location is great for access to various parts of the city, and just a short & safe walk to the Barrio Gothic area. I've been to Barcelona 8 times now...love the city...and will definitely return to Hotel SOHO Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “What a great stay!”
Reviews.Author: VancouverJennifer
Reviews.Content: We were in Barcelona for the last 10 days of October 2008, staying at the Soho Hotel, which is one of the Núñez i Navarro Hotels in Spain. The hotel's location was very good, near one of the universities and 2 of the major shopping areas - lots of action close by & I did not have too much trouble finding my way around (with a bit of help from the Concierges), even though it was my first time in the city, and I was on my own for a bit, as my partner was at a conference for a few days. The property is an approximately 50+ room boutique hotel, and to be honest, this being my first trip to Europe, and having worked in management for a large high-end hotel in Vancouver, BC (Canada), the Soho definitely surpassed my expectations! It is a very well taken care of property - extremely clean, beautiful, kind of funky, but still fairly minimalist (which we liked), and our room had some nice features and was quite spacious for what we booked. The rooftop terrace was also a perfect place to spend a couple hours in the afternoon when the weather allowed, reading a book or whatnot - good view of the city as well. The breakfast set-up was also very well done, set up in the restaurant from 7-11am, and included in our room charge. It was not just continental, but included some hot items as well as fruit, yogurt, cereal, pastry, etc. - very substantial (healthy & not-so healthy) and items were refilled in a timely manner. The service was outstanding, including the Housekeeping, but especially the Front Desk/Concierge service, in particular Alessio and Erica, who were very informative, patient, gracious and had some excellent recommendations of restaurants and events that really helped to make our trip! They also helped us procure tickets for a "football" game, and a flamenco show, both of which were a lot of fun. The only mildly negative item that I would say is that part-way through our stay, apparently a family with teenage offspring moved in next door, as we could hear their mother yelling at them quite clearly (luckily in English) a few nights in a row! Overall I would completely recommend this hotel and their staff, and it should go without saying that my standards are quite high after having worked in the industry for several years. Thanks to the entire team for helping to make my first trip to Europe such an amazing experience!

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: designtotravel
Reviews.Content: soho stay was a great one...... hotel design was a pleasure to the architect's eye..... rooms were clean, elegant, funky, fun and sophisticated....... simple hotel amenities allow the traveller to feel at home - beautiful rooftop pool and rooftop lounge chairs - great view of the city; convenient breakfast lounge on the first floor; handy internet/media lounge below as well....... front desk staff was very welcoming, warm, friendly and helpful - provided great ideas for non-touristy angle on restaurants/ clubs/ events and added a comfortable perspective on seeing Barca...... hotel location is just off of center, yet still close to all the action - still walking distance to all..... handy metro station steps away for when you get tired..... hotel website promises and photos are true to the reality

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: thommosarah
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at the Soho Hotel and it is was great. The most expensive accom during our entire 6 week holiday, but it was worth it. I highly recommend you book through their website and get the complimentary breakfast deal. We did not eat again until 8pm the same day! Great hot and cold breakfast food to fill up on. The rooms were very nice, but the road noise (lots of sirens) could always be heard so not so sure of their rooms being soundproof? Anyway, we enjoyed our stay and we will be back one day.

Reviews.Title: “Would definately stay again!”
Reviews.Author: Sarahsausage
Reviews.Content: Me and my hubby decided to visit Barcelona to celebrate my 40th (sshhh) birthday and chose the Soho following reading other reviews on TripAdvisor and we weren't disappointed! The hotel is situated about 10-15 mins walk from La Ramblas so an excellent location, it's modern, clean, the staff are friendly and helpful, the breakfast selection was lovely, the bed and pillows were really comfy, etc, etc. The only citicism I have is that the soap didn't last very long and even though it was replenished each day it was very small! (I would recommend earplugs as the hotel is on a very busy road and near an emergency department so lots of sirens throughout the night - but don't let this put you off!). Barcelona is truely wonderful and the architecture stunning, there is plenty to see and do and a trip to Sagrada Familia is top priority! Using the Metro is a doddle for getting to those far away places such as Park Guell (be warned - there is the steepest street in the whole world to traverse before getting to the Park, there are even escalators every so often for the unfit (like us!)), it is also good just strolling around the city and seeing what you come across. The Aerobus is the best way to get from and back to the airport (bus stops easily noticable and frequent buses) as a taxi fare would cost a bomb! ! Enjoy your stay in Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Carlito1
Reviews.Content: Wow what a hotel. Fantastic location, fantastic decor, fantastic facilities, but above all fantastic staff. I was made very welcome. Alessio (hotel reception) gave great suggestions for restaurants, bars ect. I will definately be staying at The Soho next time i'm in Barelona. Enjoy....

Reviews.Title: “Great base in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Holidayenthusiast
Reviews.Content: Hotel clean, modern, funky, good location, great base in the city. Great value compared to some other hotels. Good price for hotel with a pool to dip your feet in after a hard days sightseeing. Would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful ending to our vacation!”
Reviews.Author: RedPatch
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel following a cruise. We found the hotel to be in a great location. Our guide informed us that it is located in one of the better parts of town, which was nice to hear when we were dropped off. We were within walking distance to La Rambla and the metro system, making it easy to visit many parts of town. Along your walk to the metro you will find many small pastry, eateries, and coffee shops. The hotel is modernistic in design and nicely updated. It was spacious and very comfortable. The staff was friendly, spoke English, and was helpful with restaurant suggestions, maps and general directions. There was a rooftop pool area that offered a nice place to relax and enjoy at the end of the day. When your vacation is over if you choose to take the taxi to the airport, it runs around 25 Euro and the front desk will be more than happy to have one waiting for you.

Reviews.Title: “A bit of class in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: BelfastChris22
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. We where advised not to stay on Las Rambla as it was too busy so we looked at surrounding areas. Hotel Soho was a 5 -10 minute walk from Plaza Catalunya, from here you have all the restaurants, shops and the beach within walking distance. Soho was very modern, clean and the staff couldn't have been more friendly. Would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Friendly Staff, Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: lorlphyll
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel SOHO for a total of 10 days. The front desk staff were always polite, friendly, and very helpful, especially Allesio! :) They recommended restaurants and things to do, and even booked the reservations and drew us a map! The hotel is within walking distance to La Rambla and has a metro station directly in front of it, making it convenient to any area of Barcelona. The rooms were very modern yet comfortable, although the walls were rather thin making it easy to hear our neighbors at times. The little pastries they offer at breakfast are quiet delicious!

Reviews.Title: “Great room, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: traveller_boston
Reviews.Content: The rooms are colorful and fashionable while still being comfortable. This is the first hotel that I've been in that you could vary the color temperature of the lighting (making it warmer or cooler depending upon your mood). The staff was friendly, accommodating and reliable -- especially considering my early morning cab and my 4:30 am wakeup.

Reviews.Title: “wonderfull stay”
Reviews.Author: sobepa
Reviews.Content: Very nice and clean rooms. Very friendly and smiling employees, always ready to help you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Modern Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Eur0pe08
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great its ultra modern. It has mood lighting, electronic blinds a huge Plasma tv.... The staff are very friendly and offer lots of help about the surrounding area and places to see, eat, party and shop. The pool is small but is great just to cool off, there is also a lounge area and bar service on the roof top which is great after a day of sightseeing. The buffet breakfast is also great with a large variety to pick.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS”
Reviews.Author: Ellerscroft
Reviews.Content: We booked a Romantic Package through the hotel for 2 nights in September, which included dinner for one night, breakfast, a bottle of cava and chocolates. We were not disappointed. The hotel is fantastic, the suite with balcony was amazing and overlooked a courtyard and backed onto apartments but it was the centre of Barcelona, so other comments about the bad view, we thought were unjustified. What did they expect, the hanging gardens of Babylon! It was actually nice to hear the children play in the afternoon and the locals carrying on with their normal day. The hotel was spotless, the staff were extremely welcoming, very helpful and always pleasant. Breakfast was extremely good and we tried everything and filled up for the days sight-seeing. Ramblas is within walking distance but we mostly chose to use the underground and the nearest station Urgell, is within a few yards of the Hotel. The 3 course dinner with wine at Lurantia was first class and well worth a visit. We would definately stay at the hotel again and would highly recommend it to friends and family. A huge thank you to the staff at the Soho for a very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay in a perfect place”
Reviews.Author: maraoke
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at Hotel Soho last week..What a wonderful hotel..On arrival we were greeted by a very friendly and helpful man and even though we arrived before check-in time he was able to give us a room straight away...The room was so modern and had everything we needed for our 3 night stay. The staff were so helpful in recommending restaurants which were very reasonable and located nearby. The rooftop pool was fab, tho small but we didn't mind. Breakfast was delicious with alot of choice and was included in our stay which cost us 50 euros each per night...a steal! The hotel was centrally located, only 10 mins walk from Plaza Catalunya. Barcelona is such an amazing place, friendly people and lots to do and see.Bus Turistic is definitely to be recommended and there is great shopping too in the city without breaking the bank. We cannot wait to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Modern, Stylish, Centrally Located”
Reviews.Author: blueyedtravler
Reviews.Content: Getting to SoHo: From BCN airport, exit outside and find the Aerobus (big blue bus). There is only one route. It costs 4,05 Euro per person and tickets can be bought from the driver or a ticket machine outside the bus. Since we do not speak Spanish, it was a bonus that the SoHo hotel web site listed the name of the area to get off the Aerobus (Urgell). It was a bit hard to understand (again because we don't speak Spanish or Catalan) and I would recommend asking the driver or another passenger to point it out to you. After exiting the bus, we walked a few blocks up Gran Via and there it was like a beacon - SoHo! You cannot miss the large sign and it was a welcome sight. Be sure to write down the exact address so you know which way to walk. The Hotel: Very cool! We ran around the room for 10 minutes checking things out. The textured floor is a nice touch. The lighting buttons (you must have a card in to use electricity) are very interesting - hot and soft settings (like bright and ambient light) and an off button that I hit on more than one occasion thinking it was for the bedroom and left my boyfriend in the dark in the bathroom! Nice toiletries and bathroom kit with emergency razor and toothbrush. We loved the colors and spaciousness of the room. The bed was extremely comfortable, really fluffly and cozy. The only thing I would mention is that the walls are a bit thin - we heard the activities of other couples during the night. Not bad except when they talk and talk and talk! Towels could be a bit softer. Also, the only English channel was BBC News. Mini bar met its purpose. In room safe worked though was a bit hard to get to (right next to luggage rack in the room). Missed having a bar or restaurant in the hotel. The rooftop was nice - you must get towels from the front desk. Only about 8 sunbeds but there is also a more covered lounge like area to relax in. Pool is to cool off only - max about 3 feet deep. Location: SoHo is just about one block from the Urgell metro stop. Super easy to get to attractions. Also, since the hotel is on the Gran Via (basically a main drag of the area), we often opted to walk to a site instead of take the metro (used only 8 of the 10 visits on the T10 journey card we purchased). Lots of cafes nearby to grab a drink or snack. Tabac is also nearby for stamps. Staff: Staff was always very friendly and helpful. We asked for several recommendations and were provided with directions and information. I would have liked a few more suggestions and a map when we checked in instead of asking for one. I also would have appreciated some tips on the metro but we didn't know what we didn't know (for example, we were confused that the metro ticket machine asked what zone we wanted - Barcelona that you would want to visit is only zone one). Breakfast: Quite delicious. We always opted to eat outside. The food was good and there was plenty of variety. Wifi: Supposed to have it free but only worked outside and in the lobby. Overall, we had a great experience at this hotel. I loved the signature scent that you smell upon walking in the automatically sliding glass door. The two computers with free Internet were a big bonus. This hotel is a great value, great experience and good location. It was cool to be able to live in a ultra hip, ultra modern room for a few days. I would definitely return to this hotel and give it my full recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Modern Hotel with some great english lads”
Reviews.Author: seasoned_traveller69
Reviews.Content: We got back from our vacation on Saturday after a fabulous time in the hotel Soho! When we first arrived we were greeted by a beautifully modern reception, although the guy behind the desk looked a bit moody. After a smooth check in we went up to our room and were equally impressed with the design although felt the room could have been a little larger. We actually saw into one of the back rooms and they looked a little bigger so it would be a good idea to request one of those if you can. The rooftop pool was great, with really nice views over the city. That said it wasn't really a swimming pool, more of a slash pool - in fact we found that out the hard way when someone decided to jump in followed by his friend soaking the whole place, including my book, whilst we were sunbathing. He was part of a large group of guys staying there, at first they were quite noisy and we wondered if this would spoil the pool area. In fact it turned out that they were really nice guys (and a treat to look at) there on a stag party for a guy called Paul if I remember correctly...Good luck with the wedding Paul!!! Oh one last thing I almost forgot... the showers actually have a see through wall that at a push of a button can go opaque...quite a fun feature... pity we didn't get those guys to try it out with us!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Good Location”
Reviews.Author: D0min0
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from four night stay at the SoHo from our friends wedding. We were lucky enough to be able to book the "Romantic Package" so got upgraded to terrace room, breakfast and one evening meal included and cava and chocolates on arrival. The reception staff and cleaners were really friendly and helpful, all spoke excellent English which was helpful as our Catalan was pitiful. The room was great, huge bed, lovely terrace overlooking the Gran Via, huge tv and lovely bathroom. Breakfast was on until 11 every morning and had a great selection from scrambled eggs to pastries. We really enjoyed our stay here and would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A+++++”
Reviews.Author: obee2121
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed in the SOHO for about 4 days and we loved every minute. Breakfast was very good and filling enough to last through until late lunch or even dinner some days. View from roof top was beautiful, along with a very nice pool (to cold to get in). The lounge downstairs had two computer that had internet access. We were walking distance from Plaza Cataluna, maybe 2 blocks. Everyone at the reception desk were very helpful. When the manager was at the desk he seemed to be very cold, liked talking to the employees better. They had everything we needed and then some. The room we were in was very modern. Thank you for such a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: hippychick40
Reviews.Content: Very cool & chic hotel. Our room was in the middle of the hotel so was very quiet at night. Staff helpful on our arrival providing us with a map of city and gave us information on where to visit and how best to get around. As this was our first time in Barcelona we purchased the 2 day ticket on the Bus Turistic - great way to see the city. Can't wait to go back again!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: oidrey
Reviews.Content: - Friendly staff, great service - Free internet with two computers in comfortable lounge - Clean, modern, high tech, comfortable rooms (Rooms 27 and 29) - Noisy hallways and traffic from outside - Very nice bathrooms - Convenient location - Ask for a room with a view

Reviews.Title: “Something very valuable got lost on my hotel room !”
Reviews.Author: majsis83
Reviews.Content: When we got to the hotel we got a pleasant surprise. The hotel had a terrific situation, just in the center of everything. It took approx. 10 minutes to walk to Las Ramblas. It was great! The room was very modern and stylish, but a bit trixy with all the modern stuff. Some things were difficult to handle! I have had a bite plate for many years and I have had a special dentist for this. I have paid lots of hundreds of euors to get it fixed. One morning I put my bite plate in its litte box just on my night stand as I always do. We went out from the room and came back some hours later in the afternoon, when I got back I realised that my bite plate was gone with the box! The room was cleaned so we called the reception to ask wheter they had got something there but they hadn.t' The day after I spoke to the hotel receptionist... I was really sad because I knew that I now had to pay some more hundreds of euros to get a new bite plate from the same dentist. I haven't lost it! Someone else has I believe since it wasn't o´n my night stand later on. The receptionist told me that the manager was on vacation for some weeks, but that she would call me when she came back to give me compensation for the thing that the hotel had lost!!! I wrote a mail to her and got an answer that they don't take responsobility for the things that are kept outside the locker! WHAT!!!!!!!!!!!! Should I put all the clothes and everything in the locker then?!!!! This was so cruel. For the inconvience she offered me one free hotel night next time I come to town. Oh [--]!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! What an OFFER! I live hundreds of miles away and will probably never get back and IF I go back sometime I will definitely not stay at this hotel that either 1. stole my bite plate. 2. threw it away because they thought it was trash! I think its terrible. Now my insurance company will pay approx 200 EUROS and I have to pay 150 EUROS for something that I haven't lost. For something that the hotel personnel did! I think it's rude. I will never go back and I cannot recommend this hotel because of this thing that happened!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Soho”
Reviews.Author: Scunneredbywork
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Soho for 3 nights and we loved it. Short walk from the Urgell/Gran Via stop on the Aerobus. We arrived just before 2pm & got into our room. We were on the 5th floor facing onto Gran Via, the room was plenty big enough with a large bed & trendy decor. Took a minute to work out the blinds but they are operated by buttons next to the bed. If you feel the need to shut the ones at the bathroom then this is the buttons next to the socket at the sink. You can also make the lights brighter by pressing the buttons again & there is a small spot at the desk- but no mirror. I saw into one of the inner rooms when it was being cleaned & I didnt think it looked that dark- not compared to the room we had in Florence last year, it had no light. Maybe the ones on the lower floors had less light, Kept meaning to time the walk down to Plaza Catalunya, say 15 minutes at tourist pace! Seemed less at night but that might have been the wine. There is noise from Gran Via, but it never bothered us. If you don't like traffic noise then don't come to a city. You would need to be a very light sleeper for it to keep you awake! I actually loved the fact that the city is still buzzing late into the night. The walk down Gran Via seemed very safe, well lit and wide streets. People's bad experiences had made me worry but I needn't have. Our first night we asked the guy on reception to recommend a restaurant which we went to but it was packed out, but it looked fab. Our 3 nights we ate on Rambla Catalunya & then on Ronda Universitat. All 3 meals were lovely & reasonably priced. We lunched a couple of times on Pasaig De Gracia at Tapa Tapa. Great spot for people watching. Our fav bar was on the corner of Gran Via & Rambla Catalunya. Out flight home was not until the evening so when we checked out the hotel kept our bags in a secure luggage room. As we were all walked out we took a taxi to the airport which was quick & comfortable & 34 Euros (not sure how they word out the supplement for the luggage & the airport, neither wonder he wouldn't let us lift the bags) eek!! Other than that I can totally recommend the Soho if you like your hotels modern, the staff were friendly, the breakfast was good the room was comfortable & the area was good. I would also recommend you go to Barcelona, it's a beautiful city, anyone we came across was polite & friendly (only got tutted at once by the Aerobus driver). We did the 2 day Bus Turistic which was good. We just loved it! Go there!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Hotel SOHO Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: alescarpe
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife spent a beautiful stay in hotel SOHO in Barcelona! The hotel is modern, clean, original and in a really good position. It takes 10minutes walking to go to la Rambla, the area is verys safe and you can walk also in the night without any problem. There is also a metro station just 50 meters from the hotel!! All the personnel of the hotel is very kind, young and professional. They all speak fluent english and one is italian and speaking our own language he suggested us great restaurants and places to visit in the city. The rate was very good and with a special internet fare we had also breakfast included, which is generally very expensive in Barcelona hotels. The room was equipped with many technological things, wifi internet is free and there are also 2 computer to surf the web for free in the lobby. The last floor is the terrace wiith a small swimming pool and a place were you can rest after your hard day walking around Barcelona. Really a place tu suggest to friends!

Reviews.Title: “soho: excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: hilwest
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really cool! We booked the superior room and that's really superior with the biggest private terrace we ever had (book far in front, there are only four rooms with a private terrace..)Terrace was warm and sunny in the morning and awesome to sit at night. The room was very spacious with a sitting area, perfect bed, cool lighting and a nice bathroom. Very clean. Staff was excellent and helpfull. I don't understand the complains from other writers about the roofterrace: it is gorgeous. And what do you expect on a roof: a swimmingpool from olympic size? it was all very nice and trendy. And the breakfast: where do you get this anymore for 13 euro?? So if you like a trendy, modern, friendly, dark luxourious environment: book the soho.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Peter247
Reviews.Content: We arrived at hotel mid afternoon after a 20 minute walk from Placa de Catalunya (main square where airport bus stops). After reading previous reviews we were surprised the hotel was this far away from the main tourist area. The hotel is situated on one of the main routes into the city centre and this four lane road generates a lot on noise all day and unfortunately all night as well. Also due to it being close to the local hospital there was constant sirens from ambulances. The room we were given was an inner room with no view and no natural light. This small sombre room was very depressing and we asked if we could be moved but were told the hotel was full and it was not possible. The polite staff assured us the next day there would be a choice of rooms available. The hotel consists of rooms overlooking the busy main road, inner rooms around a central shaft and rear rooms overlooking a park. The next day we were hoping for a rear room but were given one overlooking the main road, and although far brighter and cheerier the poor sound proofing caused terrible trafic noise. The other point worth noting is the hotel pool and seating area. The pool is tiny and has just 6 sunbeds around it. For a hotel with 51 rooms we thought this was inadequate, and in our 5 day stay we were unable to use it once. This was highly dissapointing as after paying a premium for staying in a hotel with pool facilities we wanted nothing more than to relax by the pool after a longday sightseeing. In hindsight we would have had better value if we had booked a hotel which was closer to the main attractions, quieter but without pool facilities.

Reviews.Title: “excellent, I come back again and again”
Reviews.Author: ijkd
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful boutique hotel. The rooms are gorgeous, the beds very comfortable, the staff pretty friendly, the roof terrace pleasant and the breakfast damn good (and they don't lose any sleep if you arrive a little bit late for it). The location is very central in Barcelona. Can't recomment it enough.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Catrose
Reviews.Content: My Fiancee and I stayed her for 5 nights in July 08. Could not possibly find fault with this hotel. Location was perfect and the bus from the Airport practially dropped us at the front door. It is close enough to all the attractions to make them very accessible but also far enough away that you can avoid the hustle and bustle by night and stay in the vicinity of the hotel to eat and drink. The staff all had excellent english and could not have been more obliging, twice we asked them to recommend a restaurant and goth times a success. The rooms are really funky even though a bit strange at first but once you got used to the decor they rocked! Overall I cannot possibly fault this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Really cool outfit”
Reviews.Author: MeLikeBarcelona
Reviews.Content: Generally, the Soho Hotel is snazzy, located close to the city center, and the staff is friendly. We also really liked the roof terrace and the swimming pool area which was a great place for hanging out after a hot trip into town (and which offered a splendid view of the city). So, we'd definately recommend the Soho hotel to other travellers coming to Barcelona. The only downsides we can think of is that some of the rooms are facing the Grand Via which has a lot of traffic (we were lucky in that our room faced the back of the building and was completely quiet) and that the lighting scheme in the rooms was more cool than practical. But these are minor quarrels.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive and a great rate”
Reviews.Author: flyerdc
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in a couple of boutique hotels in Barcelona, a city of great boutique hotels, sort of the San Francisco of Europe in that regard, and the Soho was the most impressive and fairly priced. Small but well-designed and functional rooms, including free wireless internet. There's a wonderful roofdeck, perfect for the Barcelona sun, and a small swimming pool. The location is also terrific, just a few minutes' walk from the Ramblas. (For the record, I also stayed at the Casanavoa, a popular boutique hotel that is virtually next door, and was less impressed, if only because the Casanova has no pool and charges for wireless.....) The Soho staff was a little snippy on occasion, but given the overall quality of the hotel, I'd recommend it enthusiastically.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT, once again !!”
Reviews.Author: rdelar
Reviews.Content: This is our second time we stay in this hotel. Actualy we had been there just when they opened, and almost two years later, it still one of our favorites hotels. The service was great, and the conditions of the rooms are perfect. Lots of style and design. The location is great, very close to Plaza Catalunya by walking. We totally recommend this fashion hotel! Gabriela and Rene, Guadalajara, Mexico.

Reviews.Title: “Good modern hotel, well located”
Reviews.Author: vivafatelvis
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during Reyes for 4 nights in January. The hotel is modern and the facilities of a high standard. It's very similar to the High Tec chain of hotels that you find in cities all over Spain. Funky modern look, the glass wall surrounding the bathroom is a clever touch (don't worry is has built in blinds!). It's just as well that the room we had was comfortable as I was quite ill for 2 of the days ..almost made it to the Sagrada Familia if you catch my drift...so as a result I spent a lot of the time in the room. There's also a nice roof terrace and pool. There are quite a few places to choose from in this range but this is a reasonably priced, reliable clean hotel, well situated with competent polite staff.

Reviews.Title: “So So”
Reviews.Author: StevieC_8
Reviews.Content: Having read previous reviews, I perhaps expected too much of the Soho. You see, while the hotel is quite stylish, the rooms quite comfortable and the location good, there are some real spoilers. First, location. The hotel is on the Grand Vie, which is a very busy main road and, even though I requested a quiet room, it was very noisy. Next, the "mood" lighting in the rooms is novel, but completely impractical when you are trying to get ready for a night out, as you just look completely orange in the mirrors. Ladies beware! Also, when I asked for an iron I was told there was only 1 for the whole hotel, it was unavailable and I should use the laundry service provided by the hotel. I duly did this and have to say that my clothes seemed to come back with more creases then they started with. Not very impressive. There was also a broken tap in my room and the bathroom sink did not seem to produce hot water (though no problems with the bath/shower for water). That said, the beds are really comfy, the hotel is spotlessly clean, the room had a great power shower and the Ramblas is only about a 10 min stroll away. It is by no means a bad hotel, but it is not worth 5/5. I would try somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: truetravelerCMH
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Soho. The hotel is in a perfect location in the Eixample and an easy walk to Placa Catalunya and Barri Gotic. The lobby is very small and there are only about 6 or 7 seven rooms per floor, so the hotel has a boutique feel. The rooms are good sized and very high-style. The window shades, including both the front windows and the partition between the shower and the bedroom are dramatic, but can be a little challenging to operate. The roof-top deck continues the high-style effect and has a great view of the city. The staff could not have been more helpful, particularly Alesso at the front desk who went out of his way to make restaurant reservations for us. We would definately be back!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Beebster83
Reviews.Content: My sister and I (both in our twenties) spent 4 nights at Hotel Soho at the beginning of July and we had a fantastic time. The ONLY negative was that our room was rather noisy at night due to the main road the hotel is located on - nothing an iPod or some earplugs didn't fix! Apart from this, I would certainly recommend this hotel to friends. The staff are very friendly and helpful, the rooftop pool/sun terrace is great for relaxing and our room was very spacious and clean. It's just a 10 mins walk from the city centre and 30 secs walk from the nearest metro station. PLUS.... Barcelona is fantastic!!

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel in heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: issylh
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great, safe location, about a 10 minute walk from Las Ramblas. The staff was very helpful and gave us good instructions from getting around as well as two excellent recommendations for restaurants. What we liked the best was the rooftop pool, kept refreshingly cool on the hot days we were there, plus they have nice outdoor furniture under shade. The decor is very modern a lot of steel/grey color; had some difficulty figuring out the lighting situation! You must keep your room key card "plugged in" the wall slot inside the room in order to activate the lights. My spouse has a CPAP machine, but when we turned out the lights, none of the outlets work. We finally had to unplug the tv and use that outlet as it is the only one that stills worked with the lights out. The whole feel of the hotel is ultra modern, much more my spouse's style than mine. Definately recommend the location if you are up to walking a bit. If not, you might need something closer to the bus lines. We personally enjoyed the walk and felt safe at all times, plus we liked not being directly on Las Ramblas.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Watch out for the Noise”
Reviews.Author: Gansosalvaje
Reviews.Content: VERY helpful staff (they even waved goodbye) Wireless access is free. Pool is small but ideal if you want to cool off after sunbathing on the rooftop terrace. Well placed for the Plaza de Catalunya. Rooms are attractive and minimalist but request one away from the Gran Via if you want a quiet night.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: nickijane
Reviews.Content: A lovely small friendly hotel. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Our room was at the front of the hotel, there was a bit of traffic noise, but it didn't keep us awake. The room was well appointed, and comfortable, every thing was very clean. The breakfast wsa great and set you up well for the day. The hotel was central, only 10 mins walk to the central square, where you could get buses and the metro around the city and you were at the top of Las Ramblas the main pedestrian street. I would recommend this hotel without reservation to all of my friends and family

Reviews.Title: “Alright hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shauna70
Reviews.Content: This was the first stop to a month long vacation traveling through Spain & Morocco with my husband and 4 year old son. We thought the hotel was okay. It was very clean, fine bed, and very small. We expected more for the price. The first room they put us in was like a little cagey feeling (in the back of the hotel)the only window opened up to a wall, so we asked to be moved to the front. They moved us no problem. The room was brighter and felt much better, but was very loud and at night the lights that they use on the outside of the hotel are somehow part of the front part of the room, and they stayed on all night shinning brightly. A bit annoying. We passed on the breakfast for nearly $20 usd...there are tons of little places nearby that are great.

Reviews.Title: “Soho Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: intrepidlady
Reviews.Content: I wrote a review back in February after a four night stay in Soho Hotel and commented on the awful smell of smoke in our room during our stay. I also posted the same review on the NN blog site on their invitation. So I feel that I should write the follow up review after our recent return to BCN and Soho. Asun, the Director/Manager, contacted me almost immediately after I posted my comments to discuss them further. I elaborated on the situation and as a consequence she offered me one night's accomodation in the hotel if we were in BCN again. We had already planned a trip from France to Spain in June and knew we had to overnight in BCN again so I accepted her offer. In the end we decided to stay a second night there and make a weekend of it. Beforehand, I had to post a parcel of clean clothes to the hotel so they would be there on our arrival as we were doing some mountain climbing in France. Carol, another member of staff, was incredibly helpful throughout. I also booked the second night on a hotel booking website and Carol made sure we had the same room for both nights which was incredibly generous as I would defintely think we had one of their best rooms. Asun came out to meet me when we arrived on Friday afternoon and I also met Carol, both of whom were incredibly friendly. We stayed in room 64 which was at the back overlooking the park. I have to say I had two of the most peaceful nights sleep I've had in a long time. The room was pitch dark, there wasn't a sound and the bed was so comfortable. We had breakfast both mornings and while I don't eat pastries etc the buffet was impressive and is substantial enough to keep you going for hours. I checked out the downstairs media room as I needed to look up my email and I was very impressed - two pc's, a printer, spare printer paper, a large flat screen tv and some comfie chairs too. The location of the hotel is ideal; close enough to stroll into the centre but out enough to avoid the maddening crowds. There's a metro stop across the road so you are within minutes of everything. Thank you to the management of Soho; they proved their worth and did something which hotels don't do very often - they listened to complaints. All in all, I would thoroughly recommend Soho for anyone who wants a little bit of luxury and comfort while staying in BCN. It's funky, contemporary, central and the staff are incredibly helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and slick”
Reviews.Author: Ox-Sydney
Reviews.Content: Very nice little hotel. It is centrally located for most of the sights though not so for the beach if that is your thing. However it is very close to the underground and anywhere that is out of walking distance is only a few minutes away on Barcelona's efficient train system. We got a bus from the airport which dropped us off very near the hotel. Returning to the airport was not so simple as the bus does not pick up from that stop. This ultra modern hotel was clean and efficiently run. Our room was nicely decorated and the bed and bathroom were great. The toilet room was a bit dark! The only thing it missed was a kettle. Our room was high up so escaped the noise that may be heard from the lower rooms (note that I am not saying these rooms are noisy as I think they have double glazing - they just could be...). The breakfast was OK, we preferred to go out and get some good coffee and some pastries from the main market (15min walk). The two guys at reception were EXTREMELY helpful - particularly the Italian guy who's name I forget - thank you for all your advice and recommendations! I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Coolest hotel I've stayed in”
Reviews.Author: lhoiyu
Reviews.Content: The interior design is pretty amazing: simplistic, modern, yet functional. There's a metro right next to the hotel so it was also a great launching spot for visiting various sites in the city. It's not as close to La Ramblas as compared to more pricey hotels, but the price more than compensate for that. Ramblas is too touristy anyways to walk around all day. Also, It was a pleasure just talking to Alessio, the coolest hotel receptionist, to hear him explain about the local scenes, culture, customs, and about his story. Let me know when you come over to Hong Kong, and I will show you around, Alessio!

Reviews.Title: “Modern Life”
Reviews.Author: RosaPink
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Soho together with my boyfriend over a long weekend. I had a great time and loved the hotel. There was only one thing that they definitely need to fix, the lightning at the hotel, as it was impossible to do my makeup in the dark.

Reviews.Title: “Alessio - Thank you so much.”
Reviews.Author: thisismy_screen
Reviews.Content: When we decided to go to Barcelona, we wanted to stay in a hotel which fullfills most of our requirements. The SOHO-Hotel met all of our criterias. The rooms werent just comfortable, but also stylish, clean and very modern/cozy. The pool on the roof of the hotel offers you an amazing view over the city and especially over the Gran Via, where the hotel is located. Another big plus was the distance to the next metro station: 100 meters! Couldnt be any closer. The media and dining lounge are highly recommendable. Last but not least Alessio from the front-desk rounded up our stay: he was helpful (when we lost our wallet in barcelona), friendly and humorous. Thank you for this pleasent stay!!!! We will recommend the Soho!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary & friendly”
Reviews.Author: Seanmckay
Reviews.Content: We couldn't recommend this place more highly. Not only is the interior decor very cool with some amazing back lit artwork and glass walled showers, but the staff are really friendly and helpful. It is in the perfect location, five minutes walk from the top of the Ramblas, 20 seconds from a metro station and a €20 taxi ride from the airport. The complimentary breakfast is excellent, as is the ambience of the restaurant area and we got an upgrade, free bottle of Cava and Tapas which all went down very nicely. Some people have moaned about the noise but we were facing Gran Via and, given that your in the middle of a big city, the noise was never a problem. If you are going to Barcelona, definitely stay here. The only problem we had, was that the rooftop pool and terrace was closed for refurbishment but they offered us alternatives and couldn't have done more to make our stay an excellent one.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish”
Reviews.Author: argiechick
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a few days at the Hotel Soho. Highly recommended. One of the best hotels I have ever stayed in and Alessio at the front desk was outstanding and very helpful. The rooms are a great size and stylish and sexy. Very central , metro across the road, Las Ramblas a few blocks away. We stayed on the 4th floor and we could not hear any noises as I had read on other reviews. Also the rooms are pretty dark if you dont like that little ray of sunshine coming through while you sleep. The only thing I would say is that the TV volume only reaches 50 and not great sound if you have your window open. The bathroom was the main attraction as were the controls for the blinds and different lights. Would def go back without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Soho was perfect”
Reviews.Author: Nitrodog
Reviews.Content: We researched hotels in Barcelona for some time before settling on Soho. We booked a terrace room on the 7th floor overlooking Grand Via and thought it to be perfect for our three day stay. Being from Montreal, and never having been to Barcelona we had no idea what to expect. The room was lovely and the terrace was perfect for a drink before dinner. The hotel is immacuately clean and ideally located. The subway (metro) is a block away. Some posts complained about the street noise but we found these complaints to be unfounded. I would guess that those who posted them were from small towns and not used to big city sounds, as every big city like Barcelona do have certain city noises like it or not. We were never aroused by city noise at night. The staff (especially Alessio) was very friendly and helpful. Although we stayed there in Late March and it was a bit cold to enjoy the swimming pool we went up there and thought the pool floor was charming and looked comfortable. Barcelona is indeed one of the most beautiful cities we have ever visited and our stay at Hotel Soho was part of the reason we were so fond of this city. If a 15 minute walk doesn't bother you, ask at the desk how to get to Cerveceria Catalana, maybe the best tapas restaurant in town. Bill & Sherry, Montreal, Canada.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wellerman
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Soho last weekend and loved the place. We had booked a superior 7th floor room with balcony overlooking the Gran Via and it was excellent. Very modern rooms with quirky electric blinds and a glass bathroom, the balcony is wooden decking with leather seats and overall the rooms are very comfortable. The breakfast is superb with fresh bread, hams and cheeses as well as fruit, cereal and pastries although we did think it was a bit steep at 13 Euro per person. There is a wonderful rooftop pool (unheated) and terrace with great views over the city. It doesn't have a bar but room service will supply beer, wine etc to the room if you want it. Ideal location for exploring, 5mins walk to University Sq and 15mins to Placa Catalunya and there's a metro station (Urgell), right outside the front door.Overall a superb hotel and I would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish and Sexy!!”
Reviews.Author: Lola18
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Soho at the end of Jan '08, and I have to say, we loved every minute of it. Our flight was delayed so we got a cab from the airport to the hotel, and were pleasantly surprised how quickly we arrived there (cost us about 25 euro). When we pulled up outside, we couldn't believe how stylish the hotel was, Soho really has the WOW factor!! The lobby is very contemporary, and the reception staff were very attentive and efficient (even though there was some confusion with our booking, this was resolved quickly). The rooms are where this hotel really oozes sex appeal, with the 'hot' and 'soft' mood lighting and modern bathroom with glass wall alongside the bath/shower (there are integral blinds you can close for privacy). The room was also a good size for a hotel so centrally located, (walking distance to las ramblas and just outside a metro stop), and had lovely comfortable beds with extra blankets provided, as the room was a little chilly at night. The real problem with sleep though is the NOISE!! As the hotel is located on a main road in a city which never sleeps, the traffic noise is constant. We traveled with another couple, who stayed in the room directly below us (at the front of the hotel), we are all in our twenties and took full advantage of the fantastic nightlife Barcelona has to offer, so we weren't exactly in bed early, but we all found the road noise an issue. Also, the floor level lights in the window recesses do not switch off and as the blinds do not block all of the light out, the room is never completely in darkness, which when added to the noise from outside can be really disturbing. I've since read another review from someone who took earplugs and eye masks to sleep in, and I think this is the solution!! We didn't eat breakfast in the hotel, so cannot comment on it, but I would say that there are loads of great local cafes in which to eat and this is also a far cheaper option. Overall, our stay in Barcelona was fantastic, and was made all the better by staying at this hotel. If your looking for a chic, stylish hotel then the Soho has to be worth a look!!

Reviews.Title: “Stylish and Sophisticated”
Reviews.Author: ChillinIreland
Reviews.Content: Soho Hotel was very modern and stylish. The hotel was clean and maintained to a very high standard. Soho hotel is located close to Las Ramblas and all the main attractions but was in an area that was not noisy during the night. The staff were friendly and helpful and spoke good English. I would highly recommend Soho Hotel and would stay there again if I was in Barcelona

Reviews.Title: “Modern, sheek hotel. Wonderful stay...”
Reviews.Author: Natalie007_7
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this lovely hotel for three days near the end of January with another couple who where in the room directly above us. We got the aerobus from the airport for just 4 euros each and got off a couple of stops before the placa de cataluna on Gran Via and walked back a few blocks to the hotel. We were greeted with smiles from all of the reception staff who checked us in quickly and efficiently, they offered us maps and guide books of Barcelona complementry and showed us to our gorgeous rooms. They were very modern and warm looking with a contemporary decor throughout, a plasma T.V, hidden safe, fully stocked mini bar and a cool bathroom with a seperat W/C. All the lights have controlls for your own comfort (soft, cool, bright etc) you can use the controls to open and close the blinds (which was a good 'boy toy' to keep them happy for a few minutes.) Basically the rooms where great, beds very comfy, shower very powerful, spacious and enough wardrobes space and hangers. Im sorry to say but there was a small problem, I hate moaning but it did annoy me sometimes. The NOISE! We were in the front rooms facing directly on to the main road and Barcelona dosn't sleep so we had to suffer with some of the traffic noise, it wasn't too bad but you will hear it. Our friends were directly above us and they moaned about it as well... We never ate there as the breakfast is too expensive and there are plenty of little baguette and toastie places which are alot cheaper and probably nicer. Anyway stay here it's great. The location is very good as well, you just have to walk about 10 mins and you are at the top of La Rambles which is central to everything, plus there are bus stops, metro and taxis everywhere. Have a good trip!! Barcelona id good fun!!

Reviews.Title: “The sexiest hotel at a very reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: trevostar
Reviews.Content: Style Style Style -- This place has more of it than anywhere else I've ever stayed at. From the entrance to the corridor to the bedroom, the Soho hotel oozes sex appeal with its dimly lit metal decor and soft flowing orange hue. The room is spacious and modern, with attention paid to every small detail in the design of the room. The bedside light switches don't control individual lighting area, they assign a mood for the room, whether you want the mood to be "cool", "hot" or normal. Apart from that, the room was well equipped and was very comfortable. Breakfast was decent, and the location is very convenient as you can get on the subway just steps from the hotel entrance and there are lots of good restaurants and bars within walking distance. It's in a great neighbourhood (Eixample) but it's also easy to get to anywhere from here with the metro. All in all, a great choice in Barcelona. I normally love trying new places and would not stay in the same place twice. But the Soho Hotel is too good to pass up, so I think I know where I'm staying on my next visit to BCN. Possibly the most stylish hotel in its price range anywhere in the world.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED the SOHO!! Should be a 4*”
Reviews.Author: Ginzarella
Reviews.Content: I am just back from a six night stay at the SOHO. We were originally a group of 8, 4 couples from NY and then we had another couple join us from France for 3 of the 6 nights. I can honestly say we had a fabulous time in Barcelona and staying at the SOHO was one of the highlights of the trip. I am a bit of a clean freak so I am on pins and needles when checking into a hotel worrying about its cleanliness....the SOHO was immaculate the common areas were very clean the rooms were spotless and the maids were accommodating and honest. I had dropped a few euros under my bed and thought I would pick them up in the morning, I had forgotten about them until I returned to my room later and found that the maid had found them and placed them on my nightstand. WOW was I impressed with that. The rooms are fantastic and quite modern and the beds so comfortable. I loved the idea of the mood lighting and the blinds that controlled the view into the bath/shower. Please do not let this throw you off as if you require privacy the blinds in the shower/bath can be completely turned so that you have 100% privacy. If I were to have only one suggestion for the hotel it would be for more lighting in the bathroom but that would truly be my only one slight negative complaint. We had the breakfast included and it was great, lots of choices and all very delicious. We were so content with our breakfast that we never needed to stop for lunch. The location of the SOHO is amazing, besides having the two metro stations and several bus stops outside your door (less then a 30 second walk) you can walk to almost all the tourist attractions. AMAZING!! The whole staff at the SOHO are friendly and welcoming but there are two in particular that make you feel like family Alessio and Oliver. If I could sit here and write to you how FANTASTIC these two men are I would be witting for days. I have done quite a bit of traveling and have stayed at many hotels never have I come across two like Alessio and Oliver who besides always greeting you with a bright smile took the time to treat you like you were the only guest at the hotel and took their time to explain things of the city, sites to see and those to avoid, places to eat and made the reservations for you. It blows my mind that this hotel is a 3 star....if I were giving out the stars this should be a 4 star superior. All in all I have to say that my group of 10, we were all beyond pleased with the SOHO with the staff, its location. If ever in Barcelona again and I will be because it a wonderful city.....Hotel SOHO for me! Thank You SOHO for making our tip the Best!!!! I do not have any photos but we stayed in the Urban Rooms in the back of the hotel and it was just like it shows on the hotel website (Rooms42)

Reviews.Title: “Loved it !”
Reviews.Author: MadamCynthia
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a weekend in Barcelona with a friend and it was great. HOTEL: the hotel was lovely the decor is very contemporary so if you are not into it then dont stay here. However for those of you that love the latest well dressed minimalistic look to your room then this is the place. With buttons to change the mood of the lighting in the room and flat screen tv of a decent size i loved my room and would definately stay here again. (got to watch a bit of the african football tournament) The pool was nice but it was not hot enough for us to get in but its location catches great sun. would be great in hotter weather. the media room was also nice with fast internet access and nice seating great for relaxing in front of the tv - nicely decorated also I didnt have breakfast at the hotel but the breakfast loung looked lovely. The staff were lovely and very helpful giving us directions and guidance on the train systems and local attractions, restaurants and bars. LOCATION; the location is great if you are up to the challenge of walking a couple of blocks or jumping on the train to and from ...for those of you with bigger budgets there are taxis everywhere so you never get stuck. My friend and i took the metro everywhere as we wanted experience barcelona transport and once we did a journey we realised it was so easy to understand we didnt bother with taxis again. (you can purchase a 10 journey travelcard for 7 euros which allows you on and off the train for ten journeys anywhere) EVERYTHING WAS CLOSE TO THIS HOTEL (but obviously not on the doorstep) ATTRACTIONS: there are so many things to see so ensure to ask reception for a map and get sight seeing ..the beach is only a short train ride away, le rambles is great in the day and even more fun in the night, sangrada familia is nice, picasso museum and loads more ..oh and lots of shopping. NIGHTLIFE: we ended up at an R'N'B club called JAMBOREE which was great and drinks were reasonably priced - a small bottle of wine (1 and a half glasses) was only 5 euros. Malibu and coke was 8 Euros. 10 euros to get into the club (it was well worth it but there are loads of peopleoutside giving out flyers for discount). Overall this hotel is great and i would recommend it to anyone who loves contemp decor and exteremely stylish and relaxing hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location”
Reviews.Author: kmt325
Reviews.Content: Overall I was very satisfied with my 4 night stay. I would recommend asking for a room in the back. They are larger and quieter than the rooms in the front. The breakfast was 13 euros. We skipped it and opted instead to eat at the numerous nearby restaurants and bakeries. They advertise as having free wireless service in the rooms, but we actually had to connect via ethernet. They atleast offered a free connection wire at the front desk. There were 3 ethernet plugs in the room, but only one of them actually worked. The staff were pleasant and helpful. The rooms have fun features and are well maintained.

Reviews.Title: “young and pretty hotel”
Reviews.Author: Giovannona
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot and not often the hotels exceeds my expectation, but this hotel has hit a lot to me with particular design and it searches to you, cured in the details, relaxant, technological, much clean one, with the kindest staff and available, for young people, noisy how much whichever other hotel in one centers street of any other European city, very served by metro and bus, central but a part… one pleasant surprise!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the centre”
Reviews.Author: fdamir
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in august of 2007 for 10 nights.We had a great time at the hotel. It has very good room design and overall look of the hotel. Well I can't say anything bad about the hotel except it should have a restaurant opened the whole day.Thats the only bad thing.Oh yes about the lights-hm many coments about it were made(it is hard to operate it-come on people you got only 2 buttons)and i should mention that the bathroom is best suited for couples that are still in love since it has a glass wall that you can see in to the room.Some people have also given coments that the hotel is too far away to walk to the centre-oh my god you have to be an american to say that it's a 5 minutes walk.In the end i can only recomend it to all the people that would like to stay in the center of Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but improvements needed”
Reviews.Author: keroro
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because of the top reviews in Trip Advisor, so we had a high expectation that this will be a very good stay. Maybe because of our high hope, it turned out to be a bit disappointed. Actually there’re many areas that we like about this hotel: - location (just 30 seconds walk from the Urgell metro station) - neighbourhood area (the hotel is located on Gran Via, surrounded by many nice residential buildings along the street, seems quite safe to me) - There is an organic food supermarket called Veritis downstairs, very convenient if you want to buy some daily stuff - Comfortable beds, contemporary designed room & the flat screen TV - Free and private safety box embedded into the wall What we don’t like about the hotel is that although the design of the hotel and the rooms are cool and funky, we think the designer / hotel operator only design it on an artistic perspective, many details & the service provided are not user friendly enough. - The corridors are too dark, feeling very depressed and not safe to go around - The maid do not refill the personal care items (like soap or shower gel) in the room even though we stayed there for 4 nights - The heating is not stable in the room and we always feel cold, given that the temperature is quite low in Barcelona in Dec - Not even a small bottle of water or a water boiler is provided in the room. Most importantly, there is a “soft (blue)” and “hot (orange)” light design in the room. Probably part of the hotel’s hip design. However, the light in our room is out of control from the 2nd night of our stay. The “Orange” light in our room automatically turn on every night at different times without touching any button. On one night it turned on at 8pm, on the other 2 nights it turned on at 12 midnight. Most ridiculous is, the light cannot be turned off even we push the “all lights off” button. There isn’t any switch. It can only be turned off if we took out the room key from door which cuts all electricity in the room, but then the heating will also be cut off. The hotel staff comes to our room and tried all buttons but they also can’t fix the situation. They also said the system showed that everything in the room is normal. We can’t sleep with that bright “Orange” light, so we need to change the room to sleep every night and go back to our original room in the morning. What’s funny is, the hotel called technicians to fix it for us for a few times but the result is the room is normal every time… we don’t have any explanation until the end of our stay and just bring back a lot of “question marks” with us… maybe we’re unlucky, I don’t know. This is our honeymoon trip, I think this ruined the mood of our honeymoon to a certain extent. I don’t think it is a “budgeted” hotel compare with the rate of similar hotels in Barcelona anyway. I think the “orange light” problem can be fixed easily by simply adding a separate switch to all the lights in the room. Maybe the designer can think more on the users' perspective.

Reviews.Title: “Not a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: traveldog25
Reviews.Content: Why this place gets rave reviews is beyond me. We booked here for 4 nights in a deluxe room back in early December 2007 on the recommendations listed on this web site. There's nothing charming about this hotel except its location. The first night we stayed was a sleepless night with loud noise in the street. The walls are paper thin and heard the TV/Guests yelling in the next room. The bathroom was dirty with hair in sink, toilet needed to be cleaned (found yellow stains on seat) and had to call housekeeping to clean it to our standards. The room size was ok but needed some inprovement in terms of decor & furniture. There was a musty odor the entire stay but the hotel could not change our room because the hotel was booked up. The breakfast was below average and not worth the price. Your better off going to local cafes just steps outside the hotel. The halls in the hotel need improvement and you can smell the same musty odor outside the room. It took over an hour to check with just 4 other people ahead of us. They only had 1 person at check in. Bottom line.. Look at other hotels in Barcelona. We do not recommend staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: RobStockholm
Reviews.Content: We stayed in hotel Soho for two nights in December 2007. We really enjoyed our stay and the hotel standard was super. Especially since the price was quite affordable. The room was cleen and filled with nice details. Staff was friendly and helpful. We can only recommend Soho!

Reviews.Title: “Soho Hotel-Great Staff and Location”
Reviews.Author: eramm
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Soho Hotel in August of this year and had a fantastic experience. I travel to Europe quite frequently and quite a few times I've been surprisingly dissapointed by the hotels I've booked, no air conditioning, small room etc...in summary they were vastly different than their description. This being my first trip to Barcelona I didn't know what to expect. That being said, the Soho was fantastic. It's in a great location about a block from the top of the Ramblas. The hotel is clean, funky and everything works! They have very relaxing rooftop pool, small but refreshing with a garden surrounding it on the roof. They also have computers in a cool lounge and they work. Most of all, I liked the staff. Alessio, is just a great manager. He made us feel like family and even went out to dinner with us at one of his favorite places! You'll never find anyone who will go out of his way like he does. Also, Barcelona is great. It's clean, gorgeous, like a Paris with beaches. Also, ask Oliver for his favorite Tapas bar if you don't want to make tourist mistakes. Overall, great hotel and great staff! Stay here and you won't be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “not as good as reviews”
Reviews.Author: outandabout33
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the soho hotel for 3 nights because it had recieved some v good reviews on this site .. we must admit all the front desk staff were very helpfull and having the metro station right outside the hotel was very convienient also.... on the negative side we found the v busy main road outside the hotel very noisey for much of the day and evening .... and were very surprised a new hotel would not be better noise insulated to help with this problem.. also we found the hotel rooms and corridors very dimly lit which was a little depressing ....

Reviews.Title: “SOHO a tuch of class in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: empire3
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised on how cute and confortable SOHO was. The rooms are so modern and I love the buttons to open and close the blinds in the widows and also, check out those sexy showers. Don't miss the "hot" light button. The property is very clean. The free internet downstairs was much appreciated. The staff was so friendly and willig to assist in any way. Great location and just across the street from the Metro. I can't wait to go back. Thanks SOHO!

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: Naylorius
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a fantastic trip across Europe and looking back at our time spent in Barcelona, the Hotel SOHO was a perfect launching ground for us. I was a little nervous at first to be heading to Europe for the first time, but my worries were laid to rest the moment we arrived at the hotel. The staff all spoke several languages each and were able to make me feel right at home. I was impressed that the front desk attendants were able to speak with me in English, and other guests in French, Spanish, German, and more all at once and in a manner that was warm and welcoming. Our room looked brand new and had all of the ammenities we needed. One of the highlights of the room was that the lights and window blinds were controlable by buttons on the bedside table. There was even a "HOT" button that would automatically dim the lighting and adjust the room to a "hot mood". Every morning we enjoyed complimentary breakfast in the hotel's dining area consisting of assorted cereals, fruits, meats & cheeses, breads, eggs, sausages and more. From the hotel it was very easy to see the city and set out on our tours by foot. Within a couple of blocks we found great historical sites, museums, and fantastic shopping. The hotel's concierge was also a great help in pointing us in the right direction to make sure we saw the most important places on our list. There was also a subway station across the street from the hotel that proved to be a perfect launching ground for our trips to other parts of the city. Barcelona is an amazing city and the Hotel SOHO made our stay all the more memorable, I can't wait to go back again.

Reviews.Title: “avant-garde soho”
Reviews.Author: tushmd
Reviews.Content: Very pleasant suprise. We have stayed at the hip Hudson Hotel in NY many times and this is taking that concept to a much higher level. Great staff, willing to speak English and very supportive. We liked the downstairs lounge with internet access. The breakfast was great and it's important to have a full breakfast before going sight-seeing since the dollar is taking a beating vs the euro. Very centrally located and we walked to Las Ramblas and the central shopping areas in 10 minutes. Good tapas restaurants nearby also. A great small hotel when you are tired of the giants.

Reviews.Title: “SOHO a miss”
Reviews.Author: John013
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the heart of Barcelona, overlooking the Gran Via. The problem is maintenance at this hotel.... The window in my room was CRACKED....a LARGE CRACK The window was jammed and would not open The internal venetian blinds (inside the double glasing) was jammed The external window screen was broken I asked to move to another room this was not possible. I was on the 6th floor (of 8 floors) - I DO NOT RECOMMEND this hotel is you want to sleep !! The road is very busy and the traffic noise is VERY loud all night

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: lemmondd
Reviews.Content: The reservation booking online was simple and efficient, with an easy website in English. The rates changed over the course of the stay, due to a busy National Day weekend. The location in Exiample was great, easy access to the Metro right outside and plenty of great cafes for breakfast, afternoon lunch or tapas. We never even stopped on the 1st floor for the morning breakfast, it was more fun to see what was going on out in the city! The guest room was very contemporary with clean lines, lots of glass and technology for lighting effects, blind control on the windows, etc. The guest room safe is poorly placed inside the closet, hard to see the display. The minibar is simple but gives you a beverage when you want! I liked the aesthetics of the room, but did not love them and for six nights it got a little old. The room we had was on an interior air shaft which did not allow much light into the room (downer with some jetlag from Los Angeles), additionally the sound from the street bounces right up the shaft from the street level ramp which goes to the underground garage. Voices, traffic and the sound of sirens bounced into the room day and night. The free computers on the -1 level were helpful to both my partner and to me over the course of the stay. Be careful and clear the cache of your site visits when you get up, some interesting stuff left on the computers from other users! We checked out the rooftop pool and lounge area and wished for even warmer weather to go for a swim, but took some photos from the roof and moved on. Best asset of this hotel is Oliver at the front desk. His dedication to the help of guests is amazing. I manage a Hotel in Los Angeles and would love to have clones of Oliver at my property. He made a huge difference in our stay. Other staff at the desk were friendly, always offering a Hola! when we came and went, but not much more. Housekeeping was able to fix a problem with our bathroom sink pretty efficiently on day two. There are lots of options in Barcelona to stay, this is a nice hotel with a good location, it was clean and modern. I would be interested in trying other properties on future visits as well, but would recommend SoHo!

Reviews.Title: “Happy we stayed there”
Reviews.Author: Michael060
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel because of the Trip Advisor rating and the because it was seemingly a good value. The room was neat looking and very clean. Our room faced the Gran Via, which was a nice treat. The hotel was a 5-10 minute walk to the Barri Gotic and the Eixample, so really well situated. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: RedKelly
Reviews.Content: I thought this was a great little hotel. The rooms are a good size for a major city and cleverly-designed to make the most of space. The shower was excellent and the bed was very comfortable. I found the staff very friendly and helpful. Also, I thought room service and the minibar were reasonably-priced. Breakfast was really good too. The location was really useful - within 15 minutes we could walk to Las Ramblas, the Barri Gotic, and the Passag de Gracia (where many of the Gaudi buildings are). Also, it's only half a block from a metro station, where the airport bus also sets down. The best bit is probably the rooftop area with a lovely shady deck and a "pool" for cooling off and chilling out (more like a big jacuzzi though - you can't really swim in it). There were a few niggles - the sink and bath didn't drain properly unless we took the plug out. Also the noise from the park outside really intruded in the evening, since all the neighbourhood kids were playing there, very loudly. Thankfully they did all go to bed by the time we wanted to go to bed. But overall, I was really happy with our stay and would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Soho was great !!”
Reviews.Author: ragga8
Reviews.Content: My Partner and i were looking for a Gay Friendly Hotel in Barcelona and after using this website we decided on Hotel Soho and we were not dissapointed whatsoever! When we arrived we were warmly greeted by Allesio at the front desk..he took time to chat to us, ask us where we were from etc and pointed out some of the local attractions to us and even went so far as to show us where to go by using a map.Check in was fast and Simple and they had remembered some of our requests from when we booked the hotel on their website.We had a room with an inside view so wasnt really worth looking through the window, however we didnt mind and the rest of the room more than made up for it. The window blinds are controlled by a panel of switches on each side of the biggest double bed ive ever slept in! The mood lighting is also an interesting feature, again controlled from the same panel as the window blinds. There is a plasma tv with lots and lots of channels (tho a lot of which are in spanish not suprisingly) however there is BBC world etc available.The mini bar was a welcome addition after being out in the heat all day.The mini bottles of Champagne were a nice touch (only one glass in each of the 2 bottles tho!). The Bathroom was ultra - modern with the glass wall seperating it from the rest of the room, however there is blinds which you can close if you wish to (again by touching a button beside the sink! ) . ONE MAJOR FEATURE which i liked about the Soho is that the maids do not knock your door from all hours looking to clean your room...if you put the do not disturb sign on, they will be more than happy to leave your room until you leave, unlike a lot of hotels ive stayed in before. The room service is fast (within 20mins in our case) however the menu is very limited as you will find. We didnt use the downstairs resturant so we cant comment on what the breakfasts etc are like in the hotel. Another lovely part of the Hotel is the Rooftop seating area and plunge pool, its a great place to relax and although the pool is small, its still very nicely furnished etc (check out my photos!)/ All in all i wouldnt hesitate for a second in recommending this hotel particuarly to Gay/Lesbian couples i dont think its suitable for familys due to the layout of the rooms more than anything.All in all its a Trendy (but not 'in your face trendy' ) chilled out Hotel for couples more than anything When we were choosing a place to stay in Barcelona it was the reviews on this website that helped us choose this hotel.So if anyone has any questions about the hotel or visiting Barcelona for the first time please feel free to contact me.

Reviews.Title: “Very Chic”
Reviews.Author: BillyPinky
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay, 10-15 min walk to center of town, close to the metro, very easy to get around. We had a room at the front of the hotel so lots light in the room not to sure if you have a room on the small inner court yard. great big double bed and the biggest pillows. Flat screen TV . air conditioning , it was a great room, every thing a city break hotel is meant to be. The bathroom has glass walls, you can watch telly while you shower. so not for the shy. We had breakfast as well and even the restaurant is ultra chic. In dark woods and the food is good. Stay here that all i want say.
